managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your stay.  We are glad that you liked the staff.  Thank you for taking the time to write.  

Hopefully we will see you again.

review.title: Affordable hotel with hot staff
review.reviewText: I was there for four night with my mom. The hotel especially its staff was good. The location was accessible but I did not like the location. I think it was not clean. I do not its the SF problem or just because it was downtown

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for your stay.  We do hope to see you again in the future.  

Take Care.

Patrick Jackson - Hotel Manager

review.reviewText: We were greeted as we walked in the door.  The staff was helpful and a great example of hospitality.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your stay.  We do have larger rooms here.  The dsuperiors and Suites are quite roomy and I'm sure would have made a difference in your stay.  Thank you for trying us out.  

Patrick Jackson - Hotel Manager

review.title: To small for comfort
review.reviewText: Over all the room hotel was nice but the rooms are very small and having two people it was very crowded.

managementResponses.response: Thank you ginnette for staying with us.  We appreciate your stay and review and hope to see you again in the future.  All the best.

review.title: Great customer service and very convenient
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the heart of Downtown San Francisco and to all the attractions. Their Custome Service is exceptional.

managementResponses.response: Thank you Janet for staying with us.  We hoipe to see you again in the future.  Take Care.  Patrick Jackson - Hotel Manager

review.reviewText: Hotel was in a good location and we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. We left our car parked during our stay. Parking is not at the hotel so it is recommended you call them before you arrive so you can drive to the garage. There is some curbside parking out front but it was full when I arrived.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your stay John.  Thanks for your stay with us.  I never really did get why there were conflicting doors made when this hotel was built either.  Thanks for your stay and try a larger room next time.  I'm sure you will be more comfortable.  Thanks.

review.reviewText: Convenient and price was right. Room barely fits one bed and one of the closet doors opens to the bathroom!

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your stay with us.  We are glad you liked the location and found the check-in easy.  Please come see us again.

review.title: Very Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: Great downtown location within walking distance to Union Square, Ferry Building, North Beach, Financial District, China Town, etc.  Parking lot one block away on Clay St. and was only $25 for the night (as compared to $50 I've spent using North Beach garages).  Small room, but very clean and safe.  Reasonably priced.  Very easy check-in using a kiosk assisted by hotel staff.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your stay.  We are excited you had a good stay with us.

review.reviewText: The staff was great and very attentive! Overall great stay!

managementResponses.response: Thank you Shredwin for your stay and comments.  We hope to see you again in the future.  Take care.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great hotel with one of the best locations because it's in a very safe area of the city. This hotel has an amazing roof top patio with an amazing downtown scenery.

managementResponses.response: Thank you Ashley for your stay and review.  We are excited that you had a comfortable stay and found the benefits of the hotels location.  Good advice for those wondering if they need a car in SF.  It makes more sense to use public transposition.  Thank you again and we hope to see you in the future.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the BART
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel. Friendly staff, nice room, comfortable bed. Good location too (near the Embarcado stop for BART). We booked this on Expedia and it exceeded our expectations. One thing to note is in and out parking is $36 + tax per day so we decided to just turn in the rental car early and take BART. Also, the room is sort of small but comfortable for two people. I didn't feel cramped or anything but it was not as spacious as other hotels. Overall, I'd come back and stay again though!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your stay.  There are bottles water stations in the guest corridors that are complimentary to our guests on floors 2-8 by the elevators.  The bottles are provided and guest have unlimited use.  I'm sorry that you did not find them.

review.title: No bottled water in the room!
review.reviewText: No bottled water in the room, not even in the fridge...

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your stay.  I'm happy that you liked the restaurant.  I will share your comments with them.  I don't know which room you stayed in, but we have four sizes of rooms.  The Superiors and Suites are much larger than the Club or Standard sizes.  Hopefully we have have you stay with nus again in a larger room.  

Thank you again.

review.reviewText: Not a huge room but for being where it was at a good price I can't complain. Fish and Farm next door is really where I had my best time. : )

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your stay with us.  We appreciate you taking the time to review us on Expedia.  PLease note that we do have larger rooms.  I would suggest a Superior or Suite next time as they are good sized rooms.

review.reviewText: My room was too small. If you're not claustrophobic you'll be fine for a weekend stay. The price was right, and the location was great. This hotel is located in a central location with many sites, restaurants and shopping nearby.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying with us Reid and for reviewing us on Expedia.  We certainly do hope to see you again in the future.  All the best.

review.title: Great for business - a nice work lounge downstairs
review.reviewText:
Overall, it was a comfortable hotel, awesome restaurant below - with an area that makes getting work done easy. 
I come to SF for work a lot, I will likely come back.

review.title: Very rude staff, not helpful at all.
review.reviewText: Not good! Staff was very rude. I deserve a full refund! They made are staying unwelcome.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to complete the Booking.com guest survey. I am so delighted to see that you enjoyed your stay with us here at Club Quarters, and that our entire staff was able to provide you with attentive and friendly service.

If you have an extra moment and would like to help be a part of our property's continued success, we would love your feedback from this stay at www.tripadvisor.com!

I truly appreciate your continued patronage of Club Quarters Hotels, and I am looking forward to welcoming you back in the future.  

Kind regards,

Patrick Jackson - Hotel Manager

review.reviewText: This was our second stay in a Club Quarters Hotel, the first being in their New York Central Station outpost. Although for us it does not score as highly as Central Station we were more than happy with our room and the hotel in general. The staff were all polite and attentive and more than happy to help when required. Really good location for exploring San Francisco with Chinatown, Little Italy, Union Square within close walking distance. I would recommend this chain of hotels to anyone and would certainly use them again as I could trust there to be a high standard.

Great location but very noisy. The walls were thin and one side of the building is against an alley way.
Rooms are small but clean. Nice amenity to have coffee and water supplied. Housekeeping kept forgetting there were 2 people staying in the room and did not supply enough towels.

review.title: Good, central location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed staying here- the location was very central and felt safe. Reasonably priced parking garage across the street. Staff were friendly and helpful. Self check-in and check-out was easy and efficient. The only con was that the room was on the small side, but we hardly spent any time there, so it wasn't a big deal for us.

Great location
And staff is very nice
I like the room

review.title: Good choice in Financial District
review.reviewText: It was a great experience except that you have to pay 34 dollars per night for parking and there is no cheaper way in financial district. The rooms are a little bit smaller than I expected because of its location. However it is very safe and urban.  Youngsters will love it. It's location is close to Lombart stress my and Golden Gate Bridge. Will stay again !

review.title: old hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine but dated and old. It seemed more like a building that was originally apartments. It felt like a college dorm. Nowhere near a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Not far from Golden Gate Bridge
review.reviewText: Regular room was too small and we had to upgrade it by paying $25.
review.positiveRemarks: Availability of water, soft drinks, Coffee, and nibbles all day in the lobby.

review.title: Quick Trip to the City
review.reviewText: I went to SF to meet with an old friend for the day. The hotel was centrally located for all of my needs including transportation, coffee, food, and activities. The hotel was designed for business people so amenities included Wifi and access to office machines (copier, fax, computer, etc), perfect for my daughter taking summer college courses. Overall, the room was small but comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly and helpful. The location allowed me to walk to wherever I needed to go or had easy access to transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: The in room coffee could be better.
review.locationRemarks: The location was in the financial district. The hotel was within walking distance to China Town, The Ferry Building, a park, shopping, and restaurants

review.title: Better than most chain hotels.
review.reviewText: I was a bit reluctant to stay at any downtown hotel that was not a chain hotel, but I followed previous reviews about this hotel (CQ) and they were very accurate. Very centrally located to all SF tourist destinations. EZ walk to ferry bldg, BART station, trolley, wharf and piers 33 & 39, and Chinatown. You can also catch the 'BigBus' tour across the street too. Of course, there was a Starbucks in the same building so that was a 'bonus' for the wife. The hotel was always very clean. It was never too busy that you couldn't get an elevator, though, the key car feature for the elevators needs some improvement; most people had difficulty with it, including us. Rooms are a all bit small, so I would recommend you upgrade to the 'suite' like we did if you can. All in all a fantastic hotel and we would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was always very friendly and responsive, the hotel was very centrally located to all of the normal San Francisco tourist destinations.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators required your room key to go up and most people, including us, had trouble with that.
review.locationRemarks: Very centrally located to all SF tourist destinations. EZ walk to ferry bldg, BART station, trolley, wharf and piers 33 & 39, and Chinatown.

review.reviewText: Great room, good location... would stay there again!

review.title: Great hotel, close to the pier and market.
review.reviewText: Got to check in early, everyone was friendly, great location

review.title: Great location for business travelers
review.reviewText: I stayed overnight and appreciated how the hotel makes it easy for business travelers to stay. Wifi was good, large shower (no bath, FYI), quiet room, and great location kitty corner from the Embarcadero Center. It's several minutes walk from BART. I'd happily stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was somewhat small, but to be expected given the location.
review.locationRemarks: The area is ideal for people doing business in the financial district.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very clean.  The only problem, I could hear my neighbor very well.  Had to change rooms.  The staff was very accommodating, she gave me a much nicer room.  I slept very well. I will stay there again.  The price was very affordable.

review.title: Lisa does it right by the bay
review.reviewText: We stayed very last minute and were pleasantly impress wirh the location and the ease to check on and out, they also made it vey easy to find where to park and held our luggage for the day

review.title: Handy location
review.reviewText: Overall good. Bit disappointed it's the hipster dude who checked us in. Told us nothing about the facilities and rushed us through.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown , handy to Embarcadero.

review.title: High price for not much
review.reviewText: You have to park your car in a garage that costs $34.00 daily that down the street and around the corner from the hotel. The hotel has a small front so you really have to look hard to find it. It's on a one way street which means you have to go all the way around if you miss it. There is no complimentary ice nor breakfast. There is water with bottles available. No trash cans outside the rooms so you have to leave your trash in the rooms for the cleaners to get. Bathrooms are small but fine. Mirror is nice. Bed are acceptable. I wouldn't come back due to the price for one night for what you get. If the parking was closer or at the hotel it wouldn't have been so bad.

Requested a room with a king bed. What I got was a bed that was 2 twins put together to make a king...yes it's true. One mattress was lower than the other. Unfortunately we did not find this out until late that evening.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing. I would stay elsewhere if I stayed overnight in San Francisco again.
review.negativeRemarks: Considering the prices that were charged for my stay and that was discounted, I don't believe the hotel is worth the value they are charging.
review.locationRemarks: The location was nice though at night the area seems a little dicey. Lots of street people roaming around.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: We  had two rooms and the rug was stained in both.  The sofa is the second room was also stained and it was old and shabby.  The counter near the coffee maker was also stained.  There was a loud demonstration across the street at another hotel that woke us up with bull horns and I understand this is a regular occurrence often occurring before 7am.  Would not stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: They could clean or replace the carpets and worn out furniture.  They should inform guests about the continuing demonstrations across the street.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Close to a lot of things to do. China town ,att park,north beach, ferry building, union square all within walking distance.

review.title: Basic Hotel
review.reviewText:
We picked this hotel because of the location and because there was a sale on Expedia.  This was our first time staying in San Francisco so I'm not sure how this hotel rates against others of the same price.  

Overall it met our needs and I would recommend the hotel.  Not sure if I would re-book again without it being on sale though!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean, staff was very friendly and helpful.  Whenever we asked where something is they were more than happy to help us and even look things
review.negativeRemarks: Room was very tiny, no bathtub in the bathroom, no refrigerator in the room which was a big con since my husband is diabetic and needs somewhere
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located in the financial district which was a 15 minute train ride from fisherman's wharf. It's close to a lot of restaurants.

review.title: Nice for SF, but beware checking in early
review.reviewText:
Club Quarters is a small hotel in the Financial District of San Francisco.  Small, but nice lobby with secure elevators and a coffee lounge with apple desktop computers.  Room was very small, but not surprising for SF...queen sized bed with just enough space to walk around it and a stand-up shower stall, no tub.  Our room faced the road and it was quite noisy during the business day, but was quiet at night (no night life in this part of town).
The biggest negative for us was we showed up early expecting to have to stow our luggage to wait for check-in time.  They said our room was ready, which was great!  However, after getting back home, I saw that Club Quarters charged us an extra $60 for checking in early.  No mention of this charge was made at any point during our stay (though if you look at their website, they do mention a charge for this buried in their FAQ page).  Had we known this, we would have waited another half hour and we wouldn't have been billed for this.
review.negativeRemarks: If you're going to bill customers for something, let them know so they can decide whether they want that additional service.
review.locationRemarks: The BART station is about a 3 block walk.  That will take you to the things to do.

review.title: Nice hotel in the financial district
review.reviewText: I found the lobby to be quite small considering it is a 4 star hotel. Parking is off-site which made it annoying to bring in our luggage. Apart from that, rooms are great, quiet. We were there over the weekend and since we were in the financial district, all restaurants were closed for breakfast. Walking distance to shore and public transport.

review.title: Great central location in Financial District.
review.reviewText: Only downside was proximity to local Fire Station, so the sound of sirens was relatively frequent. Hotel lounge was a great facility especially to keep up with the political developments at the time & with good coffee & snacks available gratis. However snacks were not provided Fri- Sun, which was a shame as we stayed Tues-Tues. The restaurant next door served good food & had an excellent bar with plenty of IPA on tap. The locality seemed safe enough at night - we walked back from bars & restaurants in the Italian quarter with no problems. Would stay here again.

review.title: convenient lodging
review.reviewText: We chose this property because of its price, but also found it to be convenient with numerous restaurants bars and shopping venues close at hand.  Street parking, although plentiful is unduly regulated, making it nearly impossible to use overnight! local parking garage is $35 per night.

review.title: A few minute walk to piers.
review.reviewText: It was a comfortable stay. They recommended a parking garage a block away. It was very easy to find as it was around the corner and it was very reasonably priced at $34 for 24 hours.  We had a light dinner and drinks at the attached pub. It was nice not having to worry about a long walk back to the hotel. The only thing I missed here was having a fridge in the room. The description said there were available for $25 but I wasn't going to pay that just to keep our sodas cold.

review.title: Very convenient hotel in financial district.
review.reviewText: No frills, small rooms, no pretension, but everything one really needs.  Functional, efficient, free Wifi, decent restaurant next door and three coffee shops on the block.
review.positiveRemarks: Efficient and functional.  Easy in and out.  Perfect location for running on Embarcadero and doing business in the financial district.
review.locationRemarks: Extremely central, near restaurants, coffee shops, waterfront.

review.title: horrible
review.reviewText: I felt cheated by EXpedia stating it is 4 star.  This hotel does not meet the 4 star standard as Le Meridien as stated when purchased.

review.title: good hotel for that price in SF DT
review.reviewText: Hotel was good, room was very small, have common laundry, ironing, water facility
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom was wierd
review.locationRemarks: good food, and bars

review.reviewText: Great place and location. Easy to walk to many nearby places. The rooms and beds are small yet cozy. Nice staff. Quick and easy check in/ out.

review.title: Super nice
review.reviewText: Although there's no parking on site the friendly staff made it easy to find parking.  The view was awesome too.

review.title: Closet Quarters
review.reviewText: This is a no frills hotel with drab furnishings in cramped rooms.  There is definitely a place for these types of hotels, however, this is not nearly a four star hotel worth the price.  The location is convenient and that is what you are paying for.

review.title: Nice hotel in Financial District downtown.
review.reviewText: Wonderful place to stay. Tom was the most helpful person. Gave us great information and directions. Safe place to stay. Would highly recommend staying here.

review.title: A night away in the city
review.reviewText: Loved being so close to everything. Food at restaurant was fabulous!!

review.title: Great location & great staff!
review.reviewText: I stay here quite often and never have a complaint. The Club Quarters in New York near Wall Street is an excellent choice, also.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at club quarters. The location was great, a short walk to fisherman's warf. The public parking was nice, just a little inconvenient to with my bags down the street. The rooms are small but not unmanageable especially if you are planning to be out and about during your stay. Overall I had a good experience and would recommend for a short stay.

review.title: Good location, small rooms
review.reviewText:
Our room was very small.  The queen bed felt more like a full size single.  The closet and bathroom doors could crash against each other due to size limitations.  There was no robes, no iron, ironing board etc.  Decor looked tired.  

Checkin seemed cumbersome with automatic kiosks that didn't work properly.  This self service approach removed the personal touch you expect when checking in.  

About the best thing with this hotel has gong for it is the location to Embarcadero, waterfront areas etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the check in system.
review.locationRemarks: Waterfront is just 3 blocks away.  The Embercadero center is across the street.  Parking overnight is convenient.

review.title: Blocks away from the Bay Bridge
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to San Fran and my overall experience with the hotel staff was good. They were extremely helpful. I did not like the cleanliness of my hotel when I first checked in but I spoke to Tom at the front desk and he immediately had a housekeeper clean my room. They answered all my questions and were willing to go the extra mile. The room was kind of small but I stayed their alone so it worked out. Everyone was extremely friendly and I wouldn't mind staying there again.

review.title: Great location that's pretty much it.
review.reviewText: Had nearly zero interaction with staff including checking in and out. Room was a bit dated. Overall the actual experience was somewhat less than my expectations from the booking on expedia. Not to mention the promoted price on expedia with member discount applied was still more expensive than on Google. The location was great as billed though.

review.title: Great little hotel!
review.reviewText: It's not a fancy hotel, but it's very nice and clean in a great location. Just what I needed on this trip! Will return again.

review.title: Nice hotel, bad parking situation
review.reviewText:
Reservation room information was different than room received. Had to upgrade for additional charge. Parking wasn't adequate for handicap and staff wasn't compassionate regarding that need. Paying $34 in a non-secured, no accessible stall, city parking structure is not acceptable.
An hour later, finally in a satisfactory room (recommend a suite minimum for space) and forced to leave my car a block away, we began our weekend in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco, busy downtown, great museums

review.title: noisy downtown lication
review.reviewText: even with hotel security that requires a room key to use elevator. our neighbors had a party with a minimum of 12 people that lasted all night long.

review.title: Great location and facilities
review.reviewText: Everything was great. Has all the extras included and really friendly staff

review.title: overall nice
review.reviewText: parking is tricky and room was relatively small but that's what you expect in SF downtown. Perfect lobby and service. I would totally recommend it. Suggestion: can I have more tea bags?
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby and service are quite good.
review.negativeRemarks: more supplies... kind of need body lotion and more towels

review.title: Great location, decent hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel ideally located in financial district, a short walk from many of the major sights of SF, and lots of great restaurants. 

Rooms are comfortable but not especially luxurious. Definitely aimed more at the business traveller rather than at the romantic/boutique market.

review.title: We loved the hotel and the location
review.reviewText: We had about 30 hours to be in and around the heart of San Francisco, and wanted to be able to walk the Embarcadero and Fisherman's Wharf. Did both, in beautiful weather. We thought the hotel was excellent for the price. Very European. Comfy bedding, quiet halls and no sound from other rooms. The rooms are small but so what? Internet was good and having refillable water bottles and filtered water was great. Would definitely stay here again on another trip.

review.title: Location is good, but room is so-so
review.reviewText: There was hair on sheet and smell on pillow. I had to switch to different room. The room is very small too. Hopefully it was just one-room issue.

review.title: Once was enough
review.reviewText: We reserved 2 rooms one was fine but the other did not have all the supplies in the room and the comforter on top of the bed was NASTY it had stains all over it and as soon as I open the room door I went down stairs to request a clean one. I requested a new room but we were told that they didn't have any. They offered complementary sparkling water but the machine was broken. The help was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning the rooms better making sure they are stocked with supplies and washing the linens.
review.locationRemarks: Up from the ferry building

photos.caption: no sanitary wrapping and in the bathroom.

review.title: Looked nice!
review.reviewText:
First of all the hotel staff was very nice.
Next, the king size bed was 2 twin mattresses not one solid mattress. They were uneven, as if my sleep number bed was set on 95 one one side and 10 on the other. 
An empty water bottle was missed by house keeping - under the bed.

review.title: Convenient superior hotel to CBD and Embarcadero
review.reviewText: Comfortable, clean and modern hotel for a quick business trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Great location and great hotel
review.reviewText: If I come back to San Fran, this is the hotel I'd pick...

review.title: Distinctly Average in comparison to others
review.reviewText: In Comparison to other hotels of a similar price in this area I would not consider returning to CQ

review.title: Convenient location, clean room, comfortable bed.
review.reviewText: Great location for our conference Mostly pleasant. Our check in person was rude, all others were great. Shower head was broken, one towel and one coffee for 2 people.

review.title: European style hotel in SF
review.reviewText: This hotel is fine, not quite 4 stars but it works.  I think 4 Stars is a very nice hotel, this was decent.  The room I had (maybe not all rooms) was just really small.  Maybe 175 SQ Ft.  There was just little space.  Not sure if all rooms are that small, but it was noticeably small.   The meeting rooms in the basement looked nice.  There is a nice restaurant/bar adjacent to the hotel which was good.
review.positiveRemarks: Location right near Embarcadero 1 was very good.  The room was relatively quiet.  There is a lounge type area where you can have coffee - it was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The room I had was small, the bed was just so-so comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: In the Financial District, Caddy Corner from Embarcadero 1, across the street from Le Meridien.  5-7 minute walk from BART (Embarcadero).

review.title: Not as nice as the price would suggest
review.reviewText: This hotel was only adequate. After shelling out $400 per night plus $64 in taxes, I expected luxury. The room was very spare, about what I would expect from a $100 per night hotel in a major city. Absolutely underwhelming. No room service (though local restaurants would deliver). Very dated, cheap furniture in below average condition. I would not stay here again nor would I recommend it.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs major updating: carpet, furniture, amenities. Everything looks very cheap.

review.title: The hotel location was great
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great, with in walking distance to the Ferry Building and Restaurants. There were just a few things that could have been better. There are no ice machines anywhere in the hotel & there was a used coffee pod in the coffee maker. There is a restaurant Bar connected to the hotel and the service was really bad. The staff did not acknowledge us when we walked in. They walked right by our table without even a look. We were sitting there for a good 30 minutes until my husband walked up to the bar to get a beer. The bartender was too busy with a group of very loud women. There was a child behind the bar with one of the bartenders getting a soda. We ended up leaving and and going across the street to another hotel. I know this review is about the hotel but the room service you get comes from Fish & Farm, the restaurant that is connected to the hotel.

review.title: Very disappointing
review.reviewText:
If this hotel was in a developing country, it would be wonderful, but it was not up to standards for a business hotel in San Francisco. My room was extremely small with poor use of what little space there was. The sheets were scratchy. I guess that the air conditioning didn't work efficiently because the room temperature kept returning to 77 degrees. 

I tried to print a document in the Club Living Room, but the printer was low on toner. When I asked for help, the front desk clerk told me that it wasn't her job to replace the toner cartridge and implied that I was just too picky if I didn't want to use a virtually unreadable light gray copy instead of reprinting with new toner. Since it was a very important business document that I had to have a perfect copy of by the next day, I insisted on reprinting. After I emailed her the document, it took three tries to find a printer that didn't need a new cartridge. Each time she complained bitterly that I was expecting to much if I wanted the document to be in uniform print.

Overall, I was very disappointed with this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was close to where I needed to be.
review.negativeRemarks: Business services. Staff attitudes.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel good location good stuff.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel. hhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh

review.title: Excellent, close to amenities & public transport
review.reviewText: Room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Many items provided upon request.

review.title: Overall it was OK first time to San Francisco exp
review.reviewText: First time to San Francisco not sure what to expect I was kind of shocked the size of the room there was a Male concierge who is very helpful did not grab his name to other females that were there were not helpful overall experience I'd say rate between three and four

review.title: Not a 4 star hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was fine but nor very welcoming. The rooms are very small. Bathroom door have no locks. We purchased what was supposed to be a king bed but we got a two small beds put together (literary) and the bed was very noisy, not very soft and lack of pillows. The only two nice things about the hotel are decent view from the roof access and the lobby had good self serve coffee maker. I do want to add that the fireplace in the lobby is one of the worst, cheap and unrealistic fireplace I have ever seen. Do not get tricked by location of the resort, as every building is within 1 mile (literary). I am dissapointed that Expedia sold me a 4 star hotel just to find out its more of a 2 to maybe 3 star hotel. Again boring, plain, simple, super small TV, no bathroom lock, not real king beds, small windows, thin walls and absolutely dissapointing hotel. I wanted to buy my wife a nice 4 star hotel and enjoy the hotel as much as the city, but honestly definetly ruined my trip a bit, and Expedia.com  had a final sale, no cancellation, so we were stuck with it. Stay away, oh and our 3 day stay cost us 130 in parking fees (just a heads up)

review.title: Financial District Hotel
review.reviewText:
Nice, clean hotel in downtown SF. 
Had mixed experience w/ front staff ... 1 youngish guy was fabulous. Two females were off-putting ... felt I was interrupting their work/routine.
Daily parking rate ($37)( for unlimited in/out) was OUTRAGEOUS.
Insufficient supply of free newspaper ( WSJ ?) because in 3 days I never got one.
Complimentary bkfst food ( fruit, bars, etc. ) were unavailable between 6-6:30 am.  Unacceptable. The coffee was available early.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable. Rooms very clean.
review.negativeRemarks:
Personality & helpfulness of front staff.
Parking rate.
Availability ( timing) of complimentary breakfast food.
Availability of free newspaper.

review.title: great little find for a quick stopover in San Fran
review.reviewText: compact and bijou place in the heart of the Financial District. Exactly as advertised - no bells and whistles but the complimentary water is a nice touch. Lovely lounge area for late night TV watching and coffee. Staff are very friendly and professional. Great place. Will be going back. And just around the corner from the best pub in SF, The Irish Times.
review.negativeRemarks: I always like a spa suite, so perhaps a jacuzzi/steam room area
review.locationRemarks: Right over the road from the Embarcadero mall/cinema and plenty of great places nearby. Starbucks on the corner, The Irish Times pub a block away...

review.title: Close to Chinatown, convent and quiet
review.reviewText: Most staff were very nice and helpful, one young lady was very rude on two separate occasions.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Very close to piers. Clean rooms and friendly staff.  Comfortable.

review.title: Decent Hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The rooms are pretty small, similar to a deluxe cruise ship room.  The shower head was broken and only aimed down.  It was also frustrating to find out they they only stock the rooms with one wash cloth after I was already in the shower looking for the second towel.  The remote control was also nasty.  Get the new clean remotes that motel use.
review.negativeRemarks: Stock the rooms with at least two seats of towels.  Use the "Clean Remotes", get rid of the old nasty remotes.
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent.

review.title: Very clean, modern hotel.
review.reviewText: Very up kept hotel and the guest services were very nice and welcoming. In the financial district, it was very difficult to find parking and the parking that the hotel offered charged 34 dollars for overnight. Besides that it was a very pleasant experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Free parking
review.locationRemarks: Pier 33 is about 5 minutes away

review.reviewText: I had to request  room change because first room was dirty and had a horrible odor. Secondly I had to wait 20 min for staff to bring up room key and accommodate my family with a new room.... staff was extremely rude and offered no apology for inconvenience. In addition , they had no rooms with 2 beds. .. my family slept on a rundown pullout sofa. Wouldn't recommend  this place at all, nor will I return.

review.title: Nice stay. Good location!
review.reviewText: Easy to wander around if you like dowtown areas. Piers are 10-15 minutes walk. This hotel has a relatively high speed (free) wifi internet. Bottled water is also complimentary, which is pretty generous (given that SF area experiences water shortage). However, room is relatively small if you want to fit more than 2 persons in a standard room. The good thing in the room though is that there is a microwave and the charging outlet specifically for smartphones (you can charge up to 2 phones at a time). Overall, I like the hotel service.
Terrible., not comfortable room and you have to pay for parking 34$

review.title: San Francisco Getaway...
review.reviewText: A Little Long But Worth Reading...My husband and I took our first trip to San Francisco on Amtrak...What a Great Ride!  Our hotel was only five blocks from our drop off point.  The Club Quarters is a very clean, comfortable hotel with very pleasant staff and even has a sun deck on the roof.  It is walking distance to the Embarcadero, Union Square, China Town and North Beach.  Since we had no car, it was very convenient to get to several key tourist areas.  It also has a very nice sitting area where you can watch TV, read a book, have coffee or just relax.  The Fish & Farm Restaurant is connected and has great food and drinks...Fabulous Happy Hour Daily from 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm.  Something I have never seen before in a hotel...each floor has a built in section where they have water bottles and purified chilled water free of charge.  It is stocked at all times...Awesome!  My husband and I are already planning our next trip.  You will not be disappointed staying at CLUB QUARTERS!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything...As mentioned in my experience section.

review.title: close to transportation
review.reviewText: Close to Embarcadero, thus to BART, streetcars, even cable cars; helpful staff, good rooms; leave the car at home, if possible--$34/day to park, no in & out;
review.negativeRemarks: No one seemed to be in charge of re-filling the breakfast or afternoon snack stuff on holidays/weekends--sometimes ran out;

review.reviewText: The room is a little small but it was cozy and nice. The location was good. It was close to Chinatown and the shopping streets and embarcadero center. About 30-40 minutes away from Berkeley and 10-20 minutes from Oakland!
Nice hotel in the middle of downtown. Close to the Ferry building. Rooms are quaint and well supplied, exactly what you'd expect from a boutique hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking. Even in front of the hotel to drop off your bags is hard. I wish they could have a garage or collaborate with one Downtown to service clients
review.locationRemarks: Ferry Building, Downtown San Fran, bars, art galleries, smoke shops and great food.

review.title: Central location, attractive price
review.reviewText:
The hotel has an attractive pricing compared to other hotels in the area. The location is very good.

The room is aging but not completely run down, the overall comfort level is low. Some nice facilities like drinking water fountain and USB charging and nice internet. Useful for a business traveller.

review.title: Not for the weekend.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the financial district so the neighborhood is closed on the weekend. The largest impact is on garage parking since the garages in the area either close completely or at 1:00 am.

review.title: Unexpected amenities in a less touristy area.
review.reviewText: Liked the free bottled water and Directv. Could have done without the sand flys arriving via the bathroom sink. It was quiet,  comfy and met expectations.

review.title: No view but remodeled.
review.reviewText:
Small hotel, very clean, looked newly remodeled, directly next to resturaunt. Room had two small beds pushed together to make a king size bed but was still comfortable. Had a direct view of the people in the room across from us but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway so it wasn't a big deal. 
Would've loved to have had free breakfast included in the stay. Would stay there again.

review.title: Barely ADA
review.reviewText: We reserved a room for my friend in a wheelchair and arrived to find this room to not have an adequate shower nor space in the room. The staff was very nice in helping us relocate but this was a hassle. The location is good and the rooms clean albeit small. No safe in the room also not a good thing.
review.negativeRemarks: Improved ADA rooms and added safe to room.
review.locationRemarks: Financial District is the only place I like to stay....

review.title: Excellent location, great staff
review.reviewText: Location is very good; staff are very accommodating. Rooms may need some updating.
The bedside table tops were dusty.  The room floor was not swept thoughly.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Much more than I usually spend but going rate for San Francisco.  Location great for walking to Embarcadero, Market Street.  Very nice staff.  Mattress very soft, hard to get comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was helpful, knowledgeable, personable and efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: Mattress too soft, only one set of towels when there were 2 of us, asked for a second set but they only gave us another set once and we stayed 3 days
review.locationRemarks: Financial district near Transamerica Tower, easy walk to Embarcadero and Market Street, adjacent to Chinatown.

review.reviewText: Nice stay overall. Front desk lacked training. Really liked the chilled water bottle in each of the floors, Keurig coffee. The rooms were small but the bathroom was quite spacious.

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText: We spent $354 on a room with a queen size bed that was actually a full size. The room was very small and our view was of an alley with a homeless person sleeping in it. Way overpriced but that's how we felt about San Francisco in general.

review.title: Nice hotel and close to downtown
review.reviewText: The location was great I was staying there for Halloween Weekend and I had friends coming to visit and the hotel immediately upgraded me to their spacious suites for free. Out of all my hotel experiences through Expedia by far this was my best hands down. Courtney at the front desk was very welcoming and had great customer service. The hotel was in walking distance as well to many close bars. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and will be booking again .

review.title: Efficacity!
review.reviewText: Hotel without pretense but extremely efficient. Check in and check out very fast. Really new approach to Hotel services. Wellington located and clean. Parking around the corner. Loved it!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and friendly, would stay there again.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Room was very clean , the staff was amazing but unfortunately the restroom was clog up several times it was annoying

review.title: Close to everything we needed.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time. The hotel was perfect. It was close to the Bart station and a short cab distance to Union Square. Was not a far walking distancw either if you prefer that.

review.title: Nice Central HQ
review.reviewText:
First time at CQ, but liked it a lot.  Great people, location with easy access to Embarcadero and waterfront.  European style to me, smaller rooms, and narrow hallways.  Just fine with us.  Liked the water bottle filler.  Nice club room with snacks and drinks.  

Unfortunately, there was a union protest across the street at Le Meridian, so from 7-8am there was loud chanting.  Not our hotels issue, but still impacted us.

Urban hotel, so street noises were always present.  Expected, not really a problem.

review.title: Club Q
review.reviewText: Not as close to tourist stuff like Wharf,Union Square but still great location walking distance to alot of restaurants and bars. Friendly staff,nice rooms. Microwave,refrigerator and filtered water for guests to refill there own containers.
Don't bother choosing a room type. You wont get what you paid for. I paid for a suite and got a king bed.

review.title: Nice hotel well suited for mid town San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Used as a stop over for tour of California 

Found hotel easily.   Only downside as it's in the financial district limited food places open in general over the  weekend or early mornings very limited if you have an early check out and start

Hotel itself very nice.  Clean tidy and friendly helpful staff

review.title: Very small room, not as clean as I would like
review.reviewText: The room was very small.  There were a few amenities lacking such as Kleenex.  It was very quiet which was a plus especially for a room on the 4th floor.
review.negativeRemarks: One of the check-in screens was down so check-in and out was slow.

review.title: Oct 2 - 4, 2015
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed at Club Quarters Oct 2 -5, 2015.    We were in town for the NFL football game and we did a little sightseeing.  The hotel is in a good location with easy access to the F-line streetcars that run along the Embarcadero.  It's a 4 block walk down Clay to the Embarcadero and the Ferry Building, while it's also a 4 block walk along Battery to Market St.  I didn't notice any parking.  Clay is a very busy street and there isn't a driveway for the hotel.
They have an electronic check-in system which was very easy.  Brochures and maps are available in the lobby and there are further resources including computer terminals and printers for travellers in the adjoining club room.  We had requested a room with a balcony but this hotel does not have balconies.  However, we were given room 1105 which had easy access to the sun deck off the 11th floor.
Our room was fitted out with a kitchenette including stove, microwave, mini fridge and coffee maker.  We had a queen bed with pillow-top mattress and premium linens which was very comfortable.  The room was a little smaller than expected and not very well laid out.  The TV was kind of stuck in the middle of the room.  There were chairs and a couch that probably was a pull out bed.  There was no tub in the bathroom.  The free WiFi signal was strong and very fast.  Generally the room was very clean and modern looking and we were very satisfied.  However, on the last day of our stay, we returned to find that housekeeping had l

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Room was a little small, but overall we arrived in San Francisco early on check in day and hotel staff allowed us to check in early. Very nice, quiet and very clean!

review.title: Great location!  Great staff!  Nice touches.
review.reviewText: Would stay here again.  Check in and check out were a breeze. Complementary water bottle machine was a cool touch. Espresso machine in the lounge was also nice. Good environment. Not a large space, but a nice one.
Rooms are small and very basic; great location and lots of amenities on site. Not luxurious but not a bad place to stay at all

review.title: Definitely NOT a 2 bedroom suite...
review.reviewText:
We were traveling with another couple and to keep costs down decided to share a 2 bedroom suite -- which is what we were told this was, but it was not. It was a 1 bed off to the side and a love seat/hide a bed. When we got over the initial shock, we called down for a cot and were told that was against fire regulations, but they did change their minds when we mentioned that we booked a 2 bedroom suite and there were 4 of us in the room. Fortunately, our friendships lasted  4 nights in the tight quarters :) Talking to other guests, the name 'Cozy Quarters' came up a few times!

After the initial disappointment with our room we really did enjoy the hotel. The staff were quite accommodating, bringing extra towels and blankets. There is complimentary distilled water on each floor. We could see the Ferry Terminal Building from our room -- it was close to everything -- the harbour, cable car, Chinatown, AT&T Park. We were able to take the BART from the airport. It's a $7 cab ride to Fishermans's Wharf. Cabs line up across the street, so it was always easy to get one. 

We wouldn't recommend using the restaurant attached to the hotel, breakfast was slow and rather costly (we ended up going to the Subway around the corner or Starbucks on the corner) and when we went for drinks one night the drinks were terrible, as was the service. One of the drinks came with a fly and we were never asked if we wanted a second drink...
review.negativeRemarks: Don't advertise it as a 2 bedroom suite -- it's not!
review.locationRemarks: Great location -- Chinatown, California Line Cable Car, the Ferry Building, ball park, BART...

review.reviewText: great location; small but adequate rooms; excellent business amenities and work areas; coffee and snacks were a nice plus

review.title: Convenient, priced well, Bathroom reeked of bleach
review.reviewText: Good location and staff was helpful with computerized check in. Bed wasn't the best but okay. Room was small but well laid out. Bath reeked of bleach and there was no exhaust fan to get rid of the smell. Had to spray down walls with shower head to get rid of the smell. I felt bad about doing that given the water shortage.

review.title: Spartan but comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: As part of a chain of clubs this is not your standard hotel but they made the stay very comfortable. No real lobby or bar but very convenient for my needs - easy check-in and check-out, great location. Also I had a payment issue and the manager was extremely responsive.

review.title: Extremely small room for the money
review.reviewText: Very small room. Staff was great. Concierge was excellent. Location was good.

review.title: Couples first time to SF
review.reviewText: We have a great stay. The check-in and out was a breeze. Staffs where friendly. The room was clean and comfy. The only downside is because they don't have parking space we have to pay for an extra $34 per day in the closest parking space, just a cross of the street. Can safely recommend the hotel to all.

It's nice I would stay there again because all the city transportation is all around you. And it's one short block from the transAmerican building so you always have a land mark. It's flat there. No hills . A Starbucks and Subway is on the corner movie theater across the street BART is a couple blocks easy bus to Bart. But we walked. the Ferry building is a couple blocks easy walk great location. The bed was good the air was cold and the shower were hot,and noise always was a minimum considering you're in the city.They do put out snacks in the morning they do put out lunch snacks and drinks they have fresh water bottles for water to take on your day trips. They have wifi and computer with printer to use.So my wife and I was very pleased . Staff are great and helpful. Ether a bus or cable car are working all four corners so moving around the city in a brez .

review.title: Impressive entrance, disappointing hotel
review.reviewText: The entrance looks grand and at first it's intriguing to stay in an historic hotel. But the hotel as a whole, including my room, needs paint, wallpaper, lighting, carpeting, furniture, etc updates for it to be considered a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Very neat
review.reviewText: I love the fact that they had coffee available in the room, very handy and the staff very friendly

review.title: Super convenient location, fast check-in
review.reviewText: Overall I'm very happy with this hotel. The room was clean, check-in was fast and staff were friendly and helpful with one exception. They even gave out free water bottles. I'll definitely stay here again in the future. The only reason I didn't give a 5-star rating is one of the front-desk people (think her name was Courtney?) completely messed up the reservation for our airport shuttle bus, so we ended up having to take a last-minute cab ride to the airport. If you decide to use their shuttle service, please make sure that your reservation leaves you enough time to get to the airport. We were careless, thinking the hotel staff must have chosen the right time for us.
review.negativeRemarks: Front-desk needs to be more thoughtful. Wait until guests have dropped off luggage and freshened up before bombarding them with restaurant suggestions
review.locationRemarks: Love the location. Very close to Union Square and public transportation. And Tadich Grill!!!!

review.title: Nice hotel, great location, very comfortable
review.reviewText: Great location near the ferry building, great walks for history, near north beach and cost tower. Highly reccomend
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Near ferry building, wonderful walks, near  north beach, good shopping

review.title: Clean hotel in financial district!
review.reviewText: I went to SF with my boyfriend for a holiday weekend. Booked in advance and got a reasonable price. Super clean room, just small.. But that was expected. I LOVED the refillable filtered water bottles in the hallway! The staff was really helpful and super easy kiosk check in and out. The room had a Keurig coffee maker which was great as well! A little bit of a walk to food places and fishermans wharf but doable. Would definitely stay here in the future.

review.title: perfect location for everything
review.reviewText: Perfect location for everything. Room might be a bit small but very reasonable price, lounge was good!
Ac unit was broken, room was not overly clean, way too expensive for what it was. Some staff were friendly and others were not so much.  Would not recommend.

review.title: Very pleasant stay. Location is great.
review.reviewText: This hotel was an excellent choice. The location is great. The staff was attentive to all of our needs. The room was very clean and comfortable. Parking is convenient. Club Quarters will be on our list for a return visit.

review.title: Very nice hotel. close to all our favorite places.
review.reviewText:
This hotel was located in a perfect location for our needs. Close to the Ferry Building, Chinatown, Union Square and Market Street  
The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful.
The room, although small. was very clean and the bed was very comfortable.
Enjoyed the Club Room where you could just relax and get a cup of coffee, go on the internet etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Would be nice if the room rates stayed the same.  Last two nights the rates more than doubled due to some kind of convention.
review.locationRemarks: Location perfect for all the activities that San Francisco has to offer.

review.reviewText: Very modern and new. Small rooms but it's downtown San Francisco so this is expected. Good value for the money.

review.title: NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN
review.reviewText: WHY? AS I ASKED FOR CREDIT FOR A ROOM THAT (1ST NIGHT ) THAT HAD NO AIR C., ASKED TO SPEAK TO MANAGER . NO ONE RESPONDED. DID MOVE US TO A NOTHER SMALL ROOM, NOT MUCH BETTER. GREAT LOCATION, JUST A AIR LINE HANG OUT, JUST DON'T CARE ABOUT US.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING
review.locationRemarks: JUST DID

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
It was just ok. Our room didn't get cleaned, bed made or new towels which was frustrating and our room service dishes were never picked up. 

But out front desk check in lady who helped us was very sweet and helpful.

Reasonable hotel within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and Union Station.  Rooms were small but with everything that is available to do in San Francisco not much time was spent in the room.  Very nice little roof top patio.

review.title: Nice, safe area
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in good area. Clean. Comfortable. Nice view from terrace. Easy walk to subway.

review.title: san fran weekend
review.reviewText: great location for downtown/wharf in San Fran.  Parking only fair for convenience.  Price was average for parking in San Fran.  Room was smaller than anticipated as air conditioner almost touched bed.  Room design was  at fault as space overall was OK for area.  Staff was great and hotel very security conscious.  Need choice for pillows as room pillows were very soft and lacked support.  Overall experience was OK to good but would not return as many other choices for area.
review.negativeRemarks: noted above
review.locationRemarks: San Fran piers, chianatown 2 -3 blocks away.  Union Square about 10bloks

review.title: First Stay, Great Stay
review.reviewText: This was the first time I have stayed in this hotel and it was wonderful, I would definitely recommend

Hotel suited us but the cramped hallways and dark carpeting and furniture were off-putting.  Looking out into an internal air shaft was depressing.  The restaurant next door was unappealing - so we headed to the Ferry Building for a much nicer atmosphere.

review.title: Nice location in financial district
review.reviewText: Wanted a decent hotel in the financial district for a couple nights at a reasonable price and club quarters fit the bill

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Very pleased with our stay at Club Quarters. Great value for a very nice, clean, convenient room in expensive SFO. Great Location - walk to Ferry, Embarcadero, China Town etc. Great Cappuccino Machine in Club Lounge.

review.title: Good place to stay while doing business.
review.reviewText: Very small but modern. We normally stay at the hilton but it was booked. Not for the claustrophobic!
review.locationRemarks: A couple Irish bars close by!

review.title: The room smell and price is to high for the hotel
review.reviewText: The room smell like someone smoke and smell like and old place

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: I stayed here last minute for the San Francisci Marathon.  It was a little more than I had wanted to spend...BUT it was totally worth it!  The staff was helpful, the restaurant next door (hotel accessable) had fabulous food, great beer and VERY fairly priced!! It mad my race experience a positive one.
review.positiveRemarks: I LOVED the compementary coffee and water!!
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of the Financial District.  Awesome!

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Quick stay overnight while exploring the California coast
review.negativeRemarks: na

review.title: Enjoyed my 2nd time to stay here.
review.reviewText: The only drawbacks are $$ parking and (almost) all the nearby restaurants were closed on a Sunday eve.  The hotel itself was nice, clean, quiet and comfy.
review.locationRemarks: Took the kids to a walking distance park to see the Parrots of T. Hill getting ready to roost for the night and to use the playground.

review.title: Great Hotel in Central Location
review.reviewText:
We visited San Francisco in June and knew we would want a hotel within walking distance of various sites in a great location. Club Quarters checked all our must haves and we were not disappointed.
The room was a good size, very comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.
The hotel is within a short walk of so many great restaurants along the Wharf and Mission District, and not far from Chinatown shops and great shopping in Union Square.
I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to go back sometime soon!

review.title: Downtown San Francisco....
review.reviewText: if you have a chance to stay outside of downtown San Francisco you probably should. My stay at club quarters was pretty bad. My room was probably 12/12, the staff wasn't very helpful when I went downstairs to get help, and the parking is 57$ a night with tax. Also no mini fridge and most of the restaurants nearby are super expensive.

review.title: awesome hotel. great location.
review.reviewText: hotel was in walking distance to at&t park so it was the perfect location for what we were in san fran to do.

Our only complaint was that we were able to hear other toilets being used and being flushed one after another ALL NIGHT LONG and into the morning.That was the worst night of sleep we ever had at a hotel.We were in room 917 if that location makes any difference.
review.negativeRemarks: Plumbing

review.reviewText: The hotel was okay. Good location. The facilities need an update. Checking was quick and easy as well as the check out. Room was clean

review.title: A little get away
review.reviewText: It was very relaxing . beds were very soft and bathrooms were a little small with a walk in shower and there was no door handle to the bathroom door. It was different. but over all you can't beat the price and the location is excellient. It's right near everything, the pier is a block away there's so many restaurants and bars around so you can basically do anything. I will definitely be back.
Great value for the location which is walking distance to Union Square, China Town, North Beach, etc.
Great stay. Convenient location. Seamless check in.

review.title: Nothing like the picture
review.reviewText:
Our room looked nothing like what we saw on the picture 
It was small and the air conditioner wouldn't work and it smelled funny

review.title: Nice hotel! Good location!
review.reviewText: Our room was comfortable and clean! The location was convenient close to Bart station and close to local bars! Loved the filtered bottled water on almost every floor! The clubhouse offered coffee and tea which was lovely! The top floor deck was one of my favorite things about the hotel!

review.title: Ist time thru Expedia
review.reviewText: It was difficult to communicate with the Expedia Representatives. The rooms we signed up for were priced well but to small. Luckily we got to upgrade our room but our friends did not.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleanliness, the views and the bar next door.
review.negativeRemarks: King bed options, more ice locations
review.locationRemarks: The location was simple to find from the Bay Bridge I 80 direction. Took a short taxi drive to Fishermans Wharf for dinner and short distances to AT&T

review.title: Clean, convenient and affordable.
review.reviewText: We stayed here for convenience and it was just fine, but the room was tiny and there are no frills. if you need to flop for a night it'll do.  The standard room is better for a single traveler.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: I stayed for a short time but it was OK, the location is very good in a mid point to most attractions. the room and bath space wasn't big but OK. the staff were  helpful and their response was quick.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Lombard street, Ferry building market place & Fisherman wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very conveniently located, central, walking distance to great restaurants and the Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location. Suite was separated by a short corridor between living and sleeping spaces which we liked.
review.negativeRemarks: Could hear a lot of street noise.  Windows could use double paning to block noise.
review.locationRemarks: Wharf and great french restaurants within walking distance.

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel for the price. Clean lobby, nice staff, clean room with nice amenities.

review.title: Awesome hotel next to many pretty places!
review.reviewText: Loved our stay at this hotel! Beautiful hotel, new, always clean. Comfy bed and totally safe area to stay at. Close to many shops for coffee and breakfast. Easy walk to the piers for ferries, and to Chinatown! Loved it!

This is a comfortable hotel in walking distance to the Embarcadero and Ferry Buildings as well as the financial district.  Staff is warm and welcoming.  The room is a little small and I had a few issues with housekeeping.  Over all, this was a pleasant stay.

review.title: Great location, great facilities.
review.reviewText: Really impressed with this hotel, room was spacious and had everything we needed.  We also borrowed an iPad for free which helped us to plan our days in the city.  Only tiny moan was that the duvet cover was a bit nylon-y so although the room was cool, we kept getting a bit hot in the night.  Also when checking out the lady at the desk walked off to answer the phone while we were still speaking to her, so we just had to leave the iPad on the desk and hope that everything was ok as her attention was well and truly away from us by then!  Otherwise, great stay, plenty of drawer space for unpacking and amazing shower!
review.positiveRemarks: Free snacks and cans of pop downstairs but only realised when we went to collect our luggage and leave!  Bah!
review.negativeRemarks: Cotton duvet cover.
review.locationRemarks: 5 mins walk from the BART, 5 mins from the ferry building, 20 mins from Pier 39.

review.title: PERFECT Hotel in the middle of EVERYTHING!!!
review.reviewText: Club Quarters was absolutely awesome!!! This hotel is the cheapest you're going to find in the financial district while still being a four star hotel. The rooms are great, the pillows are to die for, the lobby area is perfect to get work done (free printing and snacks included!), they have a new restaurant downstairs, and it's walking distance from just about anything! There is a Starbucks next-door, a Pete's Coffee across the street, and a multitude of great restaurants all within just a few blocks of the hotel. Room service offers delivery from several different restaurants in the area if you don't feel like leaving your room. The Ferry Building Market place is just a 10 minute walk down the street and the BART is 6-7 min walk down the street! Aside from all of this, this was an amazing stay thanks to a guy at the front desk named Victor; Victor was absolutely AWESOME! As soon as I walked in, I was greeted with a smile and a personality that really brightened up my day. Victor was always a great source of information and even randomly brought some extra pillows to my room on my second night because he knew how much I loved them! THANK YOU VICTOR! To anyone looking to have an absolutely stress-free and delightful stay in downtown SF, make a reservation at Club Quarters.
review.positiveRemarks: EVERYTHING! Location, price, pillows, bottled water system, but most of all, VICTOR!
review.negativeRemarks: Absolutely nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Starbucks next-door, Pete's Coffee across the street, a multitude of restaurants within a few blocks, Ferry Building Market is just a 10 minute walk

review.title: COMPACT BUT GREAT
review.reviewText: Small room but everything required for comfort was present and well arranged. Good location in the financal district near the pyramid building. Staff was very helpful and well informed.

review.title: Nice location.
review.reviewText:
Very convenient if you are doing business in the financial district. Movie theater is walking distance as well as the Embarcadero for shopping my favorite stores: Banana Republic and Anne Taylor. Lots of restaurants to chose from and close to public transportation that takes you straight to SF Airport or Oakland Airport. 
Hotel is clean and has a Starbucks right on the corner of the street. Taxi's are readily available.
review.negativeRemarks: Better mattresses.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient if you are doing business in the financial district.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: If you like to walk you can do north beach. Chinatown. Union square and the ferry building/att park from here.

review.title: Free internet great for business travelers
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay.  Club Quarters was recommended to my by a friend.  Big plus is the free internet access.  I was able to work from my room which was a great.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  Would definitely stay here upon my next trip to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: My stay was short so I didn't need for anything
review.locationRemarks: Very close to shopping, restaurants and the pier.

review.title: Nice hotel - compact rooms - good location in city
review.reviewText: Free h20 - good location - rooms are a bit compact - but to be expected for the price

review.title: Location good
review.reviewText: Adequate hotel, not fancy but nice. Great location near waterfront and ferry building area. Nice area of the city. Quiet place, resistant nearby  and easy self park garage next door at $34 for 24 hrs

review.title: Close to my event in financial district.
review.reviewText: Room 412 was clean and quiet. It was a quick overnight stay (less than 16 hours) so unable to comment on the  many amenities offered.
review.positiveRemarks: Fast check in and check out. Attended kiosk right inside lobby door.
review.locationRemarks: Starbucks next door to hotel corner of Clay and Battery.

review.reviewText: Centered and good hotel in San Fransisco, I enjoyed to stay.

Great location, very clean and nice rooms. Easy/fast check in. Street parking close to the hotel. We got lucky and found a spot right by the hotel (free of charge after 6p and all day on Sundays vs $30-$40/day garage).

review.title: Exceptional value
review.reviewText: Great location and clean.  Everything you need in a hotel for an in city stay

review.title: Lousy Game, Great Hotel.
review.reviewText: Really comfortable place to stay while attending a Giants game. Giants lost badly but the room was worth the trip to the City.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy room, fresh drinking water, easy and friendly check-in.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was close but not provided on site,
review.locationRemarks: We walked to a Giants game. Very nice walk through the City.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Great location, cozy, clean, comfortable. The blankets on the bed are great.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking cost is high
review.locationRemarks: Everything

review.reviewText: Great location close to everything. The hotel was very comfy. The coffee and snack bar in the lobby was great!

review.title: Couldnt have asked for a more perfect hotel!
review.reviewText: The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The room smelled nice and were up to date. We couldnt hear street noise or any neighbors. Close to the event we were going to, as well as plenty of restuarants.
review.positiveRemarks: Very modern and comfortable. Felt like a fancy hotel, without the fancy hotel price tag. I would DEFINITELY stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The check out time. They wouldnt offer a late check out of even an hour, instead would charge you $50 to have the room for 3 more hours. No thanks.

review.reviewText: Good experience.  Recommend hotel to others.  Writing the experience is taking a long time to get through the review but the hotel is very nice.
I asked for a quiet room upon arrival and the hotel staff was very accommodating. The room was very comfortable, and I had no trouble sleeping. A great stay!

review.title: Second visit
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel previously- but this stay was not as good as the first. We had a very loud neighbor. We did not sleep comfortably due to loud neighbor and uncomfortable sheets.

review.title: Nice hotel bad customer service
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice looking and comfortable but the customer service was horrible. Really rude and the hotel itself was not very accommodating. Definitely won't be going there again, I've had better stays at motel 6 for half the price.
Hotel was in a perfect location with access to many SF locations but in a location that is typically quiet at night.  Staff was very helpful and the room and bed were very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and ease of access to check-in.  I like the automated check-in process at kiosks.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice to have discounted parking.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is located in the financial district of SF, so it is very quiet at night and weekends.  It is close to many popular locations and restaurants.

review.reviewText: Great price and a great location! If your thinking about paying way more for another place in the city don't do it, this place is right on the waterfront and in the heart of the city. Very close to Big Bus Tours stop #4. Loved this place

review.title: Hotel was neat and clean. Close to downtown.
review.reviewText: Towels have stains and smells like noodles. It seems like weren't wash properly. There was food in the fridge. Bed was neat and clean. Great staff.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with everything you need, but not all the fancy frills to make it overpriced.
great rooms and beds. nice location. friendly staff.

review.title: nice hotel close enough to the wharf and china tow
review.reviewText: the hotel our needs close the thing we wanted to do and affordable buy San Francisco standards
review.negativeRemarks: they should have said that the bar and restaurant was not open yet and you are on your on for parking.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to everything on that side of Fransico

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Everybody is wonderful, friendly, helpful and when there were problems with the credit cards, they were accountable and apologetic although we were not worried one but they would take care of it. A terrific group of people and gorgeous hotel!

review.title: Cute little place, convenient location.
review.reviewText: Lounge has a cappuccino machine available 24 hours a day- decaf too- it's amazing!  Rooms and workout space are small, but very comfortable.  Staff is great.  Would stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Booked my room a few days before staying, got a great deal, was very surprised by how nice the hotel was and the great staff!! Perfect location for a lot of great things!

review.title: Friendly staff, Nice Rooms
review.reviewText: Easy check in, upgraded to suite for only $25, which was lovely.  A sitting room, wet bar and refrigerator, and separate bedroom.  Comfortable.  Free bottle water, and the elevators were never long in coming.  Close to Embarcadero Centers and Ferry building, easy walking to restaurants and Starbucks.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet and elegant, yet very service oriented.
review.negativeRemarks: I loved my stay.
review.locationRemarks: We ate at different restaurants each meal, all in easy walking distance from hotel

review.title: Nice place near embarcadero
review.reviewText: This place is very convenient if you need a rapid check in and check out. The staff is nice, there is always fresh coffee in the lobby, The room was very clean, and not so small, unlike some other places in the area. The place is also not so close to the main streets so you can sleep without being disturbed by the noise.
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero, Fisherwarf, Pier

review.title: close to downtown and piers
review.reviewText:
Not as advertised, expected more, Room was small
Too expensive for what you get
review.negativeRemarks: lower the price

review.reviewText:
Walking distance to all hot spots in sf but paying 35 for parking is the  only thing that will keep me from staying there again  ...
Room was good very quiet, free water,  coffee maker, nice desk, ok beds, hairdryer, showers could use some maintenance other than that i enjoyed my stay

review.title: Great Location -- That's All !
review.reviewText: The room had a terrible odor, the hallways are dark and tight. If you just need to  rest your body and take a shower -- this is the property for you.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms with no odor, updated furniture and bedding that does not resemble a futon.
review.locationRemarks: Quick walk to the Ferry Building

review.title: Boutique hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: When you enter a hotel and you are greeted by staff with a smile, like Courtney and Jeff, you know you booked the right place. Very helpful and friendly staff. Great room, great experience, and gave great recommendations of where to eat and how to get about.

review.title: Happy with location
review.reviewText: Desk staff was very helpful .not as many snacks out as hoped

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText:
Central to everything, great room, great service. 
When I couldn't operate the coffee machine, someone came right up to show me.
More coffee when needed.
Great internet facilities in lounge room.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee machine didn't work in lounge area
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is near Chin town, the Business district, Westfield.....

review.title: Nice 4 Day Getaway
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I checked in on a Thursday (they were so nice and let us check in almost 3 hours early since our flight was so early in the morning) and we checked out Monday morning. The staff were very friendly from the moment we got in. We had the option to upgrade for an extra $25 but decided against it. We had a room facing Clay St. looking out into the street and right across from Le Meridian. It was perfect except for the couple hours protesters would come out and chant about Le Meridian. It fit us two perfectly. Enough space to get ready, get on the computer, watch TV and sleep. There is a sundeck on the 11th floor that we took advantage of every night where we would go look out into the city and have a couple glasses of wine. Location was perfect. We walked to China Town, Little Italy, Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square and anywhere else that was a little farther we just took Uber for under $20. There is a Starbucks right around the corner so it's great if you love coffee. Great stay and we plan on visiting again!

review.title: Nice hotel, some pro's and cons.
review.reviewText: Stayed on a Saturday night winter weekend break in January. In the financial district so not as close to the attractions as other hotels but also not as busy on the street outside. Not a luxury hotel but adequate. One advantage was that I was lucky enough to get one of the places to park on the street outside and it is free until noon Sunday, which saved me ~$30.

It is located right by the Embarcadero center (self parking is there, hourly rates with $34 max/day, which is pretty good for the area). only a few blocks from the ferry building. Free filtered bottles of water, WiFi. Clean.
review.locationRemarks: Ferry building (shops & restaurants & farmer's market). Embarcadero Center.

review.title: average , over priced
review.reviewText: short stay but foudn this hotel to be small in room size and overpriced compared to another hotel we stayed at which was much nicer and $100 a night less
review.negativeRemarks: lower room prices

review.title: Nice weekend getaway
review.reviewText:
We choose this hotel for its location: close to where we needed to be, and also close to transit. It is also in a quiet neighborhood and pretty safe to walk around at night. In the morning, we walked to the Ferry Building for breakfast.

We upgraded to a suite for a reasonable fee, which gave us a larger room and a small balcony. It was also a small view, but still nice to have. The hotel is somewhat surrounded by taller buildings.

The one downside is that there is no parking at the hotel itself, but there are good parking garages within a block. Price of daily parking was typical for San Francisco, and cheaper than a lot of the hotels.
