There were a lot of amenities that we didn't use or need - this time.
review.positiveRemarks: Our room was very clean and seemed modern. The suites have a mini-kitchen with microwave, cooktop and refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is less than a block from Embarcadero Center shopping. The Ferry Building is a great place, too. Also close to Market St & easy transit.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Held our luggage for no fee whilst we went to Chinatown.

Excellent location, sleek minimal design, good mini kitchen. Not only was there a handy plug for the computer, but there was a dictionary as well. In short, the suite fulfilled both the  esthetic and practical needs for a terrific stay.

review.title: It had a bed and a shower
review.reviewText: We chose to stay here because the location was convenient and the price was good. On leaving I still feel that the location was convenient and the price was good. But the room was painfully small. So if all you really need is a bed and a shower, then it's worth considering. If you want a nicer experience you should consider looking elsewhere.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Pier 1
review.reviewText: Easy check-in and check-out process.  Hotel is clean and nice with modern decor.  Parking is literally around the corner in an enclosed parking garage and is affordable ($34).
review.positiveRemarks: Location is within walking distance to Pier 1.  Starbucks is located next door.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators are lame.  Slow and seem to return to bottom floors when trying to go up from one floor to visit a higher floor.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 1 and waterfront nearby.

review.reviewText: Nice room, comfortable stay. Great location and easy check in and check out process.

review.title: In ce location. Stuufy riom
review.reviewText: Friendly and heloful staff. Stuffy room. Need better ventilation

review.title: Uncomfortable Stay!
review.reviewText:
I did not like my stay @ this hotel! When I checked in they didn't offer me an upgrade...the room that I stayed in was way too small! The bed was too small also. I had requested extra pillows when I made reservation a month ago & personnel was not to happy to comply! They need more personnel to accommodate their guests.
I will not be staying there again & will not be recommending it to my friends!
review.negativeRemarks: Personnel needs to cater & comply with their guests needs!

review.title: Nice surprise
review.reviewText: This was a last minute booking through one of those Unpublished Rates hotel. I was pleasantly surprised: from the easiest check-in I've ever seen, to the complimentary coffee (espresso, cappuccino or lattes), the best WiFi through the whole hotel. Everything went just smoothly. I also loved the self-served refillable water bottle station. Staff was very helpful. This hotel will particularly please business people due namely to its location near the Embarcadero.
review.positiveRemarks: Top notch free WiFi, free cappuccinos, refillable water bottles
review.locationRemarks: Location is great especially for business people, a bit further from Union Square and people who like shopping. It's also close to North Beach.

review.title: we stayed here a year ago, and were glad to go bac
review.reviewText: easy hotel to like. staff is courteous-and bright. layout is clever and easy to use. if there were a membership group, we'd join
review.negativeRemarks: overall size of the facility
review.locationRemarks: financial district. saw a wonderful film (mr turner) across the street. a terrific restaurant called la fusion a couple of blocks away on sansome

review.title: Will not be back!
review.reviewText: This will be our last time staying there.  The bed is so uncomfortable and we did not sleep at all.  We used to love the place for the simplicity and comfort!  The location is great!  But we will stay somewhere we can sleep!

review.title: Chinatown, Marina, SF Giants and close to Opera
review.reviewText: Very nice, stayed on Xmas eve and Xmas day 2014.  The staff was pleasent and lobby/lounge were done up nice for the holidays.   Coffee machine is great.  I checked into a basic room with no view, so I went back down and did a suite upgrade, which was much nicer, it was on the 10th floor and had a tub instead of just shower and also a living room with couch bed and tv, but best was a great view of the Marina and even a little Bay Bridge and San Francisco pier/ skyline action.  The 11th floor had a beautiful view similar to the room but included a hovering view of the Transamerica pyramid, I suggest having a picnic or glass of wine up at the tables there.  My girlfriend and I then walked 5minutes up Clay St right into Chinatown on Xmas day and had a really great experience.  We went back that night and the next day.  At night we hopped in the car and drove like 2mins to Marina blvd for a nice 20 min drive over to Golden Gate & Sausalito to do the Xmas light thing/ bay viewing.  I did get a ticket for $66 for parking in front of Club Quarters on Xmas, the sign says no Parking on Mon Wed or Fri from 2am-6pm and I misread, because that means you cant park on Sun, Tue or Thursday night of your stay since those listed are early hours of your peaceful sleep.   So that sucked, bah humbug.  On Mon, Wed, Friday&Sat you can park in front of non MTA spots (not the yellow ones) using meters which are free from 6pm-7am, then cost $6 for 4hours thereafter. If u wake up Saves $20-40per night
review.positiveRemarks: the lobby and guest office on Christmas.
review.negativeRemarks: After 6pm park in front of the hotel until 7am then pay 4$ for 4hrs on meter.  Dont park in front of MTA or the hotel on SUN, Tue or THUR night=ticket
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown was really cool, 5 minute walk.  Easy access to Marina blvd. Have a little picnic on the 11th floor balcony of Club Quarters, great view

review.title: WAY TOO SMALL - Think Cruise Ship Small
review.reviewText:
The room was incredibly noisy - I heard every raised voice and bus on the street out front. The shower was so small there was hardly room to turn around. I couldn't shave my legs or hardly bend over to pick up anything off the floor of the shower. When I did, I hit my head on the shower handle. When I raised my arms to wash my hair, I hit one elbow on the wall and one on the shower curtain.

The room service didn't answer when I called for dinner or breakfast. I tried calling 5 or 6 times for each meal before I called the front desk and they had someone "run over" and call me back. Dinner had several items missing. Breakfast was dried and crusty.

review.title: Perfect location in Financial District
review.reviewText: Overall, I really enjoyed staying at this hotel.  It is very clean.  Room was small but very comfortable.  The check in was a little weird as you had to use a computer.  The confirmation code Expedia provided was different than the checkout code, but the employees were very helpful at assisting us.  Excellent location in the Financial District...we could easily walk to everything!
review.locationRemarks: There is a great bar right next door.  The Elephant Bar.  Its a must visit!

review.title: hotel nice, but room ammenities were not the best.
review.reviewText:
The hotel rooms are basic.  The beds are ultra soft so it cuased significant back issues and a rough noght of sleep.  I needed a PHD to figure out the thermostat controls, which I ended up turning off becuase there was no happy medium and basic linen supply was 1 wash rag 1, hand towel and 2 bath towels.  

That makes it tough when shower before an evening out on the town and then in the morning when you have additional meetings. The hotel staff repsonded quick enough, but come on two people in a room and only two towels. That is a little on the cheap side.
review.locationRemarks: better use uber because cabs are fwew and far between and the doorman hailing cabs is across the street at the other Hotel where i should have stayed!

review.title: Reasonable price
review.reviewText: Small room. Reasonable priced for the area. A lot of stores and restaurants in the area.

review.title: Rooms
review.reviewText:
Overall great stay.
Shower is small and no tub but other than that a nice place

review.title: 5 night stay
review.reviewText: Smallish room but about average for a city centre. Nice and clean, serviced every day. Heating a bit noisy on the rare occasions we needed it.
review.positiveRemarks: Small comfy lounge with tea/coffee and free mnms!  also computers with fee wifi
review.negativeRemarks: Small thing, but the quilt cover kept sliding off the bed! Something that could be looked at!
review.locationRemarks: location was perfect for us in a flat area close to the financial district and Chinatown.

review.title: Staff
review.reviewText: Did not accomodate my earlier ck out and charged me a days tariif tho i left with 24 hr notice and before ck out time
Good location and a generally nice hotel w/ very cold and rude staffing.  should be closer to 4/5 but can't get over the rudeness.  I thought I was paying money to stay here..did I miss something???

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was nice, room was clean and it was in close proximity to Union Square.

review.title: Will Definitely Stay Again!
review.reviewText:
I checked in early and the room was not ready, but Liz was happy to hold my luggage while I went for a walk.  She was also quite helpful in changing my room from one facing the street (somewhat noisy) to another.

My overall stay was super!  The hotel was clean and comfortable and is conveniently located to the water, Union Square and even Chinatown.

I requested a microwave and got one plus a refrigerator in the room.  The hotel also offers complimentary refreshments to the guests each evening between 4 and 6.

I will definitely stay at the Club Quarters on my next trip to San Francisco!

Thanks to Liz for making my stay even more enjoyable!

review.title: Great hospitality from check in to our departure.
review.reviewText: The restroom door can be confusing, I kept thinking it was a sliding door vs a push to open. Having to fetch a an iron and ironing board and carrying it to the room is not quiet the experienced I hoped for since I was at the other side of the guest closet. The bed was a bit stiff but still can get a good sleep, I do recommend adding an extra 2 pillows even if it's just a room for one person. Other than that no real complaints. Thank you.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleanliness and quick check in.
review.negativeRemarks: restrooms could use locks and perhaps better mattress.
review.locationRemarks: It's a great location, no real fast routes since it's in the city. There are many locations nearby and a cinema across the street.

review.reviewText: I just love this Hotel because of price and comfort - great luxury in the room and bathroom. A desk with all the necessary things to get some work done, including free WiFi. Nice to have free water anytime you wanted on the hall near the elevator.

review.title: Room smelled like old hamburgers.
review.reviewText: Room smelled like old hamburgers and the AC unit didn't work very well.  It kept on defaulting to 68 degrees on a cold night.

review.title: Average. A little old. A little impersonal.
review.reviewText: Situated in the quiet financial area. But with a bar downstairs there is always activity.    A little rundown.   Weird machine check-in makes you feel like you're checking in for a flight.   Not great but not bad.  An average stay that creates no complaints and won't be remembered either.
very good for the value. free water station, nice lounge, efficient, clean

review.title: The hotel is very nice, near de Piers and financia
review.reviewText: I recomendable this hotel because iWork located, near public transport and also you can walk to The center
The baby crib was not a crib, it was a playpin which is not exceptable for babies to sleep in and there were not enough towels. Also the room was not dusted.

review.title: Good location, meh room quality
review.reviewText: This hotel is a good location with Ferry Building, Ballpark, Union Sq, & North Beach all nearby. The rooms are disappointing and need to be updated. Walls are not soundproof, so you can hear your neighbors. I'd stay in the area again for the location, but would look for a better hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms and soundproof

review.title: Could've been better.
review.reviewText: For the money I spent on this hotel, I expected a little more luxury. The room was tiny and somewhat outdated. I just expected more.
Great staff and room was clean.  Expected it to be a little bigger but its in the middle of the city so I guess it was ok if you are traveling for business. Location was great.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Piers and stores
review.reviewText: Crear hotel, near Piers abd financial offices and also near stores snd restaurantes.

review.title: Small room in a good location
review.reviewText: Made the reservations on Expedia based on the reviews.  Arrived, and for two people, the room was very small and cramped.   The balcony of a previous hotel was larger than the bathroom.   While the location was good, and for a single person the room would've have been adequate, this was not at all what was expected.  Bedding was certainly not 'premium', and there was dust behind the furniture (found while trying to plug the phone back in).
review.positiveRemarks: Location in the financial district was close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Larger rooms,
review.locationRemarks: Walked to dinner at the Ferry building and North Beach.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Parking is a little difficult. Walls are way too thin. I had to listen to the music from the alarm clock of the next room play from 645 am til 715 am. And the music was quite offensive rap with severe derogatory lyrics. Due to this I will not stay at this hotel in the future.

review.title: Club Quarters San Francisco
review.reviewText: We booked the hotel for location so was not expecting 5 star service. San Francisco is the most expensive city in the States so don't expect something for nothing. Parking around the corner was $33 per day which we expected. Room was small, think swing a cat and the cat gets hurt, but acceptable. Coffee available downstairs and in the room and moreStarbucks around the hotel than tramps, and there loads of tramps.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Centre of town, close to China Town, Union Square and a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Hence great location

review.title: A pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful.  Hotel is close to Chinatown, the Piers and shopping, walking distance to pretty much everything.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco.
Not a good one , tiny little room. I don't know, how two people can share this room

review.title: Just as Advertised
review.reviewText: Very brief stay. In late and out early but facility very nice. Appreciated the little touches such as free bottled filtered water dispenser on every floor and espresso machine in the lounge.

review.title: Nice hotel in the Financial District
review.reviewText: The hotel is comfy and clean. Good room quality and not a bad size as San Francisco hotel rooms go. This hotel is very conveniently located in the Financial District about 2 blocks from the Embarcadero Bart stop so that you can take the Bart from the airport. There are a couple good restaurants within walking distance (Gaylord's for Indian food and Oceana for Thai food, Sen's and a fabulous Greek place as well as the hotel's own restaurant, Elephant and Castle. There is a Starbucks right on the corner (two doors down) for those who cannot live without Starbucks. There are a few nice stores (Banana Republic, Gap, Naturalizer, Ann Taylor etc) but you will have to take the Bart to Union Square if you want to really burn that credit card.

review.title: Good for a short stay. Great location.
review.reviewText: We stayed 1 night. The hotel is located centrally. Staff is friendly.  Rooms are small though.

review.title: Love the place!!
review.reviewText: Awesome place! Really clean and modern...will stay here everytime espicalky for the price!

review.title: Clean hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel was clean and staff was friendly. The rooms are small. I knew this going and was ok with it because I wasn't spending a lot of time in the room.

If you planned to, I could see how you'd get a bit claustrophobic.

The hotel staff could not have been nicer and more accommodating.
Great value in a very convenient location.  Very helpful staff.

review.title: Great location - comfortable
review.reviewText: For the price, you're getting a great location. The room is small and so is the bathroom, but you have the essentials. They have a great area in the lobby with complimentary snacks and non alcoholic drinks all day, and complimentary refillable bottled water on each floor which we really loved and thought was a unique touch. Everyone was very friendly, and you're in perfect walking distant to the ferry building, China town, and bars and restaurants.
Was charged full amount when I tried to cancel reservation 24 hours before check in.

review.title: good or better
review.reviewText: end up No room available by the time we arrived but they sent us to Hyatt Hotel which i think it better.

review.title: Very good business hotel
review.reviewText:
quick and easycheck in , extra bonus was we could check in early, our room was ready by 11am. great internet and business area. roof top sundeck. friendly and helpful staff. downtown location very close to the ferry building and chinatown.  Rooms were small but really didnt spend much time in it. Bathroom - shower only no bath.
Overall satisfied with the hotel.

I had a great experience here. Very clean, modern rooms. Great location. Reasonable prices. They even had an interesting book selection in the room. 

Overall, a very positive experience which I would like to repeat in the future.

review.title: Perfect for an easy home base.
review.reviewText: We were there for a Giants game and Ferry Bldg visit and were very pleased with our experience. Clean, friendly staff and a stylish room. Would definitely recommend!

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed several nights on our second time at Club Quarters San Francisco.  The hotel is clean and efficient, the rooms are comfortable, and the staff is friendly.  There is free espresso and cappuccino, free wifi, free use of some computers, and a good collection of newspapers and magazines.  The location is very good for sightseeing and (I imagine) business, a short walk from the Embarcadaro and Chinatown, and slightly longer walk from the Union Square area.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is quite expensive, but that's probably the case with most hotels in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: comfortable, decent price, great location!
review.reviewText: This place rocks, when coming back to the city this place will be go to.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, decently priced, and has a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: There weren't may T.V channels to choose from; but I didn't really care as I was there to experience the city and not to watch T.V.
review.locationRemarks: It's really close to the Embarcardero where's there great shopping and food, and it's really close to North beach wheres theres some awesome bars.

review.title: pretty good choice even though price is a bit high
review.reviewText: we spent one night in SF last weekend, and it was great. room was small, but quiet and comfortable. we will go back again.
review.locationRemarks: pretty close to union squre shopping center

review.title: Incredible option
review.reviewText: Whether it was coming back to the hotel and seeing a homeless guy pinned down to the ground with blood all over the floor or riding the elevator up with a couple of hookers, club quarters certainly didn't disappoint. While I can understand people not being as excited about those instances as I was and I certainly can't guarantee you'd get the same experience, I found it highly compelling. The room wasn't huge but there was more than enough space. I loved the amenities and it was in a great location, walking distance to union square with a ton to do around the hotel. Had a great time here and I think you will too, definite recommendation.

review.title: Comfy but small
review.reviewText: Everything was as expected...I was just a little taken back by the size of the room as it was smaller than expected.  However, the hotel did provide free water and offered late check out for a small fee of $38.00 which helped since I was leaving after the marathon and needed time to relax and shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Right next to the Travelers building, across from the Embarcadero Mall, four blocks from the ferry building.

review.title: Weekend Stay for SF Marathon
review.reviewText: Hotel is in great location for races. Walking distances to shuttles or starting AND finish lines as well as to Chinatown and Market Street. This my 3rd time at the hotel for races, Rock n' Roll SF HM and SF Marathon/HM. Just enough amenities. Free wi-fi. Friendly front office staff, even though now there's check-in/out kiosks. Room service was from restaurant next door. The food was actually very good. Starbuck is just around the corner.  For my basic needs, This is my go-to hotel if I return to SF for any races.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and Market Street.

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: At first glance I thought my room was quite small, but after I came back and actually got in it I found that I was very comfortable.  Everything seemed to be in the right place, the purified water in the hall, along with extra coffee was very thoughtful and convenient.  I will definitely stay there again when I go to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: I wasn't there long enough to see everything the hotel had to offer but I really liked the restaurant, nice people and the food was really good.
review.locationRemarks: There is a million things to do in San Francisco, this hotel is pretty close to the piers so that is something really fun to do.

review.reviewText: Great hotel ! Very nice staff! They provide many great amnemeties. Also the staff is very helpful in guiding you throughout the city and any other questions you might have.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: It is located in a very convenient location to most attractions.  We walked to Fisherman Wharf from the hotel and ran along the Embarcadero Drive in the morning.  Starbucks Coffee just downstairs
review.positiveRemarks: It is located in a very convenient location to most attractions.  We walked to Fisherman Wharf from the hotel and ran along the Embarcadero Drive in t

review.title: Good place to stay near Ferry Building
review.reviewText:
Club Quarters is a nice and reasonably priced place to stay in San Francisco.  It is conveniently located in the Financial District of San Francisco, so it is walkable from the BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) stop on Market Street for easy access to and from the airport without the need to get a taxi.  And the hotel is a couple blocks from the Ferry Building, which is a great place to find great meals (and food of all kinds).    Wi-fi at Club Quarters is free.

The room was clean and comfortable. There is a 24 hour gym, and the lobby has a great lounge for guests with free coffee and tea, a television, fireplace, computers for internet use, newspapers, etc.

All in all a very pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location; reasonable price; free wi-fi; nice guest lounge; 24 hour gym.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit small with no view, but I booked the cheapest room possible so that was expected.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to public transportation, Ferry Building, shopping on Market Street, downtown SF, SOMA, Chinatown, etc.

review.title: Convenient for the Giants games
review.reviewText: Check in was a bit odd without a front desk, just kiosks, but it worked.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the expresso machines, and the bottled water.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a bit small and it is always nice to have a table with 2 chairs to play cards.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants, the piers, and the AT&T stadium.

review.title: Handy to everything.
review.reviewText:
Easy check in and upgrade. Friendly staff, good size room. 
Coffee and snacks in lounge, pleasant perk. Nearby to Chinatown, Union square. Flat walk from Embarcadero Bart station. Will be back next time in SF

review.title: Great hotel and great location!
review.reviewText: Loved the included espresso and latte bar! Also the guest closet is great! Would definitely return!!

review.title: Great time in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Excellent location, within blocks of the Ferry Building, Cable car system, BART system, restaurants, etc.  Started off a little disappointing, our room was on the 2nd floor and our view was a cement wall!  But the staff was great, and were able to relocate us to a 7th floor corner room with a view!  Excellent business centre with 4 computers, printing capability and large lounge area.  Rooms were nice and clean and the guest closets and bottled water dispensers were great touch!  Would definitely stay there again!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, within blocks of the Ferry Building, Cable car system, BART system, restaurants, etc

review.title: Small rooms
review.reviewText:
Used this hotel as it's close to the Ferry Building. Very efficient check in. Rooms clean but very small. I guess it worked for one night but I couldn't recommend for longer stays. Suits mostly business visitors. "Would I stay there again?" - no.
Also not cheap.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near business district & Ferry Building.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much.

review.title: Close to main attractions
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a few nights this weekend, on first sight the lobby was small and cramped but modern. Very quick and easy check in, just swipe with the card you booked with and it does the rest for you. We had a regular club room booked and when we got in we were pretty disappointed but were OK with it for the night. We tried to cancel the rest of our nights there but could not because it was past the 24 hour mark. We were very unhappy but the hotel front desk was very accommodating and gave us a suite for the same price. The hotel is right around the corner from the TransAmerica building and a few blocks from Chinatown and Little Italy. A very walkable mile and a half from Pier 39 and Fishermans Wharf. Aside for a few minor glitches the first day, we were all in all very happy with our stay here. If your are looking for a nicer budget friendly hotel that is close to where you wanna be, I highly recommend Club Quarters.
review.positiveRemarks: How convenient it is to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleanliness of the room was less then expected.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and Little Italy are super close, a 10-15 min walk or less. Pier 39 is only about 20 or so mins walking and Coit Tower is very close.

review.title: good location, good price
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Club Quarters in Boston as well.  Much like the other property it was VERY adequate with a good location and price point.  The rooms are very small but we expected that for this price.  Would stay there again!
review.negativeRemarks: Room size.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed this hotel and its amneties. It is central and a short walk to everything. the staf is courtious. The frontdesk is minimalist and very efficient
review.negativeRemarks: make sure the matresses are flipped around from time to time to ovoid that the become unbalanced.
review.locationRemarks: From the front desk, you can have all information about everything there is in the city, You can make reservations for bus, cable cars, sightseeings,

review.title: Club Quarters is a good choice for the price
review.reviewText:
While you could definitely tell this hotel caters towards business travelers who won't be staying in the city for too long (small rooms), it was great for two San Fran tourists as well. The hotel and our room was clean, and the staff was very helpful. The bottled water fill-up station in the hallways is an excellent idea! Plus, because you're in the Financial District, you're paying less than you would in other areas (Union Sq, Fisherman's Wharf, etc), and you're still close to cable car lines and and other areas of interest.

Bottom line: If you're looking for a spacious room where you can really spread out, this would not be the hotel for you.... But if you're just looking for a nice room to come back to at the end of a long day of sightseeing, we would recommend Club Quarters.
review.locationRemarks: Close to cable car lines, bus routes, Chinatown, Ferry Building

review.title: Good hotel.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, close to everything, quite, and right next to pub.

review.title: Club Quarters
review.reviewText: Upon arrival at Club Quarters, one of the staff members was nice enough to recommend parking our car down the street a few blocks, because it was cheaper than the hotel parking.  We ended up saving almost $30 thanks to the staff member's advice.  The first thing I noticed about the building was that it was very close quartered.  The lobby was tiny, with two airline-style kiosks for check-in.  The elevator probably couldn't have handled more than two people.  The hallways were maze-like and claustrophobic, and were covered in worn carpeting that looked like it hadn't been changed since the 70s.  The room was acceptable and clean, although small like everything else in the place.  Club Quarters is a good cheap alternative for a weekend trip or a one-nighter, but I think next time I'll be looking for something a little more contemporary and spacious.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very genuine and helpful, and the room was clean.  Additionally, the filtered water at the end of the hall came in very handy.
review.negativeRemarks: You can't improve the constrictive sensation of the hallways, but I'd defintiely recommend new carpet.  I'd also recommend better hotel room coffee.
review.locationRemarks: The location is in the financial district.  There isn't a whole lot immediately near by, but the hotel was well-situated for exploring.

review.title: Not the best
review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights. Not a club like it says on the web site. decent, but not great hotel
review.positiveRemarks: Lowest price in the financial district
review.negativeRemarks: There is no parking provided by the hotel, if you are coming by car you have to park in the Embarcadero around the corner.

review.reviewText: everything was great except the protesters that start protesting across the street at 7am at another hotel

review.title: Great stay for a weekend break.
review.reviewText: Hotel easy to find, smack in the center of the Financial district, next to the "Elephant & Castle" pub. Plenty of restaurants and bars in the area, not too far from the BART, and the bay
review.positiveRemarks: Modern, clean & tidy. Pleasant staff, nice rooms
review.locationRemarks: Financial District, Alcatraz Island, Bay area, Cable car Museum

review.title: not so great on price performance
review.reviewText: it was my first time in this hotel and probably will be the last, there is nothing wrong with the hotel, I just believe that for what I pay, maybe my expectations were bigger. or if I paid $150 per night (half of what I paid) than I would rate the hotel at 4-5 ratings. small hotel room/bathroom with ok cleaniness

review.title: Good value hotel
review.reviewText:
Even though we did not arrive until 23.00 Check in was quick and easy.

The only downside of this hotel is that although they have three lifts only one serviced the top three floors, and we were on the top floor.

review.title: San Fran Weekend
review.reviewText: Hotel was a nice walk from majority of tourist spots on our list, if not, a cab was easily grabbed. Loved the city atmosphere of the Club, but also, being the weekend.... the smaller crowd. Our room was clean and comfortable. The food downstairs was exceptionally good. A good pick!

review.title: Super small dirty rooms
review.reviewText: Not sure how this hotel got the rating it did. I have stayed in several hotels in the the Financial District of SF and this one was the worst. The rooms were small, the bathroom was dirty, and there was garbage under the bed.
it is a great hotel! super well located. it is just a few steps from the embarcadero and the metro station. Recommended!

review.title: Nice hotel near everything!
review.reviewText: Hotel just a few blocks away from China town and Pier 1. And from Pier 1 its just a short walk down to Pier 39 to Fishermans Wharf. Room was simple and clean, Staff was helpful and there is a yummy bar/restaurant attached that serves great breakfast.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: It was a pretty nice hotel but having a room right outside the alley was not great, it was loud when the garbage truck came early in the morning. But overall it was nice.

review.title: Nice express hotel in the center of it all
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel for busy guests on the go. Near everything in the heart of the financial district. Clean and comfortable. Super speedy check-in and out.
review.positiveRemarks: The check-in process. The filtered water. The view.
review.negativeRemarks: Better pillows. Too flat.
review.locationRemarks: Not far from the piers and fisherman's wharf as well as chinatown.

review.title: Love this place!
review.reviewText: Always stay here!! Highly recommend...it's hit and miss on the prices but a excellent stay...

review.title: Nice Hotel, no type of breakfast provided.
review.reviewText: Nice place close enough to the Warf area, via the F Line, small rooms but cozy.
review.negativeRemarks: Some type of Danishes, ect. in the morning for guests who don't have time to sit and eat.
review.locationRemarks: Took the F-Line (4 block walk) as instruction's provided by staff to all of the Warf areas. Bring exact cash ($2) person.

review.title: Nice location and awesome hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the location of the hotel. Was very close to downtown and within walking distance of shops and restaurants. Restaurant hooked to hotel was nice as well. Staff was all very friendly and helpful. Would definately stay here again

review.title: Excellent hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Stayed at club quarters for the Bay to Breakers race. close to the start line and centrally located to many restaurants and shops
review.positiveRemarks: Free water bottles on all floors. Free coffee and snacks in the lounge area.
review.negativeRemarks: beds were somewhat hard. Pillows were flat and walls were pretty thin
review.locationRemarks: Elephant Pub next door was great.

review.title: Same price elsewhere will get you MORE!
review.reviewText: In one word...DISAPPOINTMENT! Rooms are small, not very modern, and lack any overall taste. The sheets felt like a shower curtain liner (plastic-y!), the bed spread too! The bathroom door was a saloon-style swinging door, which didn't fit the door frame so forget any privacy! Nor did the bathroom door stay closed, it would swing open a few inches while you were looking for privacy.
review.positiveRemarks: Location!! This hotel must stay in business solely because of its great location. The pub, connected to the lobby, is great!
review.negativeRemarks: The check in process! You self-check-in at kiosk which is kind of tacky.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable hotel with friendly staff. We walked to AT&T Park and shopped at Embarcadero Center. Will stay here again!

review.title: Good Location...but bathroom needs some updating..
review.reviewText: great location but the room and bathroom really need make over....nice and helpful staff...
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom and bed...
review.locationRemarks: near Chinatown and little Italy

review.title: Good hotel for great price
review.reviewText: We stayed one night at this hotel while attending a course in SF. It was at a great rate (for SF prices) and in walking distance to our course. It wasn't fancy but all we needed was a place to crash. I will definitely stay here again if we can get the same rates again!
review.positiveRemarks: The Rate was great and had all the amenities we needed in a hotel. It was also great to be in walking distance to our course we were taking.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Near Embarcadero and Landmark Education

review.title: Short stay on the way home...
review.reviewText: Out of all the hotels we have been to this is the one hotels that we have been back because of the Convenience, price and cleanliness... The surroundings was great, we were as always greeted with welcoming arms... If and when I do it again we will be deficiently be back...
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: location was excellent!!! walking distance to everything...

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Excellent location, professional staff and a pleasure to stay there!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I know of!
review.locationRemarks: 20 min walk to North Beach, 2 minute walk to Safeway, 5 minutes from the F train, Municiple transportation and the Bark (to get to the airport). WOW.

review.title: facilities like no other
review.reviewText:
Stayed only two nights, way too short.

if your a good coffee addict like me, available for free, this is the hotel for you.
if you like the latest free internet accessibility, this is the hotel for you.
if you want a secure comfortable room, and a well appointed lounge,this is the hotel for you.
review.negativeRemarks: if you need a swimming pool, bar, exercise room etc., go somewhere else!
review.locationRemarks: if you want a centrally located hotel, in a good neighborhood, this is the hotel for you.

review.reviewText: Pretty much thumbs up, we will definitely come back here.

review.title: Good stay!
review.reviewText: Our room was so clean and convenient because here was closed to downtown.

review.title: Excellent value and location.
review.reviewText: Standard queen room is a little narrow but well appointed and clean. It's an incredible price for San Francisco, right across from the Embarcadero One. Best prices are on the weekends, and check the week before you want to go. You have to get lucky to get a room sometimes, but if you, SCORE! We are locals, but are in the East Bay, so it's a treat to stay in the City sometimes!
review.positiveRemarks: Service is amazing! The free espresso bar and bottled water is also a huge plus!
review.locationRemarks: Farmers Market at the Ferry Plaza should not be missed.

review.title: Nice location during week
review.reviewText:
Financial District gets pretty empty during weekend :(
Our room, Club, was very , very small with small bathroom.
Overall stay , so so.

review.title: Convenient to downtown San Fran
review.reviewText: We love staying at this hotel.  The location is great to see all of the sites and to great restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close..transportation options to get to any sites across the city.  The ferry building and outdoor market are great.

review.reviewText: Friendly staff. The issue I had with the room was that the bathroom was pretty dirty and the towels had hair on them. Other than that we had a good stay.

review.title: Affordable if a tad small.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and had an attractive price. Very green by not stocking every room with water and ice.buckets. Instead there was an ice.bucket area and water bottle filling stations that were unlimited to guests. Unwanted guests can't take advantage of that because you need a room key to access the elevators. Unorthodox for me but I did seem to enjoy it. No pool but there is a rooftop access to see the bay. Wish it was a little nicer but other than that I was pleased. Oh, the check in area is verry confusing. Hotel staff does not direct those checking in and out and will let you stand there confused while others cut in front of you. Fix that and I'd give it nine out of ten!
Good, nothing to complain. We enjoyed the stay...........

review.title: Nice hotel for business stay
review.reviewText: Everything was alright, only bad thing is the parking. Remember that there isn't one within the hotel facilities. There are some around though.
Room a little small but very comfortable and clean. Staff was excellent super nice and courteous.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to downtown and ferry building.

review.title: Small but quaint
review.reviewText: Great experience. Everything within walking distance from the hotel. Would stay again.

review.title: Budget hotel
review.reviewText: We arrived after a five hour flight. We had 6 bags with us, and the hotel staff didnt even offer to help us with our bags. The rooms are TINY, no room to move at all. The beds were hard and uncomfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything! The rooms are tiny. The bathroom was uninviting and not clean. Mould growing in the shower. The layout of the hotel was weird too!

photos.caption: Our seats at AT&T park. Best game ever!!! Crawford hit walk off home run

review.title: Great location!!!
review.reviewText: Walking distance to AT&T park. Hotel was very accommodating. Our room was very quiet. Never heard any outside noise. We'll definitely come back

review.title: Good value, clean, comfortable in great location
review.reviewText: Great amenities, friendly welcoming staff, overall very good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit too hot - A/C didn't work as well as would have been best
review.locationRemarks: Near the financial district and great restaurants/shopping. Central location was a definite plus.

review.title: Roof terrace
review.reviewText: Lovely outdoor terrace on roof.recommmend spending time up there during the day

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Chestnuts Fundy gift gruff big guys gift third sets fujitsu ioctl Idk

review.title: Euro style hotel downtown SFO
review.reviewText: Stayed one night. Hotel has no parking so you are left to fend for yourself at $33 day in a nearby public garage. Staff was attentive enough. Not a traditional sign in desk but a touch screen affair that couldn't find our reservation. Connected to a good restaurant and pub. Room was nice and clean. We were on the 2nd floor outside room....it was like sleeping in the road noise wise. Very loud and not restful at all. If I was here on business and needed to work the next day it would have been a real problem. I understand the concept they are going for it was just poorly executed here.
review.negativeRemarks: Some type of parking discount.

review.title: Overnight in San Francisco's Financial District
review.reviewText: I stayed one night in the Club Quarters in San Francisco. I selected it due to location and cost.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the water refill station on my floor. The lobby was nice and I visited Elephant & Castle which is adjacent to the hotel after work.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was so small and everything felt a bit run down and dingy.

review.title: Club QTRS San Francisco
review.reviewText: Every Club QTRS I've stayed at has been a very good experience. All hotels are very clean, the beds are comfortable, the staff is professional, there is free filtered water and close to where I need to be. I would recommend Club QTRS to anyone!

review.title: Nice hotel close to embarcadero
review.reviewText: The location is great, the facility is very modern and well kept, staff is helpful & friendly. upon check-out we were able to leave our luggage while we finished enjoying our time in the city. definitely would return to this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to embarcadero
review.reviewText: The location is great, the facility is very modern and well kept, staff is helpful & friendly. upon check-out we were able to leave our luggage while we finished enjoying our time in the city. definitely would return to this hotel.

review.title: Good no-nonsense overnight place
review.reviewText: This unassuming hotel is comfortable and well put together.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Great location for exploring north San Francisco on foot. Self parking but less than a block from the front door. Would stay there again.

review.title: Location was great!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The professionalism of the staff was a plus....
review.negativeRemarks: A vent or fan in the bathroom...
review.locationRemarks: On the day we checked out we were able to walk down to fisherman wharf and enjoy the bay... We went to see Sinbad @Yoshi's and had a blasted!!!

review.title: Great location but rooms are small
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel. We loved the location. We wish the room was bigger. The comforter was great but the sheets were rough to the touch. I was not sure the bathroom shower was all that clean and it was small. Motorhome small.
review.negativeRemarks: Clearer shower. Softer sheets.
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Basic yet effective.
review.reviewText: No frills, small rooms, but great location and it was good enough.

review.title: Good for Price
review.reviewText: Nice decorations, Nice staff, couch was way to small to sleep on (turned out to be a good thing...), sweet location.

review.title: Great location. Underwhelming bathroom.
review.reviewText: The hotel location is awesome, but it was a no frills experience. The bathroom left a lot to be desire. It felt like showering in a middle school locker room.
review.negativeRemarks: Nicer bathroom.

review.title: Wonderful facility, wonderful location
review.reviewText: When we went to check in, the staff were right there to assist us in the electronic check in. They were friendly and since we did not know how to do electronic check in, they were very patient and helpful. The room was just beautiful, everything was clean and comfortable, and quiet. The hotel is located about a mile from the waterfront and not far from a BART station. We really enjoyed the adjoining pub. There is a Starbucks right around the corner, being from Washington state, that was definitely a plus.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked everything about this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: We really can't think of a thing. It was just an all around great experience.
review.locationRemarks: It is within walking distance to the waterfront and close to the BART.

review.title: Friendly, safe, perfectly placed for sightseeing.
review.reviewText:
Clean, comfortable hotel rooms that were quiet and spacious. Incredibly friendly and helpful staff: from directing me to the Post Office, booking cabs, to storing my luggage for the day after checking out. For a hotel that is part of a corporate hotel chain, it really was a homely, friendly place. Nothing was too much trouble. If you're a single person travelling on your own, this makes a great base.

Two people who really stood out to me were Jenny and Sarbi. They were very warm and caring and I felt that they took me under their wing immediately. That made my stay really special as I was travelling on my own.
review.positiveRemarks: Additional helpful things: chilled water and bottles, specific charging stations for electronic devices on the bedside table (brilliant idea), wi-fi.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Coffee shops, restaurants galore. Also within walking distance to Post Office, cinema, piers, Alcatraz (25 min walk) and Fisherman's Wharf (30 min).

review.title: Definite bang for your buck.
review.reviewText: Good service. The suite had a small but usable kitchenette that was great to have (even though we didn't use it) clean, bed was comfortable, in the hall there was a purified water station with refillable bottles that was very cool. The only reason I didn't give a five for facilities is that I didn't see an ice machine (might have been there but I didn't see it). It has a really nice bar/restaurant connected to it that we enjoyed. The price for this in SF is really good and I was actually surprised.
review.negativeRemarks: Ice machine?
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, 3-4 blocks Chinatown, 3-4 blocks other way Ferry Plaza, walking distance (for those that don't mind 1-2 miles) from everything.

review.title: Small space
review.reviewText: Hotel room is very small for two people. With the bed and a desk, you don't have much room to walk around. The room is quite dark too.

review.title: My company's stay at Club Quarters Hotel
review.reviewText: For the first time, we've never been so disappointed in the Club Quarters Hotel. I booked 8 rooms through Expedia and my Board of directors had the worst time trying to register in the hotel. It seems that the staff at the Club Quarters do not honor these types of bookings even when Expedia faxed them a copy of all reservations. The hotel even wanted to charge my group for early departures even though they had been notified by Expedia well in advance of the deadline for cancelling a reservation. My group has told me to never book there again because they were so upset.
review.positiveRemarks: It was the same Club Quarters that we've become accustomed to once you finally gained entrance to a room.
review.negativeRemarks: How you make your reservation.
review.locationRemarks: This was a business trip so no time for socializing.

review.title: Anniversary
review.reviewText: It was nice the only bad thing is they have no parking and you have to pay 33 a night for overnight parking so budget that in your room but straight down Clay you hit the water.

review.title: Clean and modern affordable hotel
review.reviewText: I really was not expecting this hotel to be this nice, since the same price range around Union Square has some very awful hotels. This one is on the Financial District, which is walking distance to Chinatown and Embarcadero. You can take public transport to other places. Nice and cheap.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking situation is very expensive. But this is not the Hotel's fault I guess since parking in general in the city is just ridiculous.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Embarcadero, Market Street.

review.title: my new fav SF hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel at a wonderful Financial District location. Staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. Room just a bit small, but large social areas (with free coffee drinks like lattes and cappuccinos) more than compensate.
review.locationRemarks: Financial district/Embarcadero area of SF. Farmers market at Ferry Building is tops. Walk to North Beach and Union Square for eating and shopping.

review.title: Good location. Doesn't mention parking fees
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for the price located in SF. The hotel doesn't have a parking rage but urges you to park overnight in one down the street. That charges $46 a day! They never mention fees to you until you're leaving. Then shocked about the price. Not good customer service id say...

review.title: Thieves
review.reviewText: Plain an simple, i reserved my room on the wrong day called to change the day to one day later and they charged me for the 1st day still!!! Not happy with how they treated me as a guest. Room was dirty as well as the bed. If they would of gave me my money for 1st day back i would of over looked everything else. Very disapointed for such a "high ranking hotel"

review.title: Great location, awesome amenities for business.
review.reviewText: Stayed for one night here and liked it a lot. Very clean and modern furnishings. The room was kind of small but didn't feel cramped. I liked how they don't put the tv across from the bed and there was a nice big desk in the room. We also had a red eye flight and they held our bags all day for us! Very good staff and hotel. Will stay again.

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: We arrived early and were immediately checked in which was a rather unexpected treat. The staff was very helpful during check in and out. The room was cozy and very clean. The elevator required the use of your room key which was a thoughtful security measure. They offered an expresso bar in the lobby which was a tremendous way to start our day. The rooftop views were awesome and our 7 year old daughter had the time of her life. I highly recommend this establishment while in San Francisco as it is very close (within walking distance) to everywhere. We'll stay there again on our next visit!

review.title: Club Quarters
review.reviewText: My experience was pleasing overall. I would stay there again.

review.title: Good.
review.reviewText: Very peaceful and comforting. Quiet but stupid television. Bed is a little small but very comforting. Only has a shower but is fun.

review.title: Great hotel in financial district.
review.reviewText: Connects directly to pub and steps from Starbucks.

review.title: Great stay . . . .
review.reviewText: The only thing is that they stop serving breakfast at 11am on Sat & Sun . . . not gopod for people who want to sleep in a little on their wknd.

review.title: Great for a business traveler
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay. Very nice location right next to the Embarcadero office complex, WiFi worked great, room was quiet, the Cappucino machine in the main floor lounge was a pleasant positive surprise. Non-smoking is always a plus. Definitely will be my place to stay on future business trips to San Francisco.

review.title: Modern convenience in historic location.
review.reviewText: Walkable location had everything I needed - public transportation (Bart & Ferry Bldg.) and best districts of the city.

review.title: Nice hotel; great location
review.reviewText:
After giving this place a pass because of low ratings, I thought I'd give it a try. Overall, great location and nice staff. Newer property, so you don't have the old "boutique" charm to deal with.

Room is functional, decor is strictly "business" like; not a destination for a "romantic" weekend. No tub.
Housekeeping missed a few spots. But in general, hotel in good shape. They have"self check-in" which lacks any warmth, but it's good for business travelers. They offer a nice seating area in lobby with coffee service to include cappucinos! The location is the best! near all lines of transportation, restaurants, embarcadero's Ferry Bldg. and a quick walk to the wharf.

I received a good deal, so felt it was worth it. The staff informed me that they will be renovating some of the rooms to be more "warm" which will be nice. I'll stay again if rates are comparable to others, as now it's a known quantity.
review.negativeRemarks: need a housekeeping manager to double check rooms not cleaned well.
review.locationRemarks: Best location - near Embarcadero/Ferry Bldg., all bus/muni/bart lines. Perfect starting point for Wharf, North Beach, Chinatown and ball park.

review.title: Nice, clean room.
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly, room was nice and clean. Parking garage was pretty close. No complaints. Would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: We ordered room service and told it would take 15-20 minutes, they took over an hour.

review.title: Excellent location, venue, and service efficiency
review.reviewText:
We booked this reservation on a value travel website without knowing the hotel prior to purchasing. It met our price, star rating and location for a weekend getaway to SF. After receiving hotel name, we found that website information regarding the hotel was sparse as compared to traditional hotels so we arrived not knowing what to expect. When we arrived, we quickly realized that it is geared for business travelers who have no vehicle to park and have minimal entertainment requirements from the hotel. Having traveled extensively for business in the past, I would have found this hotel perfect.

As a tired couple looking for a mini vacation getaway we found the room and hallways cramped. We missed not having a bathtub and mini fridge. Felt a bit dungeon-like for any daylight sumpin' and lounging. Didn't meet our overall hopes for a couple's retreat from the room side.
review.positiveRemarks: Good sleep (sleep well kits /comfy bed), green , Outside Sun deck, Staff, EZ refreshments.
review.negativeRemarks: Mini fridge please! Need to give value travel websites a bit more info..business hotel. Value customers would like like a break on parking cost.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to ferry building, P/U location for tours. Easy access for tourists for many tours, shopping. Great whiskey/oyster bar on Pier 1

review.title: Really nice place
review.reviewText: Me and my wife love this place..we travel to SF often and everytime stay here..would recommend to everyone!

review.title: Well located, often pricey
review.reviewText: Located in the financial district, this hotel is close to several interesting areas of San Francisco (Chinatown, Embarcadero, Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach), and it is set in an attractive and seemingly safe urban environment. Room prices are often high, but rates may be substantially lower when business travel is off (e.g.,late Dec-early Jan). Rooms are small but very clean and well set-up, more than sufficient. There is a cozy, comfortable common room, which is usually stocked with snacks and hot drinks (also a members-only room denied to Expedia travelers). These amenities were often neglected during our most recent stay. An adjacent restaurant-bar provides 3 meals, but more intriguing food is readily available within a few blocks.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance of common room
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is an endless source of interest (and great food). But that's just the beginning for San Francisco, a huge array of urban delights.

review.title: Affordable hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: I stayed here over Christmas, and had a wonderful time. The lobby is comfortable, with coffee and snacks around the clock. Our room was on the 10th floor, and it was quiet for our entire stay (5 nights). Chinatown and the Ferry Building are close. The staff were friendly, especially Lennin. I will definitely stay here again while visiting San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet room. Friendly staff. Great location! Affordable for the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: Near Chinatown (about two blocks). Lots of dining and shopping options nearby. The Ferry Building is a short walk (about 15 minutes).

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: It went well, but it was pricey mainly because it was New Years Eve.
review.positiveRemarks: How close it was to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: This is close to embarcadero.

review.title: Great Hotel Great Deal
review.reviewText: In the best area of San Francisco and two blocks from the Hyatt Regency which gets about 4 times the price this is one of the best kept secrets in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The Location and the Friendly Staff made it happen.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a thing.
review.locationRemarks: You are in the financial district, near the bay ferries, the cable cars, restaurants and transportation to go anywhere in San Francisco.

review.title: Decent hotel for one person
review.reviewText: the hotel staffs are very friendly and accommodating. Free coffee in the lounge was nice too.

review.title: Nice and clean hotel
review.reviewText: Checked in was quick and the room was very clean with comfortable beds. Room was a little small but adequate for two of us. Hotel provided complimentary fresh ground coffee , soft drink and snack at the hotel living room and also filtered water fountain at each level which I thought a very nice touch. Free self service washing machine and drier were also provided at the lower level. Easy access to embarcadero station and California cable car.

review.title: Nice hotel with very nice staff
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice staff, plenty of free amenities and coffee
review.negativeRemarks: No parking lot, parking is $32 for no in and out, $41 for in and out. Lot is just around the corner though.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of the financial district.

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay. Clean & comfy rooms. However the staff wasn't the friendliest (maybe because we are Hispanic and we looked different than everyone else). Should probably work on being nice & polite to everyone... But overall nice hotel. Would stay there again.

review.title: Most comfortable Pillows and Bedding
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, walking distance to most areas
review.negativeRemarks: As noted the rooms are smaller, so be aware that the "Pull out sofa bed" is just a chair with a twin size pull out bed.

review.title: Nice, great location
review.reviewText: Stayed at Club quarters for 2 nights. It was small, but cozy - as we were basically just sleeping in the room since we were on vacation. Great location! Right across from the embarcadero center and just a few minutes away from the ferry building! Would book again.

review.title: Perfect for those who do not need frills.
review.reviewText: Club quarters provides the basics. Comfortable bed, desk, good lights, free internet, and a closet where any guest can pick up more coffee and basic supplies. The room even has USB charging ports. But no frills. No room service. No fancy spas. So what? Thee is a lobby room with free coffee, newspapers, reading room, and a few computers.

review.title: Nice Business Hotel Close to Financial District
review.reviewText: I always stay here when I come alone to San Francisco. The rooms I book are small and compact and not furnished with storage for a long stay - perfect for two or so days. I have had rooms on high and low floors, all sides, inside and out and all have been perfectly satisfactory. Small changes seem to occur continually indicating that the management is keeping their eye on the property. There always seems to be airline crew activity which I take as an indication of good value.
review.negativeRemarks: Satisfies all my needs and it's clean.
review.locationRemarks: Location near BART and other public transportation. Proximity to numerous very good restaurants.

review.title: nice hotel in financial district
review.reviewText: pleasant staff, helpful with questions, very comfortable bed and we had a street side room on 2nd floor, was quiet until picketers across the street started in with their megaphones at 7:00 am boycotting the hotel on the other side of the street. of course Club Quarters had no control over this and at no fault but they promptly brought us up a couple pair of ear plugs when requested. There's chilled purified water avail on each floor that you dispense into personal size water bottles with cap that they provide which I thought was different and cool, and down by the lobby theres a fancy coffee machine that dispenses reg coffee, capachino, or latte, snacks, cooler with soft drinks all included, I had no need to go to Starbucks on the corner, the Latte out of the machine was awesome, upscale! My only neg comment about the hotel might be the area. everything around the hotel vloses early! even Walgreens, Starbucks and mcDonalds in the area were closed by 6pm on a Sunday night! crazy! The restaurant/bar right next to the hotel were open til like 10 or 11 though. I would recommend this hotel, just prepare for the early closings :)
review.negativeRemarks: no coment
review.locationRemarks: location nice but not much to do in immediate vacinity in eve

review.positiveRemarks: hotel takes care of the basic necessities really well (clean room, well appointed and functional bathroom, great city location) for a reasonable price

review.title: Great staff and look, be aware of room size
review.reviewText:
The first thing that struck me about this hotel is that it looks very nice. It's bright and tastefully decorated. The second thing that struck me is that the staff are very friendly and helpful. The only interaction we had with them was checking in, having some things explained to us, and checking out, but interacting with them was a pleasure. Another thing that made a positive impression is that there is chilled, filtered water available in the hallway, free of charge.

I definitely recommend this hotel. The only thing to be aware of is that their smaller rooms can be a bit cramped. If you are there with more than one person and you are considering upgrading to a larger room, I would very much recommend that you do so.

review.title: Great for the price and location
review.reviewText: Honestly the location alone would have made this a great deal! You can walk (or catch a bus, cable car) to Fisherman's Wharf or the Embarcadero / Pier 39 on one side and shopping and attractions of Market St. Chinatown and North Beach on the other. The staff was happy to direct us to local attractions but we had a great time just walking out and exploring. The room was a little small but still very comfortable and there's so much to do you don't need to stay in the room much anyway. It's also nice that they have a restaurant attached in case you don't feel like going out for dinner but want something better than typical room service food. Another plus is free WiFi and if you don't have a laptop there are Macs to use downstairs in the guest "living room" and business center. Overall it was a great time and I will likely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, convenience, price, close to lots of transportation
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a little small but to be expected for the area
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf / Pier 39, Shopping on Market Street, scenic tours of SF

review.positiveRemarks: It was very clean, convenient to my destination for visiting and friendly

review.title: Amazing hotel right in the center of everything!!!
review.reviewText:
WOW!!! I am travelling a lot and to be honest and it is far from easy to impress me; yet after staying in Club Quarters I am simply stunned! The location, the service, the room are amazing VALUE for the overall price I got. I mean - I was able to save hundreds of $$$ and get much better offering and service than nearby Hilton or Meridian hotels...

Sarbi from the hotel staff was simply unbelievable - so polite, prompt and professional! I never seen such a pleasant host!

Next time I know that I don't need to check - Club Quarters will be my choice of stay!

THANKS!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! Free WIFI, amazing guest corner at the lobby [MACs :-)], coffee etc!!!
review.locationRemarks: Walk the streets :-) Enjoy the weather :-) China town, Italian neighborhood... EVERYTHING IS NEARBY!!!

review.reviewText: Very accommodating staff. No onsite parking but ramps nearby. Mostly small but serviceable rooms (some are larger).
review.positiveRemarks: Good value, location near business centers

review.title: Loved it!!
review.reviewText: Me and my wife love it here..we will stay here everytime we are I. The city..other hotels are to risky. This place is great!

review.title: Eh, not my favorite
review.reviewText: This is probably a good hotel for an over night stay for business... Not for a fun weekend. A very bare bones, small room. Clean though. It was just "ok".

photos.caption: Irish bank pub, a must stop

review.title: Close to everything!!!
review.reviewText: We had a good experience with the hotel we had no need for a rental car we could walk to everything good location, room was kind of small but it was nice. Easy check in and out with the automated system.

review.title: Love all the free snacks/fruit and bottled water.
review.reviewText: A solid business hotel with outstanding consideration for customers.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: I will stay here again on my next visit

review.title: Elegant but not pricey
review.reviewText: Excellent morning staff, room and terrace were simply amazing. Definitely worth it.

review.title: Not worth the money!!
review.reviewText: Take your money elsewhere. Freezing cold, heater was very loud, shower was a joke, old, no water pressure, staff could care less. Terrible!
review.negativeRemarks: everything

review.positiveRemarks: Great value, outstanding location and very clean.

review.title: Convenient and access to many places by walking
Different, but very good.
review.reviewText:
The check in/out kiosk was a new experience, but actually very quick compared to regular front desk check in. Rooms were small, but had everything I needed.
Since it wasn't that large of a hotel, going to the lower lobby to get ice/etc. was OK, but again, different than what I'm used to.
Loved the comforter. Hated the size of the bathroom counter (way too small).
Overall an unexpected, but nice stay. Would definitely recommend.
Also - having Elephant Castle connected was a huge plus - and their prices were fairly reasonable for San Francisco.
Location is great - nice walk to the water.
Try to get near the elevator - halls are never ending.
review.positiveRemarks: Location - ease of check-in/check-out Comforter (I want one!!!!)
review.negativeRemarks: Counter space in bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero - ferry to Larkspur very convenient if you don't mind a 10-15 walk. Weather was wonderful so no problems for us.

review.positiveRemarks: Convenient and comfortable, with friendly and helpful staff.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the Ferry Building.

review.reviewText: Although the room was small, it was clean and cozy. As expected, the complimentary coffee was terrible, but once again, it was free. The staff was very professional and helpful. The location was great and the price was just right. If I need to stay in the area again, most likely will stay there in the same hotel.

review.title: Great Place and affordable
review.reviewText: Everything was clean and the staff was accommodating. I'd stay there again.

review.positiveRemarks: Great location in the Financial District. Rooms are small but nice. Staff is friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great stay, bad room 1st time
review.reviewText:
The stay was great, but as soon as we got our first room we tried our key card and it wouldn't let us in. Then after reactivating card got into the room and it wasn't cleaned.. And some dudes underwears were in the restroom like he just left.

They have us an upgrade which was very nice, other than that the stay was great.

review.positiveRemarks: Convenient, quick check-in, free wifi, books in the room

review.title: i would highly recommend
review.reviewText:
this was an anniversary and birthday weekend in San Francisco. This was the lowest price room rates in the city of a 3-4 star hotel, so my expectations weren't too high. i was greeted by very polite staff. they let us know where to eat, where to shop, where to park. they did everything for us except go to the locations with us.

we told them why we were there and the next day after our room was cleaned we recieved a book on san francisco and some chocolates, we even got a letter from the front desk signed saying "Happy Birthersary". we couldnt stop laughing.

We ordered room service that was brought to the room hot. they even brought me my beers i ordered.

if you want to stay in the city, the financial district is where to stay. and the Club Quarters is the hotel to be at.

Thank you guys for everything, if you're reading this. :-)
review.negativeRemarks: free parking at the parking garage or at least something less than $20 a day
review.locationRemarks: It's in the financial district, everything is a BART ride, a walk, or a drive away. close to the bay bridge.

review.title: Comfy, quiet and great location!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel! Restaurant and bar (and Starbucks) located downstairs and next door. Great rooftop patio and conveniently located for the business traveller or the tourist.
review.positiveRemarks: The quietness of the area, the proximity to the embarcadaro, Starbucks being downstairs, the rooftop sitting area, ......just about everything.
review.negativeRemarks: The suite was advertised as being able to accommodate 4 adults. The bed was very comfortable, but the sofabed was really only big enough for one.
review.locationRemarks: About a mile to Union Square, Pier 39, Coit Tower, and lots of other San Francisco sites. Located in the the financial dist., so quiet on wknds.!

review.title: Too small of a room
review.reviewText: Came here for our anniversary weekend and the room is more like a dorm. Would not recommend this to friends unless they were here for business.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Great, clean property within walking distance of China town, the embarcadero and union square. Rooms are very small but clean and aesthetically appealing. The water filtration system is a nice touch. I stayed here during the Nike Women's Marathon and it was a great choice for the price and convenience.

review.title: Nice hotel easy to find, easy check in check out.
review.reviewText: I stayed there with my daughter and son for the Nike Women's Half Marathon. It was within walking distance of union square and a nice restaurant right next door was nice.

review.title: Noisy hotel
review.reviewText: It was noisy on a Friday night till 3am. When I called downstairs, no one picked up. The rooms are tiny and there was no bath tub.

review.title: The nicest hotel I've ever stayed at.
review.reviewText:
As a solo traveller 'fresh' off the 9 hour bus journey from LA, to wind up here (as it was one of the few rooms lefts in the city) was a very pleasant surprise. Ok, so it was out of my hosteller's budget and made for a classier breed of guest than a hippy chick in yoga pants and grubby flip flops BUT all the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming.

The room was gorgeous. I could starfish in the bed and not touch the sides. Every little detail had been attended to. No kettle here - you get your own coffee maker. I didn't borrow an ipad or request a yoga kit to be delivered to my room (I mostly wanted to sleep, wash and eat in that order) but it was nice to have the option.

I woke up 4 minutes prior to check out time and they were flexible about extending late check out (for a small cost).
review.positiveRemarks: The luxury, the professionalism of the staff and attention to detail. The sun deck on the roof is worth a peak too!

review.title: Nice hotel, close to union square
review.reviewText: I enjoyed out satay here, aside from the gentleman at check-in and the surprise of two twin beds instead of two queens. The hotel staff and rooms were very nice. There were a lot of amenities that you could use during a business or pleasure trip. And they had this rockin water bottle fill up station in our hall. When asked for extra pillows and a roll away bed they were delivered to our room in less than 5 minutes.

photos.caption: 2 twin beds DOES NOT equate to a queen size bed. Just sayin'

review.title: Does 2 twin beds equal a queen size bed?!?!
review.reviewText:
Normally, the standard queen size room goes for $179-229. However, it suddenly dropped to $119 so I quickly took advantage of it. Score!!!!

Well all know, driving through the streets of SF is crazy. Locating your hotel at night that does not have a visible sign makes it even worse. After driving in circles, we finally found the property. We self-parked at the Embarcadero Center; quite convenient as it is a 4-5 minute walk to the hotel. Check-in via the self-service kiosk was hassle free and quick. It took less than 1 minute to receive my room key.

The room size was relatively small, but that was expected. It was clean and modern.

When we got back to the hotel about 3am, all we wanted to do was sleep. Well, as we turned around to kiss each other, we felt a pronounced bump/divider in the middle of the bed. Yes, we were sleeping on 2 beds pressed together. Say what?!?! I know. Shook head in disbelief. I purchased a room with a queen size bed. Furthermore, Expedia's site specified queen bed in the hotel details. Since we were tired and intoxicated, we shrugged it off and slept.

Later that day it was bothering me so I called the hotel and expressed my concern. Surprisingly, the female front desk saw nothing wrong. She did not apologize and replied with a generic answer. Who in their right mind would think 2 twin size beds pushed together equates to a queen bed? Really?

Deceptive business practice? Perhaps. For this reason alone, I would NEVER recommend this place.
review.locationRemarks: Right across Embarcadero Shopping Center. 10 minute walk to Chinatown and 15-20 minute walk to Union Square (a bit far).

review.title: Small rooms are fine, thin walls are not!
review.reviewText: I actually quite liked the small rooms that had everything I needed for a weekend stay. Unfortunately, the tight quarters apparently means paper thin walls. The first of two nights I was woken up about 4 times by the noises of people walking the halls and talking in their rooms as well as street noises through 2 a.m. Not fun. Management switched me to a higher floor away from the street to help; unfortunately new neighbors engaged in late night....er...activities...and their noises came right on through the walls, the whole time, as if they were in the same room. Being an unwilling voyeur (auditeur?) was disturbing. So, I slept badly both nights despite changing rooms and I would look hard before staying here. And bring earplugs.

review.title: A clean, quiet, comfortable bed.
review.reviewText: We live in the North Bay and stayed at this place for a weekend music festival. We were gone from early A.M. till late every night and this place is pretty easy to get public transits. Close to BART/MUNI/buses, which we needed since we took transit into the city to avoid parking hassles. We walked to the farmer's market at the waterfront for breakfast one morning. The rooms are on the small side and pretty basic but met our needs. Was really clean and quiet.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Easy to get everywhere. Buses, trains, trolleys, street cars everywhere. Short walk to the ferries/waterfront. Walk to China Town.

review.title: Nice and friendly hotel in financial dictrict
review.reviewText: Clean and comfy room with all amenities, silent location, very friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Peace and Quiet
review.reviewText: This was my first time ever making a hotel reservation as my husband has always done that in the past. I wanted to surprise him, and he said I did a great job!! It was nice and peaceful and had everything that we needed. It's in the business district so we didn't have the best view but that was of little consequence considering it still shed a good amount of light in the room. The hotel staff were helpful and polite, and not that we're concerned about stalkers or anything, but it's nice to know that only hotel staff and guests have access to the floors above the lobby.
