review.positiveRemarks: It was just far enough away from all of the crazy traffic of Market Street but close enough that if I wanted to go shopping I could with little effort
review.negativeRemarks: Well it appeared they were doing a bit of remodeling so the front lobby was a bit cramped for space. Once that is done I'm sure it will be fine though
review.locationRemarks: It's literally minutes away from everything. Shopping, dining Fisherman's Warf, etc. are all just 2 or so blocks away

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great if you are wanting to go to Fisherman's Wharf. Actually a pretty short walk. It's across from the Embarcadero also. We were able to walk to the Wharf without having to get a taxi or worry about driving. They were doing some renovations to the front desk with was fine. The room we had was very small and the bathroom needs updating which makes it look "un-clean". Hopefully they have to plans on renovating their bathrooms as well.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms. Very out dated and not as clean.
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero and the Wharf

review.title: SF vaca
review.reviewText: Stayed while touring SF for 3 days. Good location, staff was accommodating and friendly. We would stay again.
review.locationRemarks: Tour stops nearby. Easy walk to China town and other attractions.

review.title: Great hotel in the Embarcadero area!
review.reviewText: Great hotel and the location was ideal, located in the Embarcadero area and within walking distance to Union Square. The room was quite small but we were only there for 2 nights so was fine, great facilities in the room like free wi-fi, coffee making and a small fridge. Would definatley stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The free Wi Fi and refrigerator in the room. The location was ideal.
review.negativeRemarks: The lifts were really slow, so feel this could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Located in the Embarcadero area and within walking distance to Union Square. Elephant & Castle which is just next door was great for breakfast.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: I paid $260.00 for a one night stay on a Mon. night in a room the size of a shoebox, and another $32.00 for parking.There was building construction going on in the lobby and I could hear noises coming from the unit next door throughout the night. The staff was friendly and helpful, but that only goes so far. I feel like it was completely overpriced and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: validated parking, room size, lower rates especially on weekdays

review.title: Hotel club quarters
review.reviewText: I was charged an extra 80 dollars for some reason I have no idea why, the hotel charged me double the parking cost (72$) so my bank account went negative and I had absolutely no money for my trip I had planned weeks in advanced. When I called the hotel manage he never returned my called or even sent a courtesy email to let me know that my account was credited back, which they only gave back 47$

review.title: very nice place to stay
review.reviewText:
great service and very close to the piers for most major attractions.
had an incident with a flooded bathroom at 3.00am, and there was a guy to fix the problem within 10 minuets.
the adjacent pub served good food and great beer.
thoroughly recommend this hotel to any body visiting San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: clean rooms and very helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: views from the rooms not the best
review.locationRemarks: very close to the wharf

review.title: Funky alternative to Financial District hotels
review.reviewText:
Great experience and excellent location in the Financial District. Room was small but stylish, clean and comfortable--excellent deal for the price! And they have FREE IPADS to check out during your stay (and free wifi too!)
I had a late arrival and needed to grab dinner--on a Friday night the bar/restaurant downstairs was closed, but so was everything at the Onmi Hotel just across the street. The helpful front desk put me in touch with a local Italian restaurant who delivered a great pizza at about 1am for only about $15 (room service anywhere else would have been double that!).
review.positiveRemarks: Free Ipads during your stay! And free bottled water!
review.locationRemarks: Bars/restaurants close by 11pm or midnight on the weekends (and probably earlier during the week so plan ahead).

review.title: Nice place, they dont try to pinch every cent
review.reviewText: Nice place, nice location, bed could be more firm, a bit too soft

review.title: Very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Very friendly and accomodating staff. Well mainatained facility. The only drawback(not really a drawback) was a little distant from Union Square, which is the center of the city. Bus ride from or to the hotel is a little limited. I liked the living room in the back of the hotel where there are sofas, PCs, free water or coffee.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really
review.locationRemarks: A little distant from the center of the city. Close to Embarcadero center or the Ferry building, market place China Town

review.title: Nice hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: A nice, simple, clean hotel in the financial district close to Bart, great restaurants, the Ferry Terminal market, the waterfront and downtown.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and great location with good transportation access to other parts of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Very good as it is.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great with easy walking to downtown, the Ferry terminal market and Bart which I used to go to Pleasanton, Berkeley and Oakland.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel, staff very helpful. Although billed as non smoking, first room had been smoked in and had stale atmosphere. Staff were very apologetic and immediately moved us. Whoever cleaned the first room must have known better, which is a pity
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, very friendly, good coffee and snacks
review.negativeRemarks: Retrain the cleaners
review.locationRemarks: Walk along waterfront, great access to the America Cup Park and Alcatraz Pier (both 15 minutes walk), great restaurants and bars very close.

review.title: Excellent place to stay, on short notice.
review.reviewText: Found the place on internet. Booked 2 nights before actual stay. Staffs are super friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: cost, location and have all the basic necessities.
review.negativeRemarks: coffee --- tasted water-down.

review.title: It was exactly where we needed to be!
review.reviewText:
I loved every part of it. Great location, staff...facilities.
Loved the coffee and snacks and availablitity of drinking water, that most take for granted.
review.negativeRemarks: not much.
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to chinatown and the ferry farmers market.

review.title: Comfortable, excellent location, good wifi
review.reviewText: The location was very convenient, an easy walk from Market Street and the Embarcadero. I was particularly happy with the fast wifi connection.

review.title: Winding down before the flight home
review.reviewText: Having stayed on Market Street the night before as part of a tour group I was really impressed by this hotel & it's surroundings. Really comfortable hotel with good facilities & fast free wifi . In the FD district it is close to the trans America building. Short walk to Chinatown & Union Square. Hotel staff very helpful in arranging my transport to the airport. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel in a good location for a reasonable pri
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location, very friendly and helpful staff. Unfortunately the restaurant was closed for staff training, and our TV did not work (not a great problem as we were only staying for one night).
review.negativeRemarks: Television did not work, and the restaurant was closed for staff training
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to the wharf, Nob Hill and China Town, BART stop is only a few hundred yards away

review.title: Ugh!
review.reviewText: I'm usually the type of person that will read a few reviews on the place where I will be staying and if I see a bad review here and there I'll still give the place a chance because not everyone experiences the same thing and maybe just maybe the hotel has changed. Not this time and not this place. The staff was friendly and very helpful but that's as far as it went. It was like a mini maze to get to my room, the hallways were dirty and smelly, the room was small and had a very very strong smell (not a good smell either). I will never be staying here again. I would only recommend this place to party animals...haha. ;)
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms. Need to be more clean and smell nice, not like cigarette smoke, vomit and feet.
review.locationRemarks: Eh, hotel was a little difficult to locate. As for things to do near by...shop and drink.

review.title: Holiday Inn experience at three times the price
review.reviewText: Adequate if you must stay in the Financial District, but there are much better choices at the same price point in SF. The rooms are small and dark with dorm-room-like furniture. It is on a noisy corner and you can smell the kitchen from the restaurant on the first floor if your room window is open. The computerized check-in is almost insulting at this price point, although the desk staff was perfectly nice. I am not a Club Quarters member but also stayed at one off their New York properties, which was much nicer.

review.title: Well run hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: First time visitor to San Francisco I chose this hotel for it's location and was not disappointed. The hotel is very well run, clean rooms, endless bottled water, and self serve laundry (free) all make for a very pleasant stay. Just one criticism, no fridge the room which is a pain, otherwise great hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: A small fridge in the room would be helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk down to the waterfront and then along to Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Convenient for business in China town
review.reviewText: Pleasant hotel. Plan on using the hotel again in the future
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant food
review.locationRemarks: China town is 3 blocks away

review.title: on Market and Battery
review.reviewText: just slept there and it was comfortable and quiet. nothing glamorous, but acceptable.

review.title: No Frills
review.reviewText:
This hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly. Both of these things are VERY important to me.

If you want nothing more than a bed and a bathroom this is the place you want to book. There is no pool, not hot tub, the rooms are very small. It is centrally located and is within walking distance to Pier 1 and the Embarcadero.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, the staff was nice, and it was close to the Embarcadero and BART
review.negativeRemarks: A bar on the roof top would be nice. Also the adjoining restaurant does not serve very good food.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to the Embarcadero and BART

review.title: Nice hotel in a geat location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very polite and friendly.The room was very but we could find everything we needed. It was clean enough to feel comfortable. There was an excellent English pub next door which served delicious breakfasts and dinners.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location best and the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: The towels need to be renewed and they should find another solution for the sheets and the duvet because it was not easy to keep the sheets in form.
review.locationRemarks: It is a business district but you can reach most of the touristic regions on foot like the market, the piers and the cable bus.

review.title: good
review.reviewText:
It was good. Good location. Excellent Staff.
Beds are short. It was nice to have coffee, tea, and other at lobbie.
review.negativeRemarks: size of bed
review.locationRemarks: very good

review.title: Great central location; close to all attractions!
review.reviewText: This hotel is top-notch. Location is excellent! Staff is excellent! My wife loved the free (and awesome) coffee machine in the street level snack room.ONE NOTE TO KNOW: there is no continental breakfast or snacks of any kind during the weekend. This hotel chain is a membership-based business, so if you are getting this room, it is because they sell the extra rooms to non-members. SO, during the tourist weekends, the member amenities (such as awesome snacks, free soft drinks, etc.) disappear. They have FREE filtered water on each floor, with FREE water bottles for the taking! The rooms are small, but so what; are you there to stay in the room the whole time? If so, they still offer enough room to do what you want. This rating is for a king-sized bed only. I don't know about the other rooms. Also, the room had a refrigerator and a microwave! The shower was great - no tub for you soakers though. McDonalds is a couple of blocks away. There is a restaurant/bar that is right next door with great food. You are within walking distance of a plethora of entertainment, restaurants, the piers, and more! Highly recommended!
review.negativeRemarks: Let us non-members in on the amenities!
review.locationRemarks: too numerous to detail

review.title: Not like last time
review.reviewText: We stayed here two years ago and had a great stay. This visit the bed was small and the room was dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Close to North Beach area.

review.title: Good value for money....great staff
review.reviewText: We found the room and the hotel generally to be adequate for our requirements .for the two days that we had in san Francisco .....staff were very helpful in all aspects, the room whilst clean and tidy,was getting to the stage that would soon require a bit of a face lift.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe the decor
review.locationRemarks: Great for us,not far from the ferry terminal,and only a few blocks from the cable car.

review.title: Club Quarters in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights and have stayed here before. Its always clean and the Hotel staff know their way around the town so they are great for directions. For the price this is a great hotel and we will be back soon.
review.positiveRemarks: Its clean, confortable and the price is good.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, wine bar, coffee house, 2 blocks from the Ferry Building plus you can walk to Union Square, its not too far.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Great location close to a terrific restaurant called The Wayfare Tavern. Loved the convenience of having the Elephant Cafe (pub) next door as well. 10.00 cab fare to Fisherman's Wharf. This hotel was a great find!

review.title: 2nd Visit Just as Good
review.reviewText:
We visited San Francisco for the Fourth of July this year, for our 20 year anniversary. We stayed at the Club Quarters 5 years ago when we visited San Francisco. We love the small, quiet nature of the hotel. We really enjoy that the hotel is centrally located to many sights in the city, and we loved that where ever we went in the city, we could look back and just walk towards the TransAmerica Tower to get back to the hotel.
Thank you
review.negativeRemarks: Transportation options available- we could not get a cab/taxi unless we were going to the airport.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown Port of San Francisco Fisherman's wharf (2 mi) Coit Tower (1.5 mi) Ghirrardelli (2mi)

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText:
Hotel location it great. Close walk to waterfront and trolleys.
Staff at the hotel are slightly cold and are not welcoming at all!! we asked one for directions to the freeway and he had no clue! Weird.

The rooms are very small but clean and in good condition overall. Was enough for the two of us but would not be for more than 2 ppl in the room. Not much space to move around. Shower only, no tub.
Beds are clean and comfy.

Parking is across the street and is $32 overnight!!!
40 if u want to use the car during the day.
But I guess that's expected in the big city. Just be prepared

Overall a nice hotel, but not for those who prefer spacious high end rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, beds are comfy and hotel is clean
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be more helpful and nice
review.locationRemarks: Close to waterfront and very central to a lot of things in the city. Trolley system close by for moving around

review.title: Another night in town visiting
review.reviewText:
Pros
Walking distance 1 block away from the pier or view of the bay bridge
Walking distance 5-6 blocks mall, shopping area
walking distance up 2 or 3 blocks towards north beach and china town
Great locations if your planning on shopping or doing some site seeing
Water each floor and complimentary breakfast (SNACKS) late night beverage
Cons
Room small I felt so stuffed up in the first room so I had asked the front desk to switch room. Ask for side of clay st better view and a little bit more space. but dont count on a huge space lol
No free parking you have to find st parking or park at the Garage around the conrner $32 over night parking
review.positiveRemarks: I like how you dont have to wait for check in you can just check yourself using your credit card
review.negativeRemarks: Checking out service part the machine didnt want to print out my check out slip or have somebody helping us to check out.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby downtown northbeach and the pier good for a nightout or site seeing during the day time.

review.title: Good value and good location.
review.reviewText: Not 5 stars by any means, but clean, comfortable, good location, and great staff.
review.positiveRemarks: An excellent value for downtown S.F.
review.negativeRemarks: A king bed would be nice.

review.title: Nice hotel in Financial District of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Club Quarters in San Francisco was conveniently located to many attractions (Embarcadero, Ferry Building, Financial District, Chinatown, Union Square, Cable Car stop) via foot or public transit. The room was a bit small, but we didn't stay there long, so it didn't really matter. The room was comfortable overall. It would have been nice to have breakfast included at the hotel, but there were places to eat not far from the hotel. Overall, the location was good, and the room is comfortable for a long or short stay.

review.title: Nice Stay!!
review.reviewText: I am very happy on deciding to choose this hotel, the staff was very friendly, easy check in and out, free water, coffee, tea. Previous people stated the rooms were small, I expected much worse after their reviews, but let me tell you the room is fine! We stayed in the smallest room available it has a bed, toilet, shower, nice view of the financial district from room, it was clean and cozy, what more do you need? We walked from the hotel to Chinatown, att park to see the Giants play, the Trans-america building, Pier 39, Pier 33 to go to Alcatraz. The restaurant/pub attached had good food and drinks, conveniently located right next to the hotel. Would definitely stay again and recommend this hotel to anyone going to SF!!
review.negativeRemarks: cant think of anything
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to chinatown, att park, pier 33, pier 39, fishermans warf, union square, many restaurants and bars

review.title: Simple stay
review.reviewText: On a 2 day business trip - and the hotel was conveniently located to my meetings. Self-service kiosks made check-in and checkout quick (no lines). Lobby computer areas made access to the public printer convenient for printing my boarding pass (though the first computer I tried wasn't working right). Pretty straight-forward accommodation - no bells or whistles.
review.positiveRemarks: self-service kiosks were great - so I didn't have to wait in line.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor was pretty dark and outdated.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText:
The hotel is well situated, close to China Town and also convenient to a large 24hr Safeway store where you can get food/drink etc. A short walk to Union Square. The rooms are small.
I found most of the staff at the front desk somewhat unhelpful and they would turn away when we approached and not acknowledge us. One girl, Jenny was the standout and extremely helpful.

The pub next door, Elephant and castle had a great atmosphere and was great for drinks, snack and/or meals. The staff there we very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The Elephant and Castle Pub next door
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk staff (apart from Jenny)
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Great Hotel. Staff was great. Location was the bes
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. Staff was great. Location was the best. Rooms were not largel, but sufficient. Not for large family
review.positiveRemarks: Staff. Location. Free self serve water bottles
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Parks. Embarcaro market. BART subway.

review.title: Great experience at Club Quarters
review.reviewText: I stayed here for one night on the 4th of July and I was very pleased with my stay. Hotel is clean, and very attractive. I enjoyed the free coffees and tea, along with the fridge and microwave in my room. Cold air conditioning, clean bathrooms, comfy bed. I was pleased with the room and I did enjoy the commentary water purifier and recycled water bottles they offered. I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room Clean lobby Good accommodations Location was good
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps offer a discount for the parking garage
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown nearby. Financial district nearby, embarcadero within walking distance

review.title: Good location, nice and chill
review.reviewText: My first visit to San Diego with the beloved one. It was relaxing and unforgettable.
review.positiveRemarks: The design of the hotel looks modern and exquisite. Luckily our room is not the one adjacent to the street so it was not that noisy.
review.negativeRemarks: The check out time could be prolonged till 2pm. Didn't get the chance to enjoy the pool due to the tight schedule.

review.title: Classy Hotel but watch out for parking!
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay at this Hotel once we upgraded from the Club size room to the one room suite with Kitchenette. The club size room was just too small for us. We were two people staying for two nights and found this room to be very roomy and comfortable. The room came with a sofa that had the pull out couch so this room could be good for a family of four. We were impressed that the Kitchenette came fully stocked with kitchen utensils for cooking. The Front Desk staff were very helpful in booking tours, upgrading accommodations and parking. NOTE: Hotels in the financial district of San Francisco do not have their own underground parking, therefore you will have to pay for overnight parking in a parking structure close to the Hotel. One nice feature is the English Pub and Restaurant at the Hotel. We enjoyed the food there and I particularly liked the Chicken Wrap in the Balsamic Glaze. It was very good. Another nice feature was the Hop-On/ Hop-Off sightseeing tour bus that stops across the street from the Hotel. It takes you to all the historic and popular sites of San Francisco. NOTE: If you would like to see Alcatraz, either book it in advance or see about getting tickets from one of the sightseeing tour companies as a package. We were unable to buy tickets the day of our visit because it was all sold out. It was a very nice stay for us at Club Quarters.
review.positiveRemarks: The room accommodations and the very helpful staff.

review.title: Great Weekend!
review.reviewText: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our wedding anniversary weekend. Our room was spacious and inviting.

review.title: Perfect Stay
review.reviewText: As expected we enjoyed our stay. Prime location, great price!

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location and perfect for what we had planned for the weekend. The hotel staff were very polite and accommodating. The room itself was a little small, but not by much and it was very clean. It was properly stocked with everything and for extras there was a guest closet right down the hall. There was free WiFi. There was a lounge with computers, refreshment bar, and plenty of comfy seating.
review.positiveRemarks: Plenty of restaurants and things to do close by.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is near China Town, Little Italy, and close the Fisherman's Warf all up the cross street Columbus.

review.title: Nice Embarcadero location
review.reviewText: Chose Embarcadero location because we were running in WIPRO Marathon & 5K, and it was nice to walk to start & finish lines 2-3 blocks away. It's a quiet inner city area, out of the main tourist attractions. The English restaurant downstairs was good and affordable, with good variety for the whole weekend. For other restaurants had to walk 2-3 blocks or take a bus nearby. Rooms were quiet & comfortable but on the small side. They had free water bottles on each floor, free Wi-Fi, and the parking was less than a block away, although it's $32 per day (I later saw this was average). First time staying in Frisco, would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurant downstairs nice & affordable, central location (perfect location for marathon & related races), also free bottles of water on each floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel parking was not on grounds of hotel, also small rooms (European style).
review.locationRemarks: Very central, but have to walk several blocks to Union Square, Chinatown, or Fisherman's Wharf. Buses easily accessible nearby.

review.title: Hotel for San Francisco Half Marathon
review.reviewText: Easy to get to from SFO via the BART. Staff super accommodating. Room and stall shower was SMALL compared to most hotels but perfect for us as we were out most of the time. Bed and pillows very comfortable, good water pressure, nice size TV, clean and well kept property overall. Especially enjoyed the convenience of the Elephant & Castle Pub downstairs and Starbucks next door. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, clean and comfortable...and the pub!
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything....
review.locationRemarks: We were in town for the Marathon. PERFECT location for event plus the pub downstairs, coffee next door, walk to North Beach Restaurant....

review.title: Basic and unremarkable.
review.reviewText: This hotel is fine for basic accommodations. There is nothing special about it. It's rooms are small but functional. Parking is very expensive and not located in the same building(inconvenient). The staff is nice. The location is convenient to the new Ferry Building and within a short walk to Chinatown.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is close to Ferry Building, Transamerica Building and Chinatown.
review.negativeRemarks: Cramped rooms. Expensive and off-site parking.
review.locationRemarks: In the financial district right next to the iconic Transamerica Building.

review.title: Loved my Stay!!!
review.reviewText:
LOVED MY STAY!!! Great Place for everyone, both business and families.
I never heard of Club Quarters Hotels before, but the hotel and my flight were one package deal. I thought that the hotel would be fair. I was pleasantly surprised to see that it was tastefully decorated and very clean. I even told one of the desk clerks how great the stay was. I was very impressed, and I will definitely stay at the Club Quarters again.
review.locationRemarks: Great San Francisco location. Some great restaurants nearby.

review.title: Not bad for the money.
review.reviewText: I have never slept on a harder and more uncomfortable bed. The amenities were above average. I would stay there again because of the price and proximity to the attractions I like in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Decent hotel at a good price
review.reviewText: The room and hotel were nice, but without many amenities. That's what I was looking for, though: a place to sleep at a reasonable price. The room I had was at the far end of the hotel from the elevator, quite a walk down 3 corridors. At least it was quiet. The free wifi worked well. As with many hotels that are more than a few years old, there weren't enough easily accessible outlets to accommodate my various chargers at the same time (there was a power strip on the desk, but the outlets on it were loose and none of the plugs would stay in place).
review.locationRemarks: In walking distance from the Embarcadero BART/MUNI station, Ferry Building, etc. It is in the financial district; weekends it might get deserted.

review.title: Nice small quaint hotel admist big city
review.reviewText: Lovely quaint hotel in the mist of the city. Rooms are a bit small, but still has everything you would need. They will hold your bags after check out so you can walk around to explore the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms

review.title: Clean, Quiet, No-Frills SFO Business Hotel
review.reviewText: Quick check-in and check-out. Strictly no-frills room with nice working desk and free internet. It was always quiet during my stay May 20-22nd.
review.positiveRemarks: Better priced alternative that is close to financial district. Free filtered do-it-yourself water bottles on each floor.
review.negativeRemarks: No real food facilities at this hotel. The attached Bar & Grill was not good for breakfast - too expensive, slow and very limited choices.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk to the financial district, market street, and the ferry building.

review.title: Hotel was close to the ferry building.
review.reviewText: Very nice and clean hotel. The staff was also very friendly. The attached restaurant had good food.

review.title: Spartan at Best
review.reviewText: The room consisted of a skinny short entry way and a bed. It had a small desk/chair combo along the entry wall, a shower-only bathroom, and a small closet. Each floor had a "community" closet near the elevator if you needed an iron or ironing board (none in your room). No dresser or wardrobe in the room so the only place to unpack your clothes was in the small drawer on the desk! We felt like we were living in a closet for 3 days. No parking facility nor any dsicounted parking associated with hotel. Parking was $32/day at a public lot. I would not recommend this hotel.

review.title: Mediocre hotel near busy street
review.reviewText: The Club Quarters is a mediocre hotel; though, the staff is friendly and helpful, the hotel is nothing that great. The main problem is that the rooms are close to the street and the noise is unbearable at night. One can barely sleep. If you stay there, make sure you ask for a room away from the street (if they have some). Also, and this may sound small, but you need to go to the lower level of the hotel to get ice. Ice machines are not on every floor. Just a small annoyance. Finally, the hotel has no parking and you need to hunt around to park you care - beware of the street signs!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were friendly and attentive.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to the Ferry Bullding and a few blocks away from Chinatown.

review.title: Nice clean room
review.reviewText: Nice clean room. Ideal for the business traveller.

review.title: We liked Club Quarters
review.reviewText: We had a very good experience except for a few inconveniences. We went out for six hours and came back to find our room not cleaned yet. One other thing I should mention is that the water pressure was low, so it took about twice as long as it should to shower. But it was very nice having a water cooler and bottles in the hall. Every time we have to stay in a hotel we always end up thirsty and wishing we had water, so that was a major selling point for this hotel. We discovered the computer room downstairs and another nice room with comfortable chairs and snacks that we could help ourselves to. Also, there was plenty of counter space in the bathroom, and a nice magnifying mirror.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, drinking water and bottles in the hall, magnifying mirror
review.negativeRemarks: Low water pressure

review.title: cramped quarters
review.reviewText: First, the rooms are extremely small - half the size of most average hotel rooms. Second, they are far from clean. The glasses were disgusting, and the bed was uncomfortable. They even had some weird bottled water station, where they recycled used water bottles (the ones you buy at the corner store and peel off the label), and had a tap for you to fill it up -surprised this passed any health code. The ironing boards were stained and stained my shirt. Even if it would have been clean, the size of the room was too small. Won't stay here ever again

review.title: Just right for a business traveler
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a prime financial district location. The hotel was clean and quiet and the staff very friendly. The room was a bit smaller than I am used to, but plenty big for one person (or for two if you don't plan to spend time there other than to sleep and shower). Just be warned that the financial district is a ghost town on nights and weekends, so be prepared to walk a ways if you're looking for more than the attached pub/restaurant has to offer.

review.title: Perfect location for a quick weekend
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the whole experience at CQ. From a quick checkin to the clean and quiet small room we had everything needed. We usually stay at Union square hotel and although room small out experience was top notch. We will stay here again especially because ferry building is so close!

review.title: Club Quarters has tight quarters
review.reviewText: Their smallest room is really not very comfortable for more than one person. There's one chair next to the desk. The TV is mounted over the desk at 90 degrees from the bed. They could have at least mounted the flat tv on the wall opposite the bed. Those are the CONS. The location is convenient, a short walk to Market street, the Embarcadero and also to China Town and Union Sq plus good access to public transport. The lobby is very nice. Free wifi throughout the hotel works nicely. If not for the room size and TV setup I'd have rated it more highly.
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was great! I even left my glasses there and I was able to get them back the next day!

review.title: Excellent hotel in the heart of SF financial distr
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, cozy and quiet room, helpful staff, and excellent value for the money...

review.title: Decent location and lobby. Bed was uncomfortable
review.reviewText: The location was good. The staff was friendly. The hobby was nice. The room was decent enough, fairly small but not bad. It certainly met my needs. The only real complaint I had was that my "Queen" size bed was really two twin beds pushed together. This made sleeping very uncomfortable. But for the beds I would consider staying here again - given the reasonable prices - but because of the bed I'll probably shop around for other locations next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds!
review.locationRemarks: Financial district

review.title: Fantastic.
review.reviewText: Short trip -- very comfortable. Will return. Good location.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean. Location. Spacious. Free water and internet.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have loved the option of a room with a view. Instead=brick wall.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman Wharf, Ballpark, Financial dist, Ferry Building, North Beach, Telegraph Hill

review.title: There are some pros and cons
review.reviewText:
Lets start with the good news. Right downtown, a few minutes walk to Ferry Building Market, staff was really nice even offered us free tickets to the Giants Game, room was clean, great wifi, starbucks on the corner, good room service, they offer chilled water and bottles for free, and free in room coffee and free in the "living room" which I never went into cause it's at the back of the lobby.

Cons: No parking, no vallet, no bellman, rooms are SUPER TINY, parking is expensive $32 which I think should be free or discounted considering it's across the street and very confusing to get back to the hotel. You have to use your room key to get up and down the elevator, if you forget it you're stuck. Ice is in the basement, so you have to go all the way down to get, and yes I forgot my room key and was stuck down there until someone came by with a key. Rooms are seriously small, no bathtub only shower.

My overall opinion is this is a great hotel if you are a single business person needing to be downtown, and are NOT ON VACATION. It's not a "couples" hotel, or really at all for families.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the staff, they were really nice, the restaurant had delicious room service, and wifi was really strong
review.negativeRemarks: At least get a vallet or a bellman to help you unload your car and get you up to your room. This is obviously for people who pack extremely light.
review.locationRemarks: You have just minutes walk to everything, china town, went to the Stinking Rose for dinner, starbucks, on corner, Ferry Building Market

review.title: Great price & location
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable. Staff was helpful and friendly. Rooms are small, but that is typical for San Francisco. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Find!
review.reviewText: Great rates! Very comfy. Safe and central location! We will definitely stay there again!
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: AT&T park and restaurants

review.title: Great place, few minor quibbles
review.reviewText: The hotel is great I got a good rate, during the week snacks are out in the common lounge area. In the weekend when the rate drops, the snacks disappear. A few minor problems, my room was on the 11th floor out of the 3 elevators 1 went there, which meant longer waiting times. The keys were quite unreliable (during my stay I had to get 4 new keys as they stopped working).
review.locationRemarks: Location is great but keep in mind that during the weekend most eating places around the hotel are closed (its in the financial district)

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Overall a nice place staff was extremely approachable and kind
review.negativeRemarks: The parking situation wasn't ideal had to pay an additional 32.00 dollars and it was a half block away

review.title: Would be great if it is around US$150 per night
review.reviewText:
Stayed 2 nights. Nice and quiet place to stay. But room is a bit small for a US200+ per night. The common pantry at the ground floor with coffee, tea, snacks and biscuits is a very nice touch to your hospitality. There is a rack with empty bottles and a water cooler next to the lift. This is very thoughtful of the hotel.

A 7 mins walk to the Ferry Terminal Building where there are many food stores. From there, it is another 15-20 mins walk to Pier 39.
review.positiveRemarks: Empty bottles on the rack of the water cooler. Common pantry on the ground with free flow of coffee, tea, snacks and biscuits.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit expensive for the small room.
review.locationRemarks: In the financial district, so it is relatively quiet.

review.title: Weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Close to buses and BART, shops, even cable cars. My only complaint was the weekend I was there was the weekend they were cleaning the outside windows, something I am sure is not a weekly or even a monthly happening. Decent price, too. I just wish they had one in Portland, OR.
review.negativeRemarks: Window cleaning
review.locationRemarks: Close to Everything, even a Starbucks

review.title: Hidden Gem!
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and helpful. Great location in a clean, safe, convenient area of SanFran. I would definately stay here again the next time I am in town! Shuttle available door to door to and from the airport too for under $20!

review.title: Great hotel for business stay near Embarcadero Ctr
review.reviewText: Very clean, efficiently-run hotel. Though not spacious, the room was impeccably clean, functional, and well-equipped with all of the essential amenities (Wi-Fi, workable office desk, and comfortable bedding/linens) for a short business stay. Convenient location adjacent to Embarcadero Center made it a perfect choice, at a price considerably better than the nearby Le Meridien or Hyatt.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive, in the Embarcadero One parking garage, for $32 per day.
review.locationRemarks: Directly adjacent to Embarcadero One, the Embarcadero Center

review.title: Good place to bunk for the night
review.reviewText: Nice place to get a good night's sleep, and get some work done. Activity in the adjacent street was a bit noisy at night, but that's to be expected in a big city.

review.title: Great business hotel at great rate.
review.reviewText: A very nice no frills hotel. Small rooms but very clean and quiet and perfect for those needing a hotel room mainly for sleep and shower. There is also a desk which provides an adequate work station if necessary. Free wireless Internet and very quiet. Close to Bart.
review.positiveRemarks: Free purified water. Fill your own bottles.
review.locationRemarks: Good business location and close to BART for access to other parts of the city.

review.title: A hidden gem!
review.reviewText: Excellent value for money! Can't beat the location or the service. A minor issue with our room was quickly resolved! They do need to pay more attention to the espresso machine tho; we were never able to have a latte.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, service, and size of room.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee bar needs more attention.
review.locationRemarks: Can't beat it! Right by Embarcadero 1; easy access to BART, Muni, & the Farmers Market at Ferry Plaza. We love walking; it's a great place to start.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Stayed at Club Quarters March 2013 for 4 nights. Hotel was in a great location just 10 min walk to Pier 1 Ferry Building & 5 min walk to China Town. If you wanted to go to Pier 39 you can get the bus outside the Hilton Hotel which is 2 min walk from Club Quarters and cost us $2 each. The Hotel was quiet & the rooms were small but we were very comfortable for the time we spent in the room, not much as there is so much to do in San Francisco. The staff were very friendly & if you needed anything you just asked.

review.title: Great hotel all around.
review.reviewText: Great location, great service and staff...great amenities: internet, water, snacks, coffee.

review.title: Great for business/single travelers or couples
review.reviewText: I wanted to spend a couple of extra days in San Francisco ahead of a conference that I was attending for work, and decided to stay here. The rooms were quite cozy (a little small), but aside from that, this hotel was perfect and just what I needed. It was clean, very nicely kept, was well furnished, and had a Starbucks and English pub right downstairs. The staff was friendly and helpful. It's also in a great location - something I was particularly interested in - walking distance from Chinatown and a cable car line. I definitely recommend it - As long as you don't have your heart set on Four Seasons-class over the top luxury and don't have a big family trying to squeeze in one room. Fantastic deal overall.

review.title: LOVE Club Quarters
review.reviewText: At first the front desk staff assigned rm 207 to us. This was a very small room which faced the inner 'courtyard' (actually the venting system w/plants placed strategically); it was dark and dismal. I requested another room (finally assigned one on the 8th floor facing Battery St) which was airy and bright; much, much better. I was a bit irritated when the front desk clerk (man) told me I had booked a "club room and that's what you're gonna get". Although I may not be a frequent guest at Club Quarters, I would like to be treated as well as the first time I ever registered there.
review.negativeRemarks: They don't offer the hospitality cafetiere on the weekends
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Embarcadero and 2 BART stations;Close to several MUNI stops,close to Chinatown,quiet neighborhood.Rooftop deck to view the Bay.

review.title: Club Quarters Review
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, and the staff was very friendly. It's very central, and a great location!

review.title: Nice surprise in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Helpful staff, nice rooms? Very clean. Fun sun deck was a surprise.

review.title: Parking - ugh
review.reviewText: Parking, though not owned by your company, is outrageous at $32 per night ON THE WEEKEND. Your staff needs to have the ability to offer alternatives, even if you have to use public transportation to get there. Will not stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: no tub
review.locationRemarks: parking is a major cost issue, better off staying in Oakland

review.title: Great quick getaway for work or short stay!
review.reviewText: It was a really nice room. I was hoping for a little fridge, but know that comes with the suite. It would've been nice to have more water pressure in the shower after a long day. We were next to the street, and it wasn't disruptive to our sleep at all. The staff were super friendly and helpful. The room was really clean. No complaints:)
review.negativeRemarks: more water pressure and warm water
review.locationRemarks: near the business district if thats your destination

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco!!!
review.reviewText: Loved, loved, loved, this place!!! It was fantastic. Would recommend to everyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. Friendly staff, free snacks and water. Close to public transportation. Hot water. Everything was great.
review.negativeRemarks: I have no complaints.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Great hotel at good location!
review.reviewText: The staff was tremendously helpful in every regard. We made the mistake of leaving our credit card behind at the restaurant next door. One of staff members went to check if it was there, and mailed it to us. We were impressed overall with professionalism and service they provided.

review.title: Great value, nice service!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location - especially for business travellers. Wonderful value and had everything I needed. Skip others hotel chains and stay here! The staff were very helpful and the wifi and cleaning service were perfect.

review.title: Quiet, clean, safe, great location- Perfect!
review.reviewText:
Pros: Check in was fast and easy, and the staff were helpful and professional throughout our stay. The front desk advised us about a parking garage nearby that charged $32 for a 24-hour stay, or $41 for in/out access. The hotel itself is gorgeous and a great location-- right next door to the Elephant and Castle (great pub food), one block from the Punchline Comedy Club and the Embarcadero Center (with theater and shopping), a short distance from Pier 1/Embarcadero, and very close to Columbus and the start of the North Beach area as well. The hotel elevators require you to swipe your room card to activate the elevator, which we thought was a great security feature. We were on the third floor, with our wall adjacent to an alley, and despite the busy location we heard absolutely zero exterior noise and slept quite well. Check-out was at noon and was easy as can be. We would definitely return and would recommend Club Quarters to friends/family in a heartbeat.

Cons: There were a few stains on the carpet, plus a very small tear in the bedsheet, but those are completely minor issues. Especially considering the price we paid (a great deal through Expedia), which would normally allow you a 2-star room in San Francisco, we thought the entire hotel experience was excellent. We had a wonderful time and would absolutely come back again.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, safe, and located close to lots of great spots. Loved the flags in front, too, made the building easy to locate late at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Loved it all, even the sometimes maze-like hallways were quaint rather than annoying!
review.locationRemarks: Close proximity to the Embarcadero Center, Punchline Comedy Club, Pier 1, Transamerica Bldg & Park, much more.

review.title: Fun weekend with spouse.
review.reviewText: Great location. We enjoyed the quiet room. The bathroom shower was wonderful. Nice ammenities.

review.title: Business travelers recommended
review.reviewText: This would be a wacky hotel to stay in for personal use; it's just heavily oriented towards business travelers. Not a lot of windows with views, lots of other business people around, and rooms oriented towards extended stays. Check-in is a more self service affair and staffing levels are appropriate for that level of automation. It's fine for business though, especially for all week or repeated stays.

review.title: Nice place to stay in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Room was small but was very nice. Location of hotel was great for the business I was performing at the INS, it was right across the street. Parking was expensive, $32/day. Free complimentary water was provided in convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Location was close to Embarcadero Street and downtown San Francisco

review.title: Good Hotel & Location
review.reviewText: Great location & very reasonable price for the city.... Staff was friendly & the hotel room was comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Great location - walked to a lot of restaurants & bars.... cheap cab ride to anywhere else in the city.

review.title: A great weekend stay.
review.reviewText: I was here on a weekend (when Downtown is pretty dead) and they had a great rate for a last minute trip. The hotel staff was very helpful and accommodating with early check in and storage of luggage. I don't know if it's different when it's busy, but they always had time for my special requests.
review.locationRemarks: Near Chinatown

review.title: Superb hotel
review.reviewText: Great location close to many POIs such as Union Square. Staffs were extremely helpful and they provide tons of complimentary service like free coffee and ipad charge cable. Definitely would stay again. Room is a little bit small but fine for single traveler like me.

review.title: Second stay -- and will stay again
review.reviewText: Quiet, clean and safe. Location is excellent. Price at this time can't be beat.
review.locationRemarks: Near the Ferry Building Marketplace, in the Financial District, steps from Chinatown/North Beach!

review.title: A lovely time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was very happy with this hotel. The location is perfect, and I have no complaints whatsoever.

review.title: Affordable Class
review.reviewText: free water bottle on every floor. the mp3 players were cheap but better than no sound hookups, bathroom was nice but no tub in mine, great location. nice desk in the room, and even nicer mac computers in the business center

review.title: Good location. Amenities could be better
review.reviewText: Great location and price. A little disappointed with the in room amenities.

review.title: Best downtown location and super in every way!
review.reviewText: Hotel and staff are the best. Location is convenient to everything. Parking garage is nearby at a very reasonable rate. Will stay here every opportunity I get when a downtown location is needed. Computers and coffee, water available in a wonderful spacious comfy room for all guest.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and quiet! Seemed to b brand new.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to everything.

review.title: A Gem in the Financial District
review.reviewText: Excavation for the hotel revealed the remains of a ship from the gold rush era. This was documented with photos and history and influenced design elements in the building. I was upgraded to a suite for the room price, which was very pleasing. The staff is uniformly pleasant and helpful, and I would definitely pay a return visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Dazzled with extras: bottled water, snacks, coffee 24/7, computer access. Very quiet compared to Union Square area.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit of a hike to Market Street.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for business travelers in the financial district.

review.title: Great hotel to explore SF
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and in a very convenient location. Excellent hotel if you would like to explore downtown SF.
review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel is great. Its conveniently located in downtown and close to many of the SF landmarks.

review.title: Great for business or pleasure.
review.reviewText: Every aspect of the hotel was first rate. Great location for access to the financial district. A little bit far to walk to the Muni/BART though but I made the trek 6 times in two days.

review.title: 5 days over a weekend
review.reviewText: We upgraded to a larger room with small kitchenette (microwave, sink, small fridge). The room is in an odd L shape, so although the room is large from a square foot perspective, it doesn't feel roomy anywhere. The closet was so small it could only fit about 4 shirts comfortably. There were odd and suspicious stains on the couch. The only window had a view of a brick wall about 6' away. They only use Queen beds (I am used to and much prefer a King.) Having said that, there is also A LOT to like about this hotel, and I will likely stay there again. The staff is always pleasant and immediately responsive. One of my favorite things about this hotel is they don't gouge you on incidentals. Free WiFi that was actually fairly speedy for a hotel. Free bottles and purified water - another nice feature. Superb location directly diagonal from Embarcadero 1. If you don't mind the quirky things I mentioned above, this is an unbeatable choice for a budget minded traveler who wants a great location.
review.positiveRemarks: Free WiFi. Free bottled water. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Odd shaped room. Only queen size beds. Middle of the road fixtures. Only "view" was starting at a brick wall of a building about 6' away.
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant location. There's an Elephant & Castle and Starbucks downstairs, and the Embarcadero is across the street diagonally. Great Loc.

review.title: QC is a great concept
review.reviewText:
Great hotel at a great location, access to all kinds of transit
Quiet despite its downtown location

review.title: Fine
review.reviewText: Focus on your experience. Be honest, informative, unique and detailed. Stick to content relevant to Expedia guests.

review.title: Great stay for business
review.reviewText: Great location for financial district. The only negative thing I have to say is that the rooms were a little small. Other than that great stay for the price!!
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the rooms

review.title: Couples retreat!
review.reviewText: Recommended for couples spending a night or two around town specially the pier area or for business people just to sleep and spend the rest of the day outside the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for Pier activities

review.title: Good choice in SF
review.reviewText: Great location, close to BART and other public transportation. Small rooms but very well arranged and didn't seem cramped. Very modern and clean. Decent restaurant and pub on site.
review.negativeRemarks: Great location if using public transportation, but very expensive to park with a car. Some street parking and free on Sunday.

review.title: A place to sleep with above average wifi
review.reviewText: It was adequate enough. Room smelled a little smokey, the window opened up just into the center part of the building so it was pretty dreary. But it was fairly cheap for downtown SF. The Wifi was actually shockingly good for hotel wifi (fast and without long-drawn-out-login-process), so that's a plus. Definitely business traveler oriented.

review.title: Walls are thin
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at two other hotels nearby and this was the best of the three. Bed was most comfortable. The temperature controls were easy to access and use. There shower was just a shower, not a tub with a shower head. I am tall and shower was high enough for me, unlike in other hotels. Also water temp was consistent and easy to control.

I was on 8th floor and could easily hear loud trucks and voices from the street. Also one evening my immediate neighbors were partying and it was like they were in my room. The other hotels also had noise problems, so no big points lost here.
review.negativeRemarks: noise
review.locationRemarks: Dining and groceries are within easy walking distance. Everything is expensive, though.

review.title: cute and simple
review.reviewText: Small but nice.....and yes the staff was very helpful

review.title: Good price for the city and quality of service...
review.reviewText: The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and provided wonderful service.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel has no self parking of it's own. You will need to park in the parking garage nearby about a half block away.

review.title: Great Hotel for Business Travelers
review.reviewText: Awesome amenities; who else lets your check out an iPad during your stay.

review.title: Excellent Hotel ... Great area too!
review.reviewText: Club Quarters was an amazing find off the Internet providing quick and excellent service. I loved our entire stay and enjoyed the professionalism and comforts of the hotel. You are able to quickly check in, quickly obtain what you needed for your room, quickly use the computer to print airline boarding tickets, quickly seek information on where to visit while you stay, and quickly check out. I thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night stay and will certainly come back and recommend the hotel to others. Thank you Club Quarters!

review.title: Liked our stay, but didn't love our stay.
review.reviewText: Clean, safe, quiet, comfortable but a bit of a disappointment for the price we paid. Nothing wrong, but not memorable. Best part was the story of the ship in the lobby.

review.title: Clean, Safe, Great location
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. The minute we walked in the front desk people greeted us immediately and got us to our room. The only negative I had is on the second night a Japanese couple entered the hotel looking for a room. They barely spoke english and the Asian Front desk person was not helpful. Due to this being a members only establishment you can only walk up for a room if a member or buy the room online. Instead of taking them to a computer to do this he was willing to have the customer leave. I then stepped in and help the couple secure their 2 day stay. The front desk person should have done this. Why would someone want to turn away customers.

review.title: A nice short visit
review.reviewText: It's a nice hotel if you're looking for a small, clean room. Staff was friendly and helpful. There are a few places to visit but you have to walk at least 20-30 min. to get to most spots.

review.title: An excellent business hotel.
review.reviewText: One of the elevators was out. Overall a nice hotel.

review.title: OK for economic hotel
review.reviewText:
It is OK to spend night or so. Very economical and efficient, could be too efficient.
Bath was clean but no bath tub, and very small.
Also I was disappointed about Gym.
review.negativeRemarks: Gym, Too small
review.locationRemarks: Good for financial business

review.title: Convenient, comfortable, quiet and reasonable
review.reviewText: Would have liked a couple of extra pillows in the closet. Bed spread was very heavy, no option of a light blanket, sheets and pillows that were there were perfect. We're heading back in a couple of weeks. Parking garage down the street is convenient and reasonable. Definitely seals the deal!

review.title: Efficient and clean!
review.reviewText: The Club Quarters is a very efficient experience. You can find everything you need easily and don't have to contact the staff to do it. It's a very no-frills experience, but the rooms were clean and comfortable and the overall hotel was nice so definitely a good place to stay.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent staff and comfortable room in a very quiet location. It is in the financial district so quite quiet at weekends but there is plenty just a few blocks away. For tourists it is in a very easy to find location too. Close to China town and the waterfront.

review.title: Great hotel, especially for the price in San Fran
review.reviewText: Quiet, clean, safe - for a great price in SF financial district. Close to China Town, BART, Union Square, Ferry Terminal - overall pretty central. Room was VERY quiet - ran the AC fan and did not hear anything. Great for business travel or recreational travel - had fruit/snacks/coffee drinks in lobby - nice touch. Could borrow ipads - good free wifi. Computers downstairs for printing boarding passes. Gym was nice. Would certainly return!

review.title: Clean, small and Cozy:)
review.reviewText: I spent a week in Cub Quarters with my boyfriend. The rooms were small, but we had a good time. Everything was walking distance, and the front desk was very helpful!
review.positiveRemarks: room view, and roof top area!
review.negativeRemarks: room size.
review.locationRemarks: great location! we walked everywhere. great bar/resturant downtairs! and great bakery one block away

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: We accidently made reservation for standard room for 3. We were thinking lil room only bed n bath room, but it was enough space for 3 and We requested roller bed and delivered right after we arrived.. Staff are very friendly and it's bout 20 min from Union Square.. Best location and best service.. I wish there is own parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and close to center of SF
review.negativeRemarks: Very clean , loved purified water wiz bottle
review.locationRemarks: good location , walking distance with where we need to go

review.title: Great hotel for a stay in the city.
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant stay at Club Quarters. The room was comfortable and clean and the layout was nice. You could easily walk to restaurants, shops and the waterfront. The bathroom had a nice sized shower. The room had a fridge, microwave, and was stocked with silverware and plates/bowls. It was also quiet. Parking was $32/night at a garage one block away. The only downside was that the hotel charged $35 for a late check out. But we would stay there again.

review.title: Excellent hotel, great for everyone!
review.reviewText: Great location, clean, with wonderful accommodating staff.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: It was a great location and the hotel was immaculate. Everything was compact but we were out most of the time and the hotel met all of our needs. One block down was a parking structure that had public overnight parking on weekends for $7.00 that was a great savings too. We would recommend the hotel to others and returning on a visit to San Francisco again.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: excellent loacaton, staff, amenities and excellent condition of the hotel.

review.title: Terrible hotel
review.reviewText: no customer service! I will pay more for a better experience elsewhere. This place had terrible management and the hotel is filthy. Corners and edges or the room had build up of dust that looks like it never gets cleaned. No parking garage either. Book another hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness

review.title: Great hotel for the lonely business traveler.
review.reviewText: Hotel is right in the middle of the financial district. Easy walking from hotel to your destination. The wharf is literally 2 blocks away. Hotel is clean and friendly. Rooms are small but comfy. Sort of like an extra large cruise room. The only downfall is that they do not have parking. It's around $32 a day right across the street. For the price you pay it's worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and in the middle of everything.
review.negativeRemarks: parking
review.locationRemarks: close to everything.

review.title: Club Quarters
review.reviewText: staff were helpful, room is small and bed seemed smaller than traditional queen. bed was not particularly comfortable, but room was clean, tidy, probably better suited to individial than couple stays.

review.title: Clean, Close, and not too much Cost :)
review.reviewText: I've stayed in several hotels this past summer for work and some vacation. Club Quarters is at the top of the list in terms of quality and value. Unexpectedly staying in San Francisco an extra day last minute I was able to book quickly and for just a smidge higher than I was looking for - but it was well worth it. In the financial district you're close to some of the best of the city. Also the staff was friendly and quick with getting me to my very clean and well layer out room. Next time I'm in SF I hope I'm staying at Club Quarters: )
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff - the nice clean room and they held my luggage after I checked out so I could take in a bit more city before my plane.
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't get to stay a few more nights....
review.locationRemarks: Near shops, movie theaters, peets, across the street or Starbucks on the corner, Specialties Bakery, close walk to China town

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Excellent business traveller hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Helpfully and attentive staff. Club Quarters does it right again!!!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location near Embarcadero Center and Maritime Building.

review.title: Not my favourite
review.reviewText: It's not a bad hotel and the staff were nice, but the noise proofing in the rooms was terrible, so I could hear what was going on in the hall and above below and next door, as well as when the neighbours turn the tap on / off etc..

review.title: Okay location but not a comfy hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is designed for business type people. It's in the financial district so on weekends it's pretty dead. Walking distance to Fishermans Wharf and Union Square but you'd bring comfortable shoes! Bed wasn't comfy. Room is designed for more of a business man with a nice desk. We stayed here cause it was affordable and location wasn't too bad. Hard to find places to eat on weekends and evenings. Next time we wont be staying in the Financial district; probably in more of a "touristy" location.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very nice. Room kept clean. Easy to find taxis on weekdays. Willing to provide noise machines, humidifiers and air purifiers.
review.negativeRemarks: Uncomfortable bed. Small room.
review.locationRemarks: Okay location. But as I said before we won't be staying in the Financial district again.

review.title: Rooms are small... Construction going on in area
review.reviewText: Noisy, noisy, noisy. Construction starts very early around area. Comforter was scratchy. The room we stayed in was very small. However, it is very close to Muni/Caltrain, restaurants and other shops--which were closed for some reason during the time we were there... We also couldn't get a cab because of a festival that was going on.

review.title: Great hotel for business
review.reviewText: The only big problem is that by 6 pm everything is closed in the neighborhood. No restaurants, stores, etc.

review.title: Not an uplifting experience
review.reviewText: Not an uplifting experience--front desk staff is minimal (and computerized checkin/checkout didn't work well, thus creating a bit of a bottleneck at the desk), the hallways are narrow and dark, and the room was quite small. I couldn't get the heat/AC to the temperature I wanted--it would either overheat or overcool. Even though it wasn't guaranteed in advance, I still had to pay $35 for an early check-in, which meant that I could have stayed at a significantly nicer hotel for about the same price. Location is great for the Embarcadero Center, but that's about all I can say for it. I don't think I'll be back.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room, depressing hallways, short-staffed at the front desk, not good heat/AC system.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for the Embarcadero Center.

review.title: DO NOT BOOK THE ONE ROOM SUITES!!
review.reviewText: I have stayed here several times before and found it to be a good value and clean and comfortable. Knowing that the single rooms are fine, I got a suite so I could accommodate a third adult, thinking it would be as at least as nice as the regular rooms but it was extremely disappointing. Need to warn others to beware of the "one room suites" - these rooms are quite a bit more expensive than the regular rooms but they are worn down, stained, with old furniture, tiny and poor upkeep. Can barely walk around the fold-out bed to get to the bathroom at night. A world of difference from the regular rooms. We even asked to look at an identical layout room on a different floor and it was similarly old and tired. We would have upgraded to the larger suites which have views, but they were booked. "One room suites" face only a brick wall. DO NOT BOOK THE ONE ROOM SUITES!!
review.positiveRemarks: Well located in the financial district
review.locationRemarks: There is a great little hidden wine bar in the alley behind the hotel, also a Czech beer pub.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: Excellent location to the Ferry building; a 5-6 block walk. Room was very clean as well as the bathroom. Bed was very comfortable. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. No problems what-so-ever. Perfect stay downtown. Would do it again if in San Francisco again.

review.title: Great hotel for a couple exploring the city
review.reviewText: Great location, room was clean and the staff was helpful.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk everywhere from the hotel

review.title: average
review.reviewText: no frills so it is fine to sleep in but it is small and the bathroom is lack luster. Not a hotel geared for women.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located, clean, contemporary and anonymous. The room and bed were comfortable with an adequate workspace, free internet. The system for having rooms cleaned was unnecessarily elaborate- emphasis on 'green' issues means guests have to leave a coat hanger on the bed to indicate they want linen changed. Although I complied with this odd injunction the sheets weren't changed. However the staff in general were polite, efficient and responsive.
review.negativeRemarks: elevator

review.title: Nice and comfortable
review.reviewText: Very comfortable. Great area. Close to everything.

review.title: Cardboard box
review.reviewText: Good position. Paper thin walls with noise level high. Not alot of traffic noise after 7pm due to Financial District area. Overall good.
review.negativeRemarks: Cramped and thin walls.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, not far to walk to cable car, or Market St shops, or piers.

review.title: Great value in a great location.
review.reviewText: This hotel is an excellent value. Rooms are on the small side, and the overall feel is a bit spartan, but nice design and quite comfortable. Location is excellent & there is a Starbucks right downstairs. Staff was helpful but unobtrusive.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms are small
review.locationRemarks: adjacent to the Embarcadero Center

review.title: Good location - nice little hotel.
review.reviewText: Great value for the dollar. Rooms are tight but are functional if you plan on being gone most of the day. Well thought out small features that make up for the smallness of the hotel. Would recommend.

review.title: SF Night life
review.reviewText:
Great location,
walk to many clubs no cab needed.

Small room but for SF night on the town
Its all you will need!

Staff is awsome, very helpfull.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: Next to Transamerica bldg.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Very quick checking-in. Great location and very good bar next to the hotel.

review.title: Decent budget hotel, just don't expect too much
review.reviewText: Club Quarters is a pleasant enough budget hotel in a great location. The rooms are clean, if a bit spartan (the room and furniture reminded me of a slightly nicer version of my college dorm room). The staff was helpful and friendly. Just don't expect lots of amenities. For example: The parking garage is about a block away. And you'll need to fetch your own ironing board and iron from a closet near each elevator. I stayed here during Bay to Breakers weekend when every 4+ star hotel in town was charging $500 or more per night. The rate at CQ was much less.

review.title: Anniversary night
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and the bed was comfortable and it was great for a place to sleep but don't expect much. The room was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in and was either really stuffy or too cold. I do have to say that it was really quiet, which is a nice quality.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was REALLY small.
review.locationRemarks: We thought it was closer to AT&T park than it was. But it was nice to take a walk after the game.

review.title: Club Quarters
review.reviewText: The rooftop deck was phenomenal - great view of the Bay and surrounding neighborhood. The desk set-up was a little awkward as it was in the corner. To sit down or get up I kep hitting the wall with the chair. Also the walls were a little thin, I could clearly hear my neighbors talking eventhough they weren't talking loud. I liked the bottled water service - very nice touch. Overall the room was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Could hear my neighbors
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to everything I needed - didn't need a rental car

review.title: Good
review.reviewText:
Just the room is small and no sun come in!
Everything is good!
review.negativeRemarks: No sun
review.locationRemarks: Close to Bart

review.title: A great hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed in this hotel before, always liked it. Rather small rooms, but they're just fine for seeing the city. I don't want to stay in a room all day anyway.
review.negativeRemarks: distance from Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown and North Beach. It's easy to get around San Francisco, lots of buses and Bart stations.

review.title: Hotel stay
review.reviewText: The hotel room is very simple and is meant for people visiting on business. The one thing I was surprised by was they didn't have On Demand and we couldn't order movies in our room which was disappointing. It is a great affordable place to stay but expect the minimum amount of amenities.

review.title: the price is right
review.reviewText: I am an old man -67- and do not like bottles with shampoo, conditioner, soap etcetera that cannot be read as towards its contents without glasses. I prefer to take my showers without glasses. Restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel are marginal.
review.negativeRemarks: only meeting other guests in elevator
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: not bad
review.reviewText: small rooms but worked for me. Clean & comfortable

review.title: LOVED EVERYTHING ABOUT IT!!!
review.reviewText: I loved everything about this hotel from the moment I walked in. I was promptly greeted and guided to the automated touch-screen check in station, where you do everything yourself and it provides you with your room key. The studio queen room is PERFECT for one person, and would definitely work for two. Absolutely adored the fact that there is complimentary, cold, filtered water in every hallway. There is a restaurant attached and Starbucks next door to that. It's only a couple of blocks from BART... it's just perfect! I did not get to explore more than just my bedroom as I was on business and out of the room for most of the visit, but I would recommend this affordable, conveniently located, modern hotel to EVERYONE!

review.title: GOOD PLACE FOR EVERYONE!
review.reviewText: If someone looking a fantastic quality and privacy in the same time, then their choice have to be Club Quarters in San Francisco. Very good staff, very clean room, you can play chess in waiting room of hotel lobby, free clean purified water, and strong coffee multiplied a superb location in centre of Financial District, close to Embarcadero in San Francisco. All these benefits you will have when you will stay there.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect place to spend short or long vacations

review.title: Location, Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and in very convenient location.

review.title: Convenient, slightly run down
review.reviewText: Convenient, economical, small, middling maintained
review.negativeRemarks: space
review.locationRemarks: centrally located walkable to most financial district firms.

review.title: Small rooms in a great location.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in great location. Very good adjoining bar/restaurant. Small fitness room has a several machines and free weights. Rooms were small but very functional.

review.title: Great for the Business Traveler
review.reviewText: Very convenient for the business traveler - great location, plenty of business amenities, close to the Embarcadero, plenty of shopping and restaurants as well as public transportation. My only complaint would be that the room could not be cooled below 68 degrees which is warm for sleeping.
review.negativeRemarks: Thermostat control
review.locationRemarks: Loved it.

review.title: Decent for the proce
review.reviewText: Inexpensive when compared to other hotels in the area. Room was small, but didn't spend much time in it. Was given a smoking room when had requested otherwise and room service entered my room early and woke me up. Overall the hotel was ok for the price, but probably wouldn't stay for more than a night or 2.

review.title: great value and stay four block to Ferry Building
review.reviewText: Always a great staff and clean rooms. Made for business travelers so it has what I need when I'm on the road. Love it!

review.title: near Le Meridien
review.reviewText:
I requested a high floor. Got 5th (there are 10+). The room was not cleaned (grabage, unmade bed, bathroom a mess). called desk and immediately someone met us w/new room. Upgraded size, 9th floor. So, that worked out.
Good location.
review.negativeRemarks: no parking. off-site, short walk. $32/24 hours. Not really a problem, for SF.

review.title: Never agian!!!
review.reviewText: Would not stay there again, heater wasn't working. I left something on the window stall and they insist it's not there! I paid for 2 nights but only stayed 1 due to room issues. My view was a brick wall. Felt like we were in a basement. they refused to change rooms, said they were all booked up. Oh well, never again.

review.title: Great to stay a couple of nights in SF downtown
