review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Good to stay for a couple of days centrally in downtown SF. Good price ratio and clean room, free Web-access in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room, no breakfast
review.locationRemarks: SF Financial District, right next to Transamerica Pyramid

review.title: Great hotel; great location
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and efficient; rooms were comfortable and well equipped. I also liked that we were required to use a keycard in the elevator for added security. The location was excellent. I will definitely return on my next trip and consider these hotels in other cities.
review.positiveRemarks: Efficient and friendly staff; fantastic location.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish our room had a refrigerator; although we could have if we were willing to pay a little more.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic. Close the Ferry Building; Fisherman's Warf; China Town and North Beach. The neighborhood was clean and safe.

review.title: One night in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our room was ready, even on early check-in. The staff was helpful and friendly. The elevator was a bit temperamental, but we got the hang of it. Nice sitting area downstairs to relax and sip coffee. This is not a luxury property. Very business friendly with setups for conducting business, internet, universal device chargers, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was very reasonable, considering the location.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco financial district

review.title: Excellent Housekeeping, Safe Area
review.reviewText: Transfer student from out of state who knows nothing about the city except how to get to school. Housekeeping is EXCELLENT! They work hard, proficiently, above expectation. One in particular became a cheerleader when I tell her how well I did on exams, or encouraging to keep pressing through. Free internet/printing (great for last minute reports - long walk across campus to library), free laundry where detergent is provided, excellent bed, desk and a quiet atmosphere when I did not want to go to the library; plus, limitless strong coffee with cream. There is a Safeway within easy walking distance, a Walgreen around the corner and Muni is a 15 minute walk away. The reviews I read were not good, but when I opened the door to the room I was more than satisfied. Once I learned of the corporate apartments, this took more stress off. I have a secure building and feel safe while waiting to complete my relocation. My focus is the BS in Biochemistry versus sightseeing; therefore, my needs are satisfied.
review.positiveRemarks: Housekeeping service, comfort of bed, free coffee and laundry
review.negativeRemarks: able to hear neighbor who are loud talkers
review.locationRemarks: Safe along with Green Parrots in the park!

review.title: Lovely!
review.reviewText: Good very reasonable business hotel in the heart of San Francisco. It's distinctively British with a British restaurant (Elephant & Castle), British toileteries and the automated lady voice in the elevator also has a British accent.
review.negativeRemarks: No water bottle in the room but there was a cooler on each floor
review.locationRemarks: Perfect - one block from Embarcardero Center

review.title: A comfortable stay
review.reviewText: The staff was great! The recommended parking was at the Embarcadero Center (1-1/2 blocks away) and was $32 for 24 hours. Rooms are small and well designed. The hotel served our purposes for a comfortable stay!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, service of check-in and check-out
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant was under construction. No on-site parking - and that was fine.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent! Within walking distance of the Embarcadero and Financial District

review.title: Location...location...location
review.reviewText: I really like this location. It has everything that I really need, the first of which is location, location, location. When Club Quarters is the location of my multi day stay it's because business takes me to the financial/Embarcadero district. The location is perfect. The rooms tend to be small but they have everything you need. The only thing I wish they did differently is to put an iron in every room. They make them available in a closet down the hall but usually they are already taken. I've learned to not pack anything that wrinkles if I'm staying there.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great, front desk staff is superb and the Elephant Bar Restaurant next door is good. You need your key to get on the elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: While the bathroom was mostly clean the little glass shelves that hold the toiletries was dusty and covered with other people's hair.
review.locationRemarks: This absolutely could not be better located if you have business at the Ferry Building, Embarcadero or the Financial District.

review.title: clean & comfortable
review.reviewText: check in was super easy, parking garage right around the corner. Staff very helpful. Sirens woke us up several times the first night as our room overlooked a busy street. The free filtered water was wonderful, we just happened to have our refillable bottles with us so we didn't even need to use the complimentary plastic ones provided.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the free filtered water!
review.negativeRemarks: Fan in bathroom didn't work, we couldn't open window in the evenings to get steam out of room, due to cigarette smoke from the bar & grill below.
review.locationRemarks: Being in the financial district, most of the nearby restaurants were closed early in the evening, and not open at all on weekends.

review.title: Great hotel! Highly recommend! reasonable price
review.reviewText:
Very good room, and rapid check-in and check-out process
Only bad thing is the location not very convenient to other points

review.title: no parking
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and green, but the fact that there was no available parking and the closest garage was $35.00 a night was a little disappointing when not warned about it first.
review.negativeRemarks: no parking and kiosk check in
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: CQ OK
review.reviewText: Okay. Practical business address. Convenient to the #1 trolley bus.

review.title: High-quality, reasonable SF hotel in great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is not fancy, but the room was extremely clean, front desk staff friendly, and there were cozy touches like books in the room. The location is great, and the neighborhood extremely safe. I'll go back.
review.locationRemarks: The financial district is quite safe in the evening, with interesting restaurants. Good shopping in the Embarcadero district.

review.title: Great deal
review.reviewText: Stayed here for our anniversary. The location was perfect as it was closely situated to muni and Bart stations. Located right next door to a Starbucks and other great places to eat. The room we had was small but was perfect considering we were out and about most the time. A great value in a good area.

review.title: Great hotel at a good price
review.reviewText: Good location in the financial district, not too far from Fisherman's Wharf. The Moscone Center was about a 20 minute walk. Clean, modern room, helpful staff. I had a single, which was perfect for me. Nice security, good area. Nice amenities like chilled water station in hall. Good price, too. I would definitely go back.

review.title: Very nice for the Price
review.reviewText: It's pretty difficult to get a decent hotel with a good rate in the Financial District. This hotel had a good location with a decent pub/restaurant on the bottom floor. The rooms were super clean. Mine was a little small, but it was just my wife and i for one night - plus we're not the type of people who spend much time in our room except for to sleep. My only complaint is that the bed was a little too firm for my tastes.

review.title: great location, great perks
review.reviewText: The club quarters is a good choice if you are on a budget but don't want to feel like you are. OUr room came with a mini-fridge and microwave which was very useful. The hotel also offers free bottled water (refillable bottles) so you save A LOT of money on purchasing water in the city ($1-2/bottle). The hotel is walking distance to most sights including fisherman's warf, union sqaure, chinatown and the pier to catch the alcatraz ferry. We'd stay here again!!!!

review.title: Very good hotel experience
review.reviewText: Clean room; friendly, helpful staff; useful amenities. The bed was was extra firm, but I slept well anyway. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel for last minute booking!
review.reviewText: Decided to get a hotel for the NWM about 3 weeks before the event and tried expedia's unpublished rates to get a cheaper price (unpublished description: 3.5 star in embarcadero area). I was a little skeptical about how the room would be after reading reviews of tiny rooms and pictures with older looking furnishings, but when I check in I was pleasantly surprised with my room. I had a room on the top floor (9), with a full kitchen area (sink, microwave, stove, mini fridge, coffee, dishes, etc), couch with a pull-out bed, desk area, flat screen TV, and bed area. Very spacious room and comfortable. I wish I would have known I was getting a room with a kitchen and pull out couch so I could have invited more runners to stay and make the price cheaper, but it was still very comfortable for me and a friend. Also it's right in the middle of the financial district, a short walk from Union square (10 min) and probably a 20 min walk to Fisherman's wharf. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: perfectly adequate
review.reviewText: Well located, clean. Rooms small but adequate. Personnel are busy but friendly. Very convenient location. Furniture in club lobby is getting shabby and dirty but our room was up to date. Only real complaint was that we had to walk three long corridors to get to our room from the elevator. If the configuration doesn't allow a more convenient route, at least offer the bottled water at both ends!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, reasonably priced. Clean. Room was very small, but, really not a factor for us. Reminded me of an interior cabin on a cruise. Bed was VERY comfortable, which was a BIG plus. Would definatly stay there again.

review.title: small rooms great location
review.reviewText: If you need to stay in the financial district, this is a great location in San Fran. However the rooms are extremely small and you have to hunt down ironing boards as they are not in the room. Great location and walking distance from everything. Chinatown is 3 blocks away and simply amazing.

review.title: My SF business address.
review.reviewText: Fine hotel, all the basics.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Good location for being in the city.

review.title: Excellent experience
review.reviewText:
It was perfect. The service was excellent. They have free WiFi everywhere. The room was comfortable and clean. The business room was amazing to drink some coffee or tea while you are working or surfing websites.
I totally recommend this hotel, also is close to the fisherman's area.

review.title: Love Club Quarters SF. Will return and look forward to visiting other CQ in Boston, NY etc.
review.reviewText: Would stay here again for sure.

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText:
only 5 blocks away from BART station, convenient to and from SFO. I would recommend and stay there again. Staff very friendly and knowledgable.
6 blocks away from Broadway where the night clubs are and walking distance to Pier 1. Great location!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This property is a very functional location for road warriors and people who don't need to spend a lot of time in their rooms. The rooms are small, but the bed is comfy, the bathroom clean, and there's free wifi. The location is great for Chinatown, North Beach and the Embarcadero, and convenient to the BART for everything else.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: For the price in SF, the hotel wasn't bad. The service was satisfactory, not great. They gave me a smoking room which really was a downer. Free water was nice, and the rooms were comfortable, but pretty small.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and the staff was pleasant and prompt! Room was a little small but for the price it was perfect! Close walking distance to public transportation. The pub next door was a nice place to stop as well. Would stay there again!

review.title: Perfect fit for what I needed
review.reviewText: Great location for my visit, just over the sky bridge to my daughter's apt. Room size just right for one person. Decor very modern and functional. I like the amenities such as the chilled water. We went up to the 11th floor outdoor space and sat around, drinking wine and enjoying the view. I will definitely be back!

review.title: Location location location
review.reviewText: Nicely placed in down town. Great central location.rooms are a bit small but we only slept there. Great for the price! The pub next to th hotel was great!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location for walking all over the city. Safe neighborhood. Close to Ferry Building and restaurants. Generally quiet. Nice staff. Always stayed in Fisherman's Wharf. After staying at club quarters, would never stay in the wharf again. Great value for the price. We'll be back.

review.title: Very conveniently located
review.reviewText: Just blocks away from the ferry building, cable cars, and chinatown.

review.title: Perfect for business!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was perfect for a 1 week stay. The staff are all very friendly, and helpful.
The rooms had everything - comfortable bed, very well maintained bathroom, good size flat screen TV on the wall, and quiet rooms. It was in a convenient location to anywhere in downtown SF, and the BART/MUNI transit.

The downside to being in the financial district is that everything is closed on the weekend, and so it's a bit of a walk to get to restaurants (down near Union Square). But other than that, minutes to get to Embarcardero for a great walk to Fisherman's Wharf, and bike rentals to Golden Gate Bridge. All the fun stuff! :D

review.title: Club Quarters
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel. However, there were people arguing outside at 2:00 am and I could hear everything. The restroom had a fishy odor. Other than that, it was okay for the price.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Quiet, clean, no free parking but I don't own a car so it didn't matter. Close enough to cable cars and easy to catch a cab. no rip off mini bar. Extremely helpful front desk staff.

review.title: Great city to propose in.
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to a lot of stuff in the center of San Francisco. China town, North Beach (Little Italy), Washington Square, Coit Tower, Union Square, Ferry Building and Embarcadero St, and the BART station are all with in walking distance of the hotel. The rooms are kind of small, but the quality of the room is good and the front desk employees were very helpful.

review.title: Extremely nice
review.reviewText: I had a wonderful stay. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, the room were well maintained every day. The only thing that's missing is king size bed.

review.title: Overpriced but clean
review.reviewText: Overpriced but clean

review.title: Perfect for business trip
review.reviewText: Room to move, free filtered water available at all times, great for morning runs along the Embarcadero, safe and convenient neighborhood.

review.title: Convenient and economical choice
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Convenient to everything. Good price. Why stay anywhere else?

review.title: "Next trip in SF will be @ CQ"
review.reviewText: Everything was a comfortable walking distance away.

review.title: Near Everything San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room is small but my best friend and I thought it was good enough for the purpose of our trip - sleep and shower. Please note that the walls are on the thin side so we heard all the laughing and all the noises next door - muffled but still heard. Instead of ice, you can fill clean water bottles with cold water. It was a very nice place for a decent price. However, I'm not a fan of the "service fee" for getting food delivered to us - $2.50. I would have walked downstairs to save the $2.50. I would recommend if you want a place to stay that's accessible to a lot of things around San Francisco.

review.title: Guest Quarters San Francisco
review.reviewText: One block from Tansamerica tower. Walk to Fishermans Wharf, Chinatown or Embarkadaro. Very friendly hotel. Quiet. Clean. Room a bit small but well worth the price.

review.title: beautiful stay for the affordable price
review.reviewText: people were friendlly and the room was very elegant and nice for the small size of it. Only wished I had a king size bed, but they were able to make it accamodating for the size of the room. Felt comfy and safe to stay in this hotel.

review.title: Will never stay at Club Quarters again!
review.reviewText:
The laundry was a plus. The staff were very professional. But the room was a big disappointment for two weeks:
1. No view.
2. Only four file cabinet drawers to use for clothes. Ridiculous idea for a hotel that bills itself as a biz hotel for long stays.
3. The kitchenette, for which we chose this hotel, turned out to be a microwave. Also ridiculous. Nowhere before in a great deal of travel have I experienced that definition.

review.title: Quiet on the weekends
review.reviewText: I stay here each year to run the SF marathon because it is a few minutes walk to the start. Usually stay Fri, Sat, Sun and find that there is lots of great food in the area though hard to find a pastry shop or lunch place open in the financial district on the weekends. Hotel is good for people who like the convenient location, free wi-fi, and don't need to feel fussed over by a large staff or need a lot of amenities like a lobby bar. There are plenty of other places to go for a nice drink or tapas! Room was very clean and had all the amenities you need for a comfortable stay. Don't understand why it is so much less expensive than all other hotels nearby, it is a great deal.

review.title: Great! Would definitely return!
review.reviewText: Great hotel - this is my second time staying here, and was pleased again.

review.title: visiting SF
review.reviewText:
What I didn't like about this hotel is that the rooms are rather small. I had requested a queen size bed for my husband and I but the room that we stayed in, had a full size bed.
What I did really like about this hotel is that it was clean and well kept. Our room had a microwave and a refridgerator. Most importantly, the location of this hotel was awsome! I would definately stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Modern facilities and convenient location make this a great hotel for staying in San Francisco, whether for business or pleasure.

review.title: Quite Satisfied
review.reviewText: PROS: Good location; Close to F-line (streetcar); Close to cable car (California line) terminus (never had problems boarding); very safe neighbourhood; Free WiFi & even printing; Direct bus through Chinatown where lots of choices for non-Western food (actually hotel is within walking distance to Chinatown too). CONS: We've been given a smoking room w/o our knowledge - we found a feint strange smell but didn't realize it's a smoking room until Day 4 of our 5 days stay. Hotel guest relations staff didn't do anything to make amends - only said that they didn't receive Smoking/Non-smoking preferences from Expedia; No fridge in room.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Close to ferris building and downtown area.
The only problem is the room is a little bit small, but it's clean and convenient.
A good place to go if you want to save some money and spend more time outside.

review.title: Club Quarters
review.reviewText: Very convenient, hip self service type hotel. Very efficient and comfortable. Perfect for the business traveller

review.title: Lives up to Expectations
review.reviewText:
My assigned room was only on the second floor but was extremely quiet because it was on the inside. However, late in the day a strong menthol cigarette smell began to permeate the space and when I returned about midnight it was well nigh intolerable.

The next morning the front desk staff leaned over backwards to change the room to one on a high floor on the outside. Problem solved.

I will continue to use this hotel whenever I have business and am traveling alone to San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Loved the location! Perfect for walking to all the places I wanted to go see and in a great part of town. The location felt very safe and clean. The staff were always smiling and extremely polite. Loved the room, small but quaint and actually very cozy. I didn't mind that I could occasionally hear my neighbors in the other rooms either. I'd definitely stay here again :)

review.title: Great trip. Great hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed here with my friend and we had an awesome time in San Francisco... I'm from Australia and my American experience has been awesome. I have stayed at some places which have given me a negative experience in some places but Club Quarters definitely added to a positive experience in San Francisco

review.title: Service is below average.
review.reviewText: We booked a suite, but was given a regular room. I went back to the front desk. The person did not know what I was talking about until I showed him the Expedia record. The suite is actually just a little bigger than the regular room with an extra sofabed. Perhaps, they called it a suite in downtown San Francisco. What I was really upset about is the lack of honesty of the front desk. I travel frequently to San Francisco. The service of this hotel is just below average.

review.title: Great Stay in a good hotel
review.reviewText: This was just what we wanted in a hotel. Great location, friendly and very helpful staff, lots of good restaurants right around, good access to public transportation, the whole thing

review.title: More or less cheap hotel near piers
review.reviewText:
No refrigerator in the room;
No hotel parking, even payable. Nearest parking is closing at 10pm

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Great location, great price

review.title: Excellent for business travel
review.reviewText: The rooms are nice and the hotel is very well maintained. The soundproofing is not the best so if you have someone in the room next to you with the TV on, you will hear it. Traffic noise can be bad too depending on what floor you're on. But that being said, I will continue to book this hotel for my business meetings as the rooms are nice and the location is ideal.

review.title: Giants game
review.reviewText: great location in walking distance

review.title: Yes!
review.reviewText: Very impressed with this hotel, especially for the price. Desk staff was knowledgeable and helpful.

review.title: Quality Comes Standard
review.reviewText: Club Quarters is everything I need in a business hotel: convenient, clean, quiet and efficient. If you're looking for a "no frills" solution in the San Francisco financial district, you've found the right place.

review.title: Stay Away
review.reviewText: While the hotel was located in a central area of San Francisco, the roooms were too small, and we had a suite, and the hotel staff was mediocre. I wouldn't stay here again.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Modestly priced, good location, comfortable quarters. Would have no problem returning, staying in similar priced hotels in the area, or trying another Club hotel in another city. The staff was very friendly and helpful in suggesting places to eat and visit.

review.title: Very good business hotel
review.reviewText: Very easy place to stay. Rooms small but efficient. Very clean. Some rooms have a surprisingly nice view at no extra cost.

review.title: Best Bargain in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Hotel is conveniently located in the financial district of SF, a quick walk from Market Street or the Embarcadero. The hotel is part of a chain that caters to business travelerers, clean and efficient. You can check in and check out at three video monitors in the lobby, there's free wi-fi throughout the property, and you will find nice touches like free bottled water by the elevators and a cool rooftop deck. This was my second stay at the CQ in San Francisco and I intend on staying at some of their other properties in the future.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location is great! We walked to the Ferry Building and Chinatown. Friendly staffs.

review.title: Really nice perks
review.reviewText: The room was super-small. That said, it had free wifi, a nice lounge downstairs, the adjacent restaurant/pub is good, there is a fridge in the room, and the service is great. I would definitely recommend for the business traveler.

review.title: Good for Price and location
review.reviewText:
This hotel was ok. The rooms are very small. I shared it with my husband and it was a little on the tight end. This room is great if you are traveling alone. It does have good wifi, which was important to me. The staff was ok, not great not bad. We did have to move rooms because our tv was not working, and they gave us a downgrade. It really didn't matter to us because we were rarely in the room. Other then that, it is in a good area; a couple of blocks down Chinatown. I also think that this hotel should validate parking because there is no parking, so you have to park across the street in a parking garage.
In short, my husband said he would stay again, and I would look around for other options, but if I had to, I would be ok with staying again.

review.title: Great Amenities
review.reviewText:
I loved the lounge atmosphere instead of having a lobby, as well as the water dispensers in the hall for filling water bottles and the hall closet with the ironing boards and extra soaps.
The computer stations even had hours dedicated only to folks printing boarding passes!

review.title: Good affordable place to stay in SF
review.reviewText:
Great service. Rooms are clean and well-furnished. WiFi service was a bit
slow, particularly in the mornings. Only 3 blocks to the BART makes the location convenient. However, the walls between adjacent rooms are thin and noise can be an issue -particularly on the weekends.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Nothing too fancy, but clean, comfortable and safe. Only downside is that I stayed there on the weekend and the finanicial district closes on the weekend, so many restaurants and shops in the area were closed.

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: We visit SF yearly, love the FiDi, Chinatown, NorthBeach and Union Square area, and Club Quarters is located amidst all that, just a block from the Pyramid.

review.title: Nice hotel, quiet but still reasonably close to all you need.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel rooms with tv. Good service and staff. Ferry terminal about 10 min walk away.

review.title: Will go back
review.reviewText: Nice hotel near shopping area.If you like walking you can walk to the wharf:)

review.title: San Francisco Gem
review.reviewText: On a rainy weekend in San Francisco, we felt very lucky to have made reservations at Club Quarters. Just a few blocks walk from the Ferry Building, we arrived soaking wet but pleasantly surprised. The front desk personnel were cheerful and courteous, and within a few minutes we were in the elevator speeding up to our room. The room was efficiently designed without skimping on the amenities. Nice clean, plush, quiet accommodations. The hotel is connected to the Elephant & Castle restaurant, which appeared to be THE place to be on a Friday night. We had a great, albeit noisy dinner there. Club Quarters is located within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, the MUNI system, and Chinatown. We enjoyed watching the Chinese New Year's Parade, then going to a nearby Chinese restaurant for wonton soup! We will definitely keep Club Quarters in mind the next time we travel to San Francisco.

review.title: I was very impressed and can't wait to come back.
review.reviewText: This hotel is so good that soon it will be very crowed and fully booked. The price is great! Future guests may find it had to arrange a room. It was perfect for me in all respects.

review.title: Very nice business hotel
review.reviewText: Very convenient to the SF financial district. Completely safe neighborhood. Room small but very efficient and compact. Would not stay here with my wife along but it is perfect for traveling alone. Taxis and BART are conveniently available.

review.title: I Heart Club Quarters!
review.reviewText: I had never heard of Club Quarters and got it on Expedia as a sort of "pig in a poke." Boy, was I surprised! Within walking distance of anything that matters, super clean, quiet, and comfortable. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. Highly recommended!

review.title: Reliable choice
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a convenient location. The staff was friendly and helpful. Not a lot of frills, but for a business trip it was just what I wanted. I appreciated the coffee available in the lobby.

review.title: Very good basic place to stay
review.reviewText: Very modern, well-equipped small hotel for the single business traveler. Large, multi-service hotel across the street. Attached restaurant and bar. Great shopping nearby. I'd come back!

review.title: Nice hotel, Great price
review.reviewText: Never had issues, we love it. We'll definitely stay here again. Nice location too.

review.title: No have a parking
review.reviewText: I need pay 35 dlls every day

review.title: convenient option to business district and embarcadero
review.reviewText: Adequate hotel, close to business district and embarcadero. Nice to have a bar right within the hotel grounds.

review.title: Adequate but not overly impressed
review.reviewText: Good location, nothing special.

review.title: Cozy & clean..
review.reviewText: The room was small and "cozy" (as my girlfriend called it). Immediately, you can tell it is geared for the business traveler. It was very clean and the staff were friendly. Since we were there for NYE, we didn't stay too long inside the hotel, so the size was not too much of a concern. It is also in the financial district, so after normal business hours the area becomes quiet. However, we had a good time. The British pub (Elephant & Castle) downstairs had some great food. There is even a Starbucks on the corner for that early morning cup of coffee. Overall, we were happy with our stay.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel with friendly staff and an excellent location at a good value.

review.title: Excellent hotel for the budget-minded seeking quality without compromise.
review.reviewText: There were two elevators off of the lobby and I never had to wait long to get my ride. The hallways to the rooms were well lit and nicely decorated with black and white photographs. Chilled and filtered water was available in the hallway for free. The room was nice and functionally furnished. The wall mounted air conditioner was noisy. The bathroom was well appointed. Internet connection was included in the price and worked flawlessly. The hotel does not offer breakfast but a restaurant is right next door and there are plenty of other coffee shops within a minute walk.

review.title: Very Good Location. Will Go Again. Excellent Quality For Price.
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel. Very comfortable room and very quiet. Great location downtown San Francisco. Parking is a bit of a pain but other than that great location and great service. Definitely a place to go back. The crew is in the hotel is nice too and that is worth mentioning.

review.title: Club Quarters SF
review.reviewText: This stay confirmed my opinion that I will always stay at Club Quarters when possible - and book through Expedia because the process was seamless! This CQ was terrific for business stay - clean, convenient, free bottled water and free wifi - what more could you want?

review.title: Club Quarters - San Francisco
review.reviewText: Everything was very clean and nice. The room was a little small, but not the smallest I have been in.

review.title: would stay again
review.reviewText: great location,rooms a little small but adequate as most time is spent enjoying the city.would highly recommend.

review.title: Nice hotel.... a little pricey
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice, clean and quaint. Front staff helped us with questions about the area and got us checked in right away, no wait time. Room was quite small for the price but it was last minute and in the financial distract to I guess thats normal. Complimentary water bottles, coffee & tea was nice.

review.title: Great stay for the price
review.reviewText: The rooms are rather small, but it's a comfortable place to stay and the staff is terrific.

review.title: setting new standards
review.reviewText: internet, coffee and bottled water is free...that's just so awesome...i've stayed in 1200/night hotels and they are cheap on these...

review.title: Great hotel for a great price.
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel and the location. I was just minutes in walking distance from Embarcadero Center, and I even walked to Pier 39. When I go back to San Francisco, I will not look elsewhere. This place is perfect for the professional on the go. The room is modestly-sized, but I would hardly consider this a negative attribute. The hotel surroundings are clean, and it feels safe (especially compared to the surroundings of the hotel where I stayed the first night on O'Farrell).

review.title: Definitely I'll be back!
review.reviewText: Very nice people at frontdesk, clean and organized rooms, modern furniture, best location and reasonable price for San Francisco.

review.title: CQ in SF is Nice
review.reviewText: The hotel is a very nice chain, of which i have also stayed in their Philadelphia location. The location in SF is in the business district, which was a little boring since we were there for the weekend. Very few restraunts near by were open. However, i wanted to be sure we were staying in well-known, clean accomodations, due to the recent bed-bug epidemic. The windows to my room opened, which was quite nice and kept the hotel from feeling stuffy. The hotel is close to tourist trap Fisherman's warf but quite far from Golden Gate Park, where we spent most of the weekend. Friendly, helpful staff. No continental breakfast. However, the water bottle station is a great amenity. All over, i enjoyed the hotel itself, but the location wasn't for the best choice for a leasiurely traveler. (it is, afterall, a business hotel). Thanks CQ!

review.title: Content
review.reviewText: The room was pretty well kept, but the first afternoon when we got back from out morning sightseeing trip to Alcatraz, the room had not been cleaned and the cleaning lady had stored the trash bag in there. She quickly went in to pick it up, but we were not expecting to come to an unmade bed nor unpicked up trash.

review.title: Great Price Good Hotel
review.reviewText: I wasn't sure what to expect but the hotel was nice. We went for labor day weekend and we had a great stay. The staff isn't very friendly. However, the rooms were nice, the lounge was nice (with chess, coffee, water, etc.) Restaurant/bar next door had good happy hour and food. Starbucks close buy. Right next to the biggest mall Embarcadero. Overall very satisfied!

review.title: I WAS VERY PLEASED!!!
review.reviewText: Clean,quiet,off the beaten track,close to a lots of places(locations).

review.title: A secret great find!
review.reviewText: I will find a reason to stay in the city again and stay here. The location was great because I love the Embarcadero. I took BART from SFO airport after a flight from Tokyo, wheeled my luggage from BART right to the hotel. Unlike BIG hotels, I was able to check in at noon, and on check-out day I had no trouble storing my luggage. My 4th floor room was modern, clean, had all the amenities and I have no complaints. I placed a wake-up call for a nap. Voice mail message was efficient and reliable. This hotel had everything I needed. The front desk staff were courteous, knowledgeable about the city and how to reach my destinations and very helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this property WITHOUT ANY QUALIFICATIONS. The Expedia reviews which were negative (needing renovation, run down, smelling cigarette smoke) did not match my experience. It was true that being located in the financial district, there are not many restaurants nearby that are open. But availability of nearby mass transit and walking are not difficult from this location. It is located across from the 5-stay Le Meridien, and this should be included in descriptions of this property. I think its a great secret!

review.title: Decent Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: The service was marginal, hotel was acceptably clean and quiet. If you can find an okay deal, I would recommend this hotel in the financial district. If there are no deals, you can probably find a little more for your money.

review.title: It is not often you get something for free!!
review.reviewText:
Location of Club Quarters San Francisco was pretty good. Liked the free internet, lounge and coffee station and laundry facilities. All greatly appreciated.
Went in August and it was very COLD. Always take a jacket.

review.title: Small and neat hotel
review.reviewText:
Over all, I was satisfied with this hotel. The hotel and also room were small but neat so that it was a totally comfortable stay.
I liked the the free bottled water.(Actually, you have to bottle the water by yourself.)
The only drawback I realized was the speed of the Internet that was frustrating.

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: As I read the reviews, some did not seem pleasant, however I did not encounter any of the other guests issues. I found the hotel staff to be friendly and gave quick service, as we requested a cot and received that right away, as well as any extra towels or pillows. The hotel offers filtered water, coffee and tea at any time. it is not a luxurious hotel but it is clean and all one would need. the only complaint we had was that either the walls are thin or our neighbours were very load. The location of the hotel is in the business district, therefore it is quite but has cafes and restaurants around and is very close to "little italy" and a cheap cab ride or about a 20 minute walk to the piers or fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Excellent choice for Embarcadero or Financial district
review.reviewText: I stayed at club quarters when I ran in the San Francisco marathon in late July and it served all of my needs. It is close to the embarcadero which is where the event was staged. A nice feature of the hotel was the filtered water one each floor. I could refill my bottle or the one they provided as often as needed. Staff were helpful, and room was clean. Restaurant choices immediately surrounding hotel was limited. I was not expecting much from the Elephant & Castle next door which provides room service for the hotel, however I had a decent meal there the first night I arrived. I would definitely stay here again if I needed to be in this area of SF.

review.title: yikes
review.reviewText: Our room must have been a former smoking room. The scent of room freshner was nauseating, and there were no windows to open.

review.title: Great Value for a Weekend Stay
review.reviewText: I really don't understand any of the negative reviews. Great location in the financial district. Close to the Embarcadero. Terrific rate on weekends.

review.title: Easy, slick and convenient place to stay
review.reviewText:
It was simply an easy place to stay. It took 60 seconds to check in and they did the little things I asked well and in a way that made me feel like a valued customer.

Great value for money.

review.title: central location
review.reviewText: We stayed here to see our son participate in the S.F. marathon activities. Short walk to starting line. Hotel was quiet, clean, comfortable. Only trouble was waiting for slow elevators. Good op. to find the stairs and get some exercise! Nice place.

review.title: Clean, but small hotel room. When in SF again, will stay there.
review.reviewText: I've read reviews before booking a room at this hotel. Some people complained, but I think for the price I paid this hotel is fantastic. My room was clean, friendly hotel staff, the location was perfect. I did stay by myself so the size of the room was not an issue, but I think for many couples this type of room will be too small.

review.title: 'Not impressed Rooms to Small"
review.reviewText: The rooms appeared clean but very compact. Linen service was a nightmare 2 person occupancy would only get 1 set of linen everyday for the entire stay. I would only recommend this accomadation if no other hotel available. The staff was very friendly and helpful. However the rooms were too small and beds were not comfortable which were two twins put together. This hotel was not what i expected according to the star rating. The only advantage to this hotel is that it is in the walking distance to all the tourist attractions.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco, Especially for the Price.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location and exceeded expectations. The staff was friendly and the rooms were pleasant - a little small but fine for the price. There were some nice touches, free internet and printing from the room, nice snacks to name a couple. We will stay there again.

review.title: Good Value, Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: Although I had never heard of Club Quarters, we were pleasantly surprised at the service, cleanliness and amenities the hotel had to offer. While the rooms are a bit compact, we did have a microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker plus shampoo, conditioners, etc. Another good point was the free bottled water on every floor! We liked the area because it didn't have the crowds of people like Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf. The Embaradero area is great - short walk to the ferries and on Saturday they have a fantastic Farmers Market.

review.title: Always satisfied
review.reviewText: This is our third visit to Club Quarters. It is in a great location, walking distance to everything. We always receive great service! We will of course, visit again!

review.title: Impressed!
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and comfortable. Next time I'll get a two bed arrangement, as that was the only uncomfortable thing. The only other thing was the last night, when a large family occupied the room next door. They were very loud all the way up to midnight. We were leaving the next morning, and I said something to one of the occupants. He apologized and we left on friendly terms.

review.title: Good room for the single person who won't spend a lot of time in it.
review.reviewText:
The Club Quarters San Francisco is definitely what I would call a hotel for the business person instead of the tourist.

The size of the room was about that of a small bedroom and with both a queen sized bed and full sized desk, the room can begin to feel claustrophobic very quickly. The bathroom is not much better with the sink taking up most of the space, leaving a very small amount of space for the toilet and shower (there was no bathtub in this room). While there is a television, it was a small one being about the same size as my computer monitor. Furthermore, the one time I ordered from room service it not only took over an hour for me to receive my meal, but it was cold and no silverware was provided meaning I had to go down to the restaurant to get a knife and fork (which defeats the purpose of the room service).

On the plus side: It's location is great being only a couple of blocks from both Market Street and the Embarcadero. Free bottled water was a huge benefit given the heat conditions of San Francisco. For those with wireless internet, free WiFi was provided. There was a free laundry room and gym available.

In all, this is probably a good place for individuals who plan to spend absolutely no time in their room. If, on the other hand, a room where one could lounge around before heading out in the morning or relax in the evening, or a room better fitted to a couple or family, there are probably much better (and cheaper) options.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: The location is really good, very central, and the hotel is a great value for the location. The rooms are a tad small, but very functional and again, the value is high.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText:
This hotel was average, nothing really special about it. The room was clean and satisfactory. The location was good very close to downtown financial district. Close to restaurants as well.

*Only downfall is parking, $32 a night!

review.title: Don't Stay on the 2nd Floor Unless You Are a Smoker
review.reviewText: Good value and great location for the price.

review.title: San Francisco Club Quarters
review.reviewText: This is 'Modern European' style hotel. Rooms are small and bathrooms bit obsolete and small as well. The hotel looks like it is from early 90th. Self check-out process is awkward however reception desk employees can assist. No news papers in a room at morning. NO PARKING at hotel. Near-by public parking cost more than $30 a day. At week end it is possibility to park on a street, if you can find it. Street parking during weekdays are only 2 hours and metered. The overall price is bit high for this hotel and services. There are few small breakfast café near by. Dinner restaurants are in close proximity as well. Even movie theater and couple night clubs near by.

review.title: Great value & very pleasant
review.reviewText: Very positive: clean, pleasant & knowledgeable staff, well furnished, Rooms were small, but who cares? Best part of the location: Ferry Building farmers market, but otherwise, not many standard tourist sites nearby.

review.title: I'll stay here again.
review.reviewText:
This is great place to stay for business. It's not a luxury spot but it was clean, safe, comfortable, and convenient.

The staff was friendly and helpful. The surrounding few blocks are very quiet on the weekends when the financial district is closed but who needs all that ruckus anyway?

review.title: very good value
review.reviewText: the hotel staff were extremely helpful. rooms are clean but not fancy. free computer is nice perk. good locaton for public transportation.

review.title: GOOD!!!
review.reviewText: PERFECT LOCATION TO STAY IN FRISCO

review.title: I'd recommend it.
review.reviewText: It's a smaller and less fancy hotel than the nearby businessmen's hotels, but the quality, cleanliness, and service are of business travel quality. Rooms are smaller than the Hyatt, but that's okay. I was at a conference that took place at the Hyatt, but this was close enough to be no problem. I'd stay here again.

review.title: If you have no other choise this hotel would offer a good value for money.
review.reviewText:
Room is really small (may be 5-6 square meters). Service is great as it is everywhere in the US.

In my case the hotel offered a nice value for money ratio, where all other hotels in SF were booked out or cost more than US-$ 250 / night.

review.title: Quiet spot in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the financial district that is quiet at night. Walking distance to either the Embarcadero or North Beach. Nice little British Pub next door. If looking for night life, this is not the spot to stay at.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Small, euro-style rooms best suited for those on business or not planning to spend much time in their room, but nicely done and a terrific value. Financial district is not best location for tourists, but close to Ferry building and farmers market. If you have a car (and you shouldn't), don't park it on the street overnight; my car got vandalized. But area feels safe enough, if a little empty at night.

review.title: Need a parking lot
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine except for the parking, we had to pay $32 dollars per day 1/2 block from there, plus the room, better look for a better hotel with parking lot.

review.title: Club Quarters San Fran
review.reviewText: I'll stay there again.

review.title: Very decent hotel for this price
review.reviewText:
Excellent location, close to the Market Street and Union Square but without such noise (especially firefighters).
Rooms small but clean.
The only problem: tiny window opening towards windowless well made of concrete.

review.title: Great Deal, im eager to go back!!!
review.reviewText: i'd never heard of this hotel, so wasn't sure what i was getting into,, but i was so impressed. This hotel went beyond my expectations!! The bed was very comfy, the showe very nice, with more than expected amenities. The Elephant Bar & Restaurant was super convenient. I was able to get to the wharf just walking a few blocks straight down, which was great for me because i travelled alone. Didn't need to use $ on a taxi! Next time i'm in SF, i want to stay at this hotel!!!

review.title: Great except the shower smelled terrible?
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful. Great value and location for the Financial District. Love the free water bottles and dispensers. Only two complaints - 1.) the shower distinctly smelled like bad b.o. that you could detect as soon as you walked in the bathroom. Made me a little suspect about the cleanliness of the room though it appeared to be clean. 2.) the King bed was really 2 twin beds pushed together and you could feel the connector so really you could only sleep on one side or the other. What's the point of a King then?

review.title: Bring your own cleaning supplies
review.reviewText: The hotel wasn't bad...a little dreary but would have been okay had it not been so dirty. The bathroom was clean but under the desk it was really dusty and dirty, like it hadn't been cleaned in months.

review.title: Small, but Nice
review.reviewText: Hotel is walking distance (about 6 blocks) from the BART line which goes to and from SFO Airport. This same station will get you to the rail to the Zoo and other outlying destinations. 2 blocks from shopping center. This hotel is located in the Financial District. You will need to take a bus or cab to Fisherman's Warf and Golden Gate Bridge and the park (45-60 min walks). Elephant & Castle is adjacent to the hotel which is very convenient and has good food. Hotels offers free purified water and free recycled bottles. Very nice lobby with free coffee, water and 3 PCs for internet use and printing. If you are not familiar with CQ, the rooms are fairly small and very compact. Note, this hotel offers smoking rooms on the second floor. If you are not a smoker or allergic, make sure you get a room on the fourth floor or above. You can smell smoke on the third floor. Overall, good experience. Friendly and courteous staff. Clean hotel. Pretty quiet.

review.title: Business Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location and close to everything that I needed. The room was good, accomodations were clean and the staff was friendly. Car service to/from airport was available as requested. However, the halls were dark and narrow, the fitness equipment was marginal and the restaurant/pub was very noisy. I ate mostly in my room or at other nearby hotels. Internet service was very slow. It worked for a short business trip but it wouldn't be my first choice on a return trip.

review.title: small room
review.reviewText: The room was relatively small, but comfortable. I would not recomend this if there is more than one person.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
This hotel has no real frills. You get a great location and a basic, comfortable room. Internet is free, Starbucks is right next door.
Needs renovating soon.

review.title: Great stop!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was excellent, they were very helpful and friendly. The attached Bar/Restauraunt is great. The hotel rooms are tiny, but not bad if you are planning on site seeing all day and just need somewhere to sleep. We woke up early and just started walking around the city and saw so much! We had a great time!!!

review.title: Excellent modern rooms
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great find. Lots in useful ammenities. Close to all transportation lines, plenty of restaurants around. The room was clean and modern.

review.title: They thought of everything
review.reviewText: Pulled up in the loading zone in front of the Hotel, after a maze of one-way streets and bad mapquest directions. I was worried about finding ANY parking and was greeted by friendly staff, who directed me to nearby parking. The room was small but clean, Lobby had really good endless supply of coffee and fixins, they even had cold clean refillable bottles of purified water for free. Most hotels charge 5 bucks for this! Security was good and elevators had pass keys. Location was great!...5 minutes walk to my early morning interview and 5 min. walk to Chinatown. Got great silk Chinese robes for family for souveniers. Go to the eastern bakery for chow-se-bao and chinese butter cream buns. A fun pleasure and business trip. Would highly recommend this Hotel.

review.title: Ideal Accomdations in The City
review.reviewText: Was curious about this property for some time as a regular visitor to San Francisco. Finally got around to giving it a go, and was delighted. Comfortable, immaculate, extraordinarily professional and affable staff. Great amenities, including the attached English-style pub. Location was ideal as well, heart of FiDi within walking distance of numerous downtown attractions. Not the least bit ostentatious, and reasonable rates, with many options for various types of accomodations. Will stay @ Club Quarters again. 3 thumbs up.

review.title: Not for light sleepers
review.reviewText: There carpets were stained. There were holes in the sheets. There was a blinking light on the telephone for messages. Even if you listen to the messages, the light keeps blinking. There was a 1 inch gap in the bottom of the door which allows copious amounts of light into the room. Not to mention you can hear everything that goes on in the hall. I clicked on free parking and was told by the clerk if I wanted free parking, I needed to drive around, I'd find some eventually and have to take my chances. The bed was comfy, but small for me and my husband. Not enough towels.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: As other reviews have indicated, this is a "no frills" hotel. It was clean, and in a decent area. The walls are very thin; I could hear every word spoken in the adjoining room. And the "king" bed was two smaller beds pushed together. But the price is excellent, so... Full amenities at full price, or adequate at a bargain rate? Pay your money and take your choice.

review.title: Simple is good
review.reviewText: The Club Quarters offered clean, organized space with few amenities, but strong focus on what I actually needed: clean room, good internet, workout room, good location.

review.title: Fine for the price
review.reviewText: Helpful staff

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: It's in the financial district and it is close to the ferry building. It is in a good area, and most places are walkable. The room is kind of small but good enough for sleeping and venturing out during the day. The staff in the hotel are helpful and nice. Overall, its a quiet hotel and location. i'd stay again for the convenience of the location.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Located a few minutes walk from the Ferry Building at the Embarcadero‎ and other downtown attractions, this hotel offers a good central location. Its not located in one of the usual tourist locations, but its easy to get to them by a variety of public transport options. Its also a short walk from the BART station which gives direct access to SF airport, so you dont need to use taxis from the airport if you want to save some dollars.

review.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN THE EMBARCADERO
review.reviewText: The hotel and the staff were great and the free internet was nice. I would stay here again and would tell anybody who wants to be near the Embarcadero and ferries to stay here. It's a walk to Union Square but close to China Town.

review.title: Great Place, Great Location
review.reviewText: Based on others' reviews, we stayed here and was very impressed. This hotel was very clean, nice and in a great location (financial district). They have free coffee and free wireless internet that worked great. Parking is across the street at the Embarcado. Walking distance to Chinatown and Ferry Building. Embarcado had lots of shopping and restaurants. Highly recommend this place. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Bathroom doors have 1 open gap + more
review.reviewText: I travel quite frequently, and I found this hotel to stand out like a sore thumb. This hotel is pretty much bare bones. If you are USED to the amenities of a larger hotel chain, you will be surprised as to the difference of this hotel. Firstly, their so-called high-speed internet connection was slow, and did not connect half of the time. Secondly, if you are sharing a hotel with your mate or work college, be informed that all (i was told by the front desk) of the bathroom doors have no-locks as well as a 1" open gap on both sides of the door. So, anyone can see right in as you're doing your business. The elevators have a magnetic card that rarely works. I had to use only one eleveator when I was there because I knew that was the only elevator my swipe-card worked in. Finally, when I called the hotel before I checked in, they said the bed I would have was a king bed. In fact, the bed was a Double-Bed, not a queen. On the plus side, though, this hotel is in the middle of the financial district, close to everything in that district. Also, there's an "Elephant and Castle" restaurant and a Starbucks in the same building. However, there's no mini-bar or fridge, even though they said that all rooms have a "kitchenette". Also, the hotel was very quiet. But, the room was very small. But mostly, the evasiveness of the staff was something I found to be surprising in a hotel that is marketed to businesses and leisure.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: In comparison to other hotels, Club Quarters is fairly inexpensive. I asked for a quiet room having just traveled across country and was awakened by the hotel staff from midnight until 2am messing in the storage room which was right next door to my room. I asked for a wine opener and 45 minutes later had to call back. 30 minutes after that I ended up going to the front desk because they never came. I would stay elsewhere unless it's all you can afford.

review.title: Good place to stay but local calls are not free
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the very expensive area of SF. For this reason, I am pretty satisfied with everything - the price and the friendly clerks. However, I did wish that local calls are free.

review.title: Nice place to stay right near downtown
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet and simple. It's not an ostentatious hotel with a fancy lobby, but if all you need is a nice clean, modern and quiet room located right near Embarcadero Center, this is a very good choice. If you have a car, parking is across the street in a public garage at $32/day.

review.title: Great business hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed there before, and will happily stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel, I would recommend it
review.reviewText: The only problem we had was at check out. Very unclear about the computers. They said they didn't work and there was a long line. When he was finally able to help us he went and used the computer that said wasn't functioning and put in my credit card and it worked fine. Rooms are small but adequate and the bed is very comfortable

review.title: Awesome Stay!
review.reviewText: This is an awesome place to stay! Clean, well-laidout rooms, great service, great location. I cannot say enough good about this hotel. If you get a chance to stay here, do so. Thanks!

review.title: excellent choice
review.reviewText: Clean, nicely decorated, comfortable. The rooms are smalls, like everyone else says, but they are more than adequate; besides how much time are you going to spend in your room while on vacation in San Francisco. Good hotel, good price, good location. Well done.

review.title: Excellent SF spot
review.reviewText: Club Quarters is in a quiet area but near BART and Ferry Building. Many bus routes stop nearby. It's always our first choice. Do not miss the rooftop deck -- outstanding views at any hour.

review.title: The location is within walking distance thru safe areas to North Beach, Chinatown and a Safeway.
review.reviewText: Great place, friendly staff, and within walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach and a local Safeway store. Only saw two poor homeless guys, and they were unintrusive. We took a cab to the Orpheium Theater on Market and again to the Grand Hyatt (less than $10.00 with tip each trip-easy to get cabs out front). Fridge in room with kitchenette was useful as the Club has no ice or vending machines. The Elephant diner/bar downstairs was a pleasant surprise. They even made breakfast for us even though it was past the times posted for breakfast! No unpleasant surprises, we felt like the only people on our floor, very private. Security is tight so we were really comfortable. Will stay again next timewe visit the city.

review.title: Convenience, location, price
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a prime location. Easy to get around the city by foot, if you're up for walking. Also close to public transport as well. Definitely a great bargain, and a nice clean & comfortable room too. And the friendliness of the staff was a plus too. Definitely recommend staying here ;-)

review.title: Great price
review.reviewText: We were three adults in a suite and it turned out to be a great deal. We will definitely return.

review.title: Great facilities, great location.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Excellent service. Surprisingly good decaf and regular coffee--free and available 24 hours a day. Free WiFi access was excellent. This was my first time at a Club Quarters Hotel, and I will definitely seek them out whenever I can in the future.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location and excellent price.

review.title: Will definetly go back to this hotel! Best Location and Price!!!!
review.reviewText: Ok so originally i had booked my hotel reservation with Cathedral Hill Hotel in SF. OMG it was hidious it was the worst hotel i ever stepped foot in. I called expedia in the brink of tears and they offered for me to stay at this worderful clean beautiful modern hotel. Maybe im being a bit much but compared to Cathedral Hill this place was a palace. The room we got was very small- but it had a little kitchen which we saved money because i cooked a little bit then it had a nice fitness center and the location of this place is fabulous. I personally like to go to SF to walk so we walk it to everysingle place you can image. All the piers Union Square North Beach Embarcadero, Financial District ect... I would recommend this place its reasonable in rate and definetly clean and up to date. I go to San Francisco once a year and i can assure you i will go back to Club Quarters!

review.title: decent hotel for a decent price
review.reviewText: I've stayed at Club Quarters a few times - this time to run in the Bay to Breakers. It's close to BART and the Ferry Bldg. It's a short walk to Union Square or North Beach. The staff is helpful and arranged an airport shuttle for me. They also had accurate instructions on which bus to take to Golden Gate Park. The rooms are small, but they're clean and I usually don't spend much time in my room when visiting SFO.

review.title: Actually, pretty good
review.reviewText: The only issue was the hide-a-bed was broken.

review.title: Nice place - best for singles and business travel
review.reviewText: Perfectly nice hotel in a great spot near Embarcadero Center. Clean, well kept. Standard amenities. The rooms are quite small. They are perfect for a single person or business traveler, but a bit tight otherwise. My wife and I did fine for three nights, but we did occasionally feel like we were tripping over each other. If you keep this in mind, I think Club Quarters is a good value compared to other area hotels.

review.title: Club Quarters - San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean, easy access to most interesting places to go in SF. Good prices too!

review.title: Very convenient location
review.reviewText: This hotel is very conveniently located close to North Beach, Chinatown, and the Embarcadero. Service was very good and staff was very helpful. The only ( slight) negative was that the rooms are a little small.

review.title: A decent and secure hotel in the midst of downtown San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This was my 3rd trip to San Francisco. For the price, this by far was the most reasonable. Except for a flood in the Reading/TV room and a Fire Alarm on an early, early Saturday morning, I have no complaints. I will check in here again when visiting. The location is great. My only concern is the lack of parking. Public parking is available 1/2 block away @ $37.00 w/o in and out priviledges. Otherwise, a bargain for business and vacationing travelers.

review.title: Good value, central location
review.reviewText: I have stayed in this hotel numerous time for business and pleasure. It's always very clean, internet always works, has a nice little gym in the basement and the location is great for business meetings downtown as well as for meals/social engagements at the Ferry Building, downtown or North Beach.

review.title: Efficient, well hidden hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was built in 2003 and we've been by it dozens of times and didn't really notice it. Excellent location, very efficient operation for the serious traveler or someone who needs to be in the middle of the Financial District and not pay an outrageous room rate.

review.title: Great place to stay'
review.reviewText: Very comfortable room, great area, close to Chinatown and Union Square.

review.title: Great Business Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was set up perfect for my trip. The rooms are well set up. Big desk with lots of work space. Mini frig in the room. Quality sheets. I would recommend this hotel to a business traveler looking for a great place to stay. A+

review.title: Convenient/Prices great
review.reviewText: We always try to stay at Club Quarters because it is convenient for us. No frills but prices great.
review.userLocation: live in Modesto, work in SF

review.title: for single or couple is great
review.reviewText: stayed by myself while attending a conference. was pleasantly surprised by everything, including central location, the way the place looks, the service, the room and the price (though you can always hope for a cheaper rate...). coming over from europe the size was completely fine. was pretty far from the elevator, so a bit of walking, and the view was disapointing (alley) but if you are out most of the time (which i was) it is pretty good. for the centre of SF is ideal.

review.title: Nice for Short Stays
review.reviewText: The hotel service was good. There is no on-site parking and hotel rates did not include parking. However, parking was half a block away for $32/24hrs. Location is great for getting around most destinations in the city. The standard rooms were small, but appropriate for limited number of nights and people.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel. Nice area. Close to everything. Will stay there again.

review.title: second time and counting
review.reviewText: second time i went to this particular hotel - it's very extremely centric and if you're a walker - even better. Rates are great and rooms are what are needed - if you're looking for a suite size room - ask before - overall - great value for your buck great location...can't wait to go back to SFO - plan on staying there again

review.title: n
review.reviewText: n

review.title: Good deal in great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean and in walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach and the Ferry Building. Would recommend to anyone going to the city for a weekend getaway. The Elephant and Castle Pub next door had great food. My only wish was that the parking garage across the street offered a better rate to the hotel guests.

review.title: I found the hotel I will be going to from now on when I'm in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Before I begin reviewing the pros and cons of the hotel, keep in mind I am review the suite. Pros: 1. Very business oriented room with modern decor. 2. Clean 3. Has a refrigerator and a microwave. 4. Has a nice big desk 5. They have a free printing service which allows you to print documents from any PC. Really cool and helpful. 6. Bar next to hotel had really good food. 7. Very comfortable beds and pillows. Overall, it was the best hotel I have stayed at in San Francisco thus far. Minor Cons: 1. The outlet on the desk wasn't working. 2. The wifi at the hotel is slow. It was a Wireless B. They need to upgrade to a Wireless G or Draft-N.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: I recently went to the hotel for a weekend away with my girlfriend for Valentine's Day. The suite at the location was simply amazing, from the decor to the size to the comfort and convenience of the amenities. The location in the financial district of Embarcadero was great and equally convenient for shopping, dining and walking around. I would definitely recommend for anyone, especially travelers on business.

review.title: Proximity,COmfort and Service
review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded my expectations--was very convenient to the Ferry Building and downtown, the Embarcadero. It was compact, comfortable, and well appointed. I was extremely content staying there. The staff was very accommodating--our group of 9 people were caught in a terrific rain storm and decided to order Chinese food (delivered)--we had a party in the Lobby with the blessing of the staff--It was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend Club Quarters.

review.title: Excellent SF location for a reasonable price
review.reviewText: Club quarters provides a very clean, comfortable facility within walking distance of the Emabarcadero and BART. The rooms are small but adequate. Promises of providing exercise equipment in the room were not fulfilled but over-all a very serviceable hotel. I would stay again.

review.title: Functional, convenient & good value for $$
review.reviewText: Good business hotel if you don't plan to spend time in the room. Financial district location across the street from Le Méridien (which you visit to see how the other half lives). Functional, almost spartan but a good value for dollar.

review.title: Fabulous...again!
review.reviewText: We have stayed here once before and loved it and we have a great experience this past time as well. We look forward to many, MANY more stays there!!! THANKS!

review.title: Great Bargain
review.reviewText: Great Find. Central location; easy access to transit, shopping, waterfront, Chinatown. Bargain rates for small but comfortable and clean room.

review.title: Great value in great location
review.reviewText: Clean and crisp room. Excellent bathroom only a problem for those who must have a tub. Soundproofing not perfect, so a bad neighbor could pose a problem, but hasn't happened to me yet. Like the location at the edge of the Embarcadero Center as its close to everything without being in the middle of the madness. Easy walk from BART station linking you to airport.

review.title: Best for business travel
review.reviewText: Aside from the fact that the entire hotel is decorated in green and gold (pink anyone?) this hotel is one of the best I've ever stayed in for business travel. The staff was always curteous and friendly and ALWAYS had an answer for my problem, rooms are well equiped for an on-the-go business person, place was quiet and everything was in order and convenient. I've convinced our company to get a membership here and believe it will be well worth it; I'm looking forward to my next stay this month!

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: We went to San Francisco on vacation and stayed at this hotel for one night. It was very nice, self-serve bottled water on our floor. Our room was clean and nice for people like us with lots of gadgets. There is an attached bar and restaurant (all meals) that was busy. The BART and bus are fairly close and it's easy to find if you get lost because it is one block from the TransAmerica building. Very friendly staff and felt safe. My one caution is that the area, like many major city downtowns, it is fairly empty at night and that may bother some people but that has nothing to do with the hotel.

review.title: not planning to return
review.reviewText: hotel room was small; room smelled, no DVD player,no refrigerator, desk was cramped in the corner.

review.title: Convenient and affordable hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Conveniently located small hotel in the Financial District of San Francisco. Service was great, however the hallways are narrow, and I had to walk through a maze of hallways to get to my room. I try to stay here when I'm in town (this was the second time I've stayed here); I'll definitely be back!

review.title: modest
review.reviewText: A modest place to stay. Newly remodeled, it seems. However the hallways are quite narrow and we had to walk almost all the way around the floor to get to our room as circulation was limited. The rooms are quite small, with apparently no sound insulation in the walls. The fellow next door started talking on the phone to someone in india about 5:30am sunday and we could not avoid hearing the entire conversation. Just a shower, no tub in the bathroom. Room was quite clean with new furniture.Good location across the st. from Le Meridian.

review.title: Okay Stay
review.reviewText: Plusses are price, Financial District location and convenience to local transportation, such as BART and MUNI. Negatives are lack of on site parking, and many rooms look out onto a building air shaft.

review.title: would stay here again
review.reviewText: Good place to stay at a reasonable price. Very clean & quiet. Well situated - approx 10 min walk into centre of San Fran, 5 min walk from transport on Embarcadero. Only small criticism is that the Elephant & Castle next door isn't the best place to eat - ok for a quick drink before heading out. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Club Quarters rocks
review.reviewText: We always try to stay here in SF. It's quiet and nice AND close to BART. Be sure to go on the 11th floor "sun deck" for great views night or day. I have never had a problem at Club Quarters. Restaurant/bar and Starbucks within steps.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION ..CLEAN ..
review.reviewText: Great place..close to bart ..shopping ..eating places...clean,,small room ..but this is the city..fantastic place for businees travlers.. upgraded to suite and was extremely happy on size and comfort !

review.title: Looking for an excuse to go back.
review.reviewText: The right hotel, in the right place, at the right price.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We were able to walk to AT & T park for a Giants game at night. Felt very safe returning. Nice to have all the amenities one might need accessible in the hall way, including bottled water. The next morning we walked to Fisherman's Wharf and Chinatown. We were too late for the Farmer's Market at the Ferry Building - but that is right there too! Parking at Embarcadero Center for $30 a night. You could easily walk from BART. The price was reasonable. We would stay here again.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, Great Location within walking distance to good restaurants and fun sights. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Perfect for the Price!
review.reviewText: Overall, the amenities, room, price and location were great! We will definitely go back! Our only disappointment was the TV...it was a bit small and located in a awkward spot, when lying in bed.

review.title: Fun and Relaxing
review.reviewText: This hotel is a nice hotel with close proximity to BART and Muni. Several different types of good restaurants that deliver to hotel. Friendly staff that were very helpful. It is a lil ways to downtown, but that is what makes it nice too.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The rooms are small and when I requested a non smoking room I meant non smoking all of the time, not just while I was in it. It smelt horrible.

review.title: Nice!
review.reviewText: It was a pleasure to stay in this hotel. The front desk people were very helpful and courteous. The room was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was cleaner than I have ever seen a bathroom in any hotel. I was very pleased. The only negative was the bathroom door did not close flush to the doorjamb and so there was a slight crack to the room with the toilet just visible. Family would have been fine, but I was with a friend. No biggie... just a slight negative.

review.title: Fantasic!
review.reviewText: Very clean, friendly and helpful staff, secure and neat building, offers a lot of amenities, absolutely excellent, and all for a fair price. I plan to stay there during all of my business trips if possible.

review.title: Good Choice Away from Union Square
review.reviewText: Just a stones throw away from the hustle and bustle that is Union Square, this hotel is ideally situated in the financial district which is quiet at night and much cleaner area in comparison. Perfect for the business traveller and everything touristy and all price points shopping is available within walking distance. The one way street maze is too much if you insist on renting a car but perfect for pedestrians and public transit access. Hotel was very well suited to the business traveller in a bare bones kind of way. Room Service was really take out and delivery but plenty of neighbourhood fine dining to be had.

review.title: Won't be going back
review.reviewText: The rooms were really small. I booked the queen size studio room, which is supposed to be bigger than the regular rooms but yet it is still very small. We had like a 19 inch TV, there wasn't even a bathtub since the bathroom is so small. If all you are looking for is just a bed to sleep on then it should suffice but not when you when to relax in your room after a long day out.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: This is a very nice place to stay. Close to China town and a short FLAT walk to the warf.

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
