review.reviewText: We arrived in San Francisco by train/bus and left the same way so we needed a hotel in a convenient location near public transportation. You can't get better than this! We were able to walk to and from the Ferry Building with our rolling luggage when we arrived and left. When we took the bus, we were usually no more than a block or too from a stop. There were only two minor aspects to the hotel that we didn't like. One, the bathroom door uses catches to close leaving a small gap that affected privacy. It was also loud. Of course, this wouldn't be an issue for one traveling alone. Second, our room didn't have a tub. Since we rented bicycles and rode across the Golden Gate Bridge, this was one occasion that I would have loved to soak in a tub when we got back. However, as I said, these were minor details. The service was excellent! The hotel has a nifty arrangement with local restaurants to provide room service for very little additional cost. The bed was comfortable, the wireless internet worked great, and the room was clean and attractive. We will definitely stay there again!

review.title: I would stay there again
review.reviewText: The hotel was very central for us. It is very close to Embacadero Center, Chinatown, Coit Tower, Fishermen's Wharf, cable cars. Many within walking distance. Bus transportation was just steps from the hotel.

review.title: PERFECT LOCATION AMAZING VIEW
review.reviewText: EVERYTHING WAS PERFECT BUT THEY DID BNOT CLEAN OUR ROON THE NEXT DAY. LOCATION WAS NUMBER 1. RECEPTIONISTS WERE VERY FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: This hotel is best suited for the business traveller, but I stayed recently with my family (wife & 2 kids under 10). The rooms are small, which is to be expected in a large urban area, but were comfortable and quiet. The best feature of the hotel is definitely LOCATION. You are two blocks from the Ferry building on the Embarcadero, 3 blocks from ground zero of Muni Transportation at Market Street, and three blocks from Chinatown.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This was a very nice and clean hotel. They have complementary water bottles, coffee and tea.

review.title: Excellent weekend choice
review.reviewText: Club Quarters is the perfect weekend hotel for the 2-3 day visit to San Francisco. You can walk just about everywhere and it is literally accross the street from the Ferry Building. You could take the ferry to San Francisco if you lived in the North Bay area. Price is definitely right also, for the weekender.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel offers free bottled water, coffee and tea, and internet service. These were nice ammenities. It was also a good location for us because the tours we took left out of the ferry building which was only a 5 minute walk. This hotel is close to the Embarcadero station so we took the BART from the airport to there for only $5.35 each. Cheaper than a taxi or shuttle.

review.title: convenient and reasonable
review.reviewText: New, clean, comfortable, walking distance to North Beach restaurants. Will definitely stay there again. Great weekend price.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel before and had a larger room. Although the room was small, overall this hotel is good value.

review.title: Downtown SF
review.reviewText: Not much around the hotel, but in safe area. With some effort you can walk to some of the city's attractions.

review.title: Super nice!
review.reviewText: The hotel was so quiet and in a great area. We stayed in a kitchenette (it had a king size bed with a single size sleeper couch there is no division in rooms however, just a really big entertainment center to serve as a "wall") and it was so comfortable. As a note, they provide everything you need (i.e. plates, glasses, silverware, pots, pans, mixing bowls, cutting knives) in case you want to cook in the kitchen. I loved it here and would recommend it to anyone. Only drawback is there is no ice machine, only a filtered water dispenser in the hallway. I would come prepared with your own beverages to place in the fridge. That's it...my only complaint! As a side note, I relied on other reviews regarding parking...please realize parking on the street is EXTREMELY difficult to find (not sure if it was because it was summertime or what) so be prepared to pay for parking. Most in the area are $38 a night. We purchased tickets for an open top bus tour that were good for 2 days (you can find these types of tours originating in Union Square) and didnt need our car. The cost ranges from $25-$32 per adult and in my opinion it is well worth it. Especially if you find one that will take you on a full loop for one price. I dont remember the name of the company, but the buses have an American Flag on the side of the bus. These will take you to the Golden Gate Bridge, Pier 39, Chinatown, etc. Oh, and make sure you bring a jacket! : )

review.title: Clean, efficient business hotel in the financial district
review.reviewText: This is a nice business hotel in a great location. Rooms are small, but are clean and comfortable. Location is quiet.

review.title: Great location and rooms were very clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: I liked this hotel due its location, price and quality of room for the price. It is fairly basic but you get free internet access in the main room off the lobby and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. You can hear your next door neighbors some and that was my only issue.

review.title: VERY NICE HOTEL, BUT ...
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was really not that impressive. The management however was very friendly. The room was big enough for 3 people, we stayed there with 2 teenagers (11 and 14), and we had to ask for an extra bed. The sleeping sofa is really only a wide "twin", no way can 2 people sleep on that comfortably. Also, we had to keep asking for extra towels, they consistantly left 2 towels and there was 4 of us in that room. Other than that, I was lovely to be able to bring our own food to the hotel and eat it there.

review.title: Great location! Clean and stylish rooms
review.reviewText: Very convenient location, within walking distance of start line for SF Marathon. Room was kind of small but fine for the location and price. Wish it had a bathtub but shower was fine, water presure-wise and brightness. Bed was very comfortable and room was quiet. Purified water 'station' was neat idea & handy! Hotel staff were okay - professional but not very engaging. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay downtown and within walking distance of Embarcadero and transit lines. Thank you!

review.title: Have been in better
review.reviewText: The hotel itself wasn't bad. We didn't get off the a good start with the hotel staff they really weren't helpful at all.

review.title: Good Value; Good Location
review.reviewText: This hotel offers good value in a good location. My room charge, including all taxes and fees, was much lower than the room rate alone for other hotels in the area. My room was small and minimalist (somewhat like a cruise ship cabin, although a little bigger)but clean and reasonably comfortable. Also be prepared for narrow hallways. The location, adjacent to the Financial District and pretty easy walking distance to Union Square, North Beach and the Ferry Building, was very good for me.

review.title: Business Hotel for the Idle Traveler
review.reviewText: Very modern hotel. Several available amenities for the business traveler. Still good for the leisure traveler as well. Had a very good deal for the weekend (i.e. Friday through Sunday).Well located in Financial District. One block from the Transamerica Building. If not taking cabs, good access to #1 Bus and California Street Cable Car. Also nearby are J Trolley and Montgomery Street BART Station both on Market Street(about a six block walk).

review.title: Great location - for business traveller
review.reviewText: In addition to helpful front desk, free and convenient access to internet helps a lot during my stay. I would definitely go back even though the TV set is way too "out of style", compared to their modern setup.

review.title: Good Find!!!
review.reviewText: Great location, rooms are very nice. Yes, they are small, and the bathroom is small too, but very efficient and pleasant. We were coming and going early in am and late at pm, so we had no trouble parking on the street.....be careful of street cleaning times, however. Make sure you're on the right side of the street on the right night!

review.title: Great value, convenient location.
review.reviewText: We've stayed at Club Quarters in San Francisco twice. It's now our hotel of choice.

review.title: Terrific Hotel with One Caveat
review.reviewText: I was delighted with Club Quarters--till my third night. Groups came in and partied--beginning at 3 am. One frankly expects better of a good hotel, even while recognizing they can't anticipate ever scenario.

review.title: Good Hotel And Location
review.reviewText: Located in good area of downtown close to attractions. Not far from BART (Bay Area Transit), trolleys, and buses. Room & bathroom was a little small but bed was very comfortable. Hotel staff was very helpful.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The stay here was great, the staff was friendly, they offered me some options for late night food when I called the front desk since I arrived a little after 11:00 p.m. The room was incredibly clean as were the sheets and the shower. My only complaint is that the bed wasn't too comfy, the pillows were, however the bed was not, although I feel thats a small price to pay for a relatively cheap hotel in a safe location close to many locations. Everything was within walking distance...if you like walking. Another perk is that they offer free bottled water. This hotel is really good and I would recommend it to anyone staying in SF.

review.title: Will Stay Here Again, and Again, and Again
review.reviewText: Stayed three nights at the CQ and really enjoyed my stay. This is the second time I have stayed here and it seems like it keeps getting better and better. The rooms are always clean. The shower had greater water pressure with lots of warm water. Free hi-speed and even includes a mini-fridge! The best part was the FREE, yes I said FREE, filtered water bottles! Instead of charging $5.95 for a 12 oz bottle if you take it from your room, they give you free water bottles and filtered water machines on your floor. This is such a HUGE asset and made me love the hotel even more. And of course, the location is absolutely perfect. A short walk to China Town, North Beach, Ferry Building, AT&T Park, and even Fisherman's Wharf. Note to CQ staff - "Keep my room ready for my next visit!"

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: If you want access to San Francisco's Embarcadero attractions this hotel is perfectly located. It's about a four block walk to get to the Embarcadero. Very nice.

review.title: Perfect Location!
review.reviewText: The hotel has all the amenities that I like, the bed is comfortable, the room is clean and well kept, the staffs are friendly and helpful, free internet & computers in the lobby with fresh coffee & ice-cold water, and close proximity to shopping, and public transit.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel - very new and plush. The staff were friendly as well and it was conveniently located in the Financial District - 5 mins walk to Chinatown, 5 mins from Embarcadero, a little over 10 mins to Union Square and close to North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf also. The Elephant & Castle bar onto the hotel was handy. There's also free internet access with 3 machines in a downstairs lounge area with a tv and tea/coffee laid out, which is a very nice touch. I'd definitely recommend the place.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: My stay was very pleasant. High quality bedding. Desk had a return for using your laptop. I booked the most basic room and was quite comfortable. It is not too small for one person. Upgrade if you want a refrigerator, microwave or bathtub. Helpful front desk staff.

review.title: Everything great except the wireless
review.reviewText: This place was great for the price -- and I would stay here again if they fix the wireless. It went up and down again and again during my stay. Everything else was great: decor, location (my interests are in North Beach and Chinatown), service, proximity to amazing restaurants, work desk, price... The decor reminded me of both a cruise ship and Japanese hotels -- things are small/compact and the doors are metal. There is only a shower (no tub).

review.title: Best Bang for your Hard Earned Buck :-)
review.reviewText: This boutique hotel is located in the Financial District in SF which means if you are trying to get away for the weekend, it's PERFECT! Plenty of street parking so you don't need to pay those ridiculous valet fees that other hotels are charging. It's a few minutes from Fisherman's Wharf and Union Square. Great hidden gem.

review.title: Club Quarters - simple and clean
review.reviewText: You don't get the flat screen tv or the stone counter tops in the bathroom or the luxurious comfort bed, but the room is decently sized and clean. I stayed for 2 nights and the only complaint I had was that maid service never came around after my first night's stay.

review.title: For business travelers
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco on business and needed a hotel that was walking distance from the Embarcadero Center. I found the Club Quarters on Expedia and booked because of its proximity and price. The hotel is different than any other I've used. Check-in was quick and elevator access is controlled by the room card. The room was a studio single and reminded me of a cruise ship cabin because it was so small. It was however comfortable and had everything a business traveler needs. I would stay here again if on business and will look for Club Quarters in other cities.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Simple decor. Liked the internet service and the filtered water machine.

review.title: San Francisco's Club Quarters
review.reviewText: We went to SF for a quick weekend trip and stayed at San Francisco's Club Quarters. The hotel was nice, the rooms are very small, but if you're not going to spend a lot of time there, then it's the perfect place. Close to everything, nice area.

review.title: Superb service
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location and is perfect for a weekender. We goofed up our reservation and the manager and receptionist fixed it post haste, absolutely graciously. The rooms are a little small, but who stays in their room in San Francisco except to sleep? Great stay, price, and comfort. Thanks, Club Quarters of San Francisco!

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText: The hotel is cute, room was small, but I was aware of that going in. It is really well-located to make a car unnecessary.

review.title: Just right
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at CQ while attending a seminar in San Francisco. The room size was small, but just what I needed for the trip since I was traveling alone. Two people would have been a tight squeeze and I would upgrade in that case. The hotel was clean and simple. CQ does cater to the business crowd but I am sure that this is due to the location being at the edge of the financial district. Within a few blocks of getting on/off cable cars. Within approx 15 blocks or so of the famous Fisherman's Wharf. Overall, just right!

review.title: Surprisingly Great
review.reviewText: I am a frequent business traveler and needed a reasonably priced room near the financial district in the city and decided to try this Club Quarters (had one bad exp with a Chicago one). It was as good as my normal Marriott or Hyatt and with inexpensive overnite parking around the corner at the Embarcadero Center. Food and coffee shops are accessible. I wish the bathroom was a little bigger but it was funcitonal. The bedding and furniture was new and the room was fine. I'd stay again.

review.title: Efficient space, good value in the City
review.reviewText: "Club" is apt. It sort of has the feel of frat grads in their next phase. Serious frats, though, not Animal House. Comfortable.

review.title: Terrific Chain
review.reviewText: CQ in SF was typical of this chain...clean, comfy, good service, good location. This particular one is located downtown near the Ferry Terminal (not near Fisherman's Wharf area or Union Sq). The area is busy during the day, but gets quiet at night. There's a movie theater across the street, but not a lot of good restaurants very close-by; Ferry Terminal is 10 min walk...not terrible, but the location of the CQs in NY and London are much better.

review.title: Absolutely adequate for my needs. Great Location. Small but well appointed.
review.reviewText: Staff professional and polite. Mattress/ pillows/ linens, good quality and comfortable. No moisturizer in bathroom.

review.title: Good hotel near Embarcadero plaza
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Good price for the location. Clean rooms and common areas.

review.title: Good for Alone Travel
review.reviewText: I stayed in the basic room. Small (which isn't uncommon for San Fran), but perfect for just 1 person. In the same building is a great Irish/English oriented bar with decent food and nightscene.

review.title: Great Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: Perfect location for conferences in the area, close to Chinatown, a nice walk to Union Square and a great price. Restaurant/Pub is convenient, reasonable and good food. Largest drawback was the parking situation. Only a block from the hotel, but was one of the most expensive parking areas I've seen in any of the larger cities.

review.title: Was ver y happy
review.reviewText: I thought that this hotel was very nice. I had read a comment of another person who had stayed there and gave it a bad review. This was a clean and nice hotel. The room was small but it had everything we needed for an overnight stay. I did not mind having to get a bottle of water and filling it myself. It was a convient location in walking distance from all the Piers and Chinatown.Just remember that you will have to park about half a block away.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: I was there with 2 high schools students and got a suite. It was a little crowded in the room, but comfortable. The staff at the front desk were so helpful and friendly- - giving us directions around town, and tips for getting to airports, getting around San Francisco, etc. We all had a great stay.

review.title: Will be staying here again
review.reviewText: I am very low maintenance when it comes to travel so to me this no-fuss great rate of this hotel is great! Convenient, comfortable, internet access and close to where I needed to be.

review.title: Good business hotel
review.reviewText: At first I was unsure if I liked it being an L shaped room. But then I realized this maximized privacy by having the bathroom at one end and the bedroom area at the other.It grew on me. Must be a well insulated building too as it was very quiet. Not exactly the one I would take my wife to as it is modernistic in look and the window stares out at a wall 15 feet away. But as a business hotel, thumbs up.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: The keycard used for both the elevator and the room quit working daily. Since it was so small, it did lack some of the more usual items in a room, but they do have free filtered bottled water available. The hotel is very close to all of the shopping.

review.title: Love the hotel, except shower.
review.reviewText: Hotel was fabulous!!! Except for the shower. The water spewed out onto the floor and I couldn't put down the hand-held shower nozzel. I think it was a room for handicaped folks.

review.title: mislead by reviews
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel before reading a lot of the reviews, and had I read them before I might have been mislead to stay there. I'm not sure why people write bad reviews. This hotel is ideally located in the central part of SF. It's close to the bay (3blocks for port of SF) and about 4 blocks for Market street. There is nice pub attached for quick grab and go, and like any typical corner in every city, there is even a starbucks for your high maintenance girlfriend attached to the corner of this hotel. Go figure. The room size (queen) was typical size to any big city hotel room. I definitely think it deserves a second look after reading most of the reviews, and most of the non-haters will be more than satisfied. I wouldn't go as far as to become a member, but it more than ever served its purpose... which before staying there I had nightmares about it from the reviews.

review.title: I'll stay there again.
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly. It is centrally located but in a quieter area than many of the downtown hotels. It is on the European side of design but not too small and nicely appointed.

review.title: A fine mid-priced hotel
review.reviewText: I was booked into this hotel for business travel, and it was fine. Clean, good amenities, well-located. I was given a room on the 3rd floor and the noise from the street was quite bad - had to wear ear-plugs. The rooms/doors also aren't particularly sound-proofed, and i was woken a couple of times in the early hours of the morning by loud groups of people returning to their rooms.

review.title: Quite impressed and would definitely stay here again.
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night--we were in town on business, but we were very pleased with the hotel and the food was fabulous in the bar/lounge. We will definitely stay here again. My uncle was meeting us there and got lost, the manager at the front desk gave him directions from my cell--greatly appreciated. Overall the stay was very pleasant. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Perfect room for someone who just needs a pied-a-terre.

review.title: Gets the job done
review.reviewText: Small rooms with little amenities, but for those looking for a clean business oriented hotel, this is the one for you. It's inexpensive yet offers free internet and just enough for either someone on a budget or conducting a business trip. It's also within walking distance of numerous major business and recreational spots.

review.title: Clean, efficient, good location
review.reviewText: We go to S.F. often and tried this hotel out as it had a 3.5 star rating, was reasonably priced and was near our business location. It is a reasonable hotel with some good amenities such as a nice lounge, a very convenient and well-rounded restaurant. The rooms were fine but somewhat low on the luxury scale. Not quite spartan but I would think this is more of a business hotel than a vacation hotel. I think 3.5 stars is appropriate overall but don't expect a lot of opulence.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet, hotel in downtown San Francisco; good value for the money considering location; fitness center somewhat small - not a problem as I was there Friday - Monday but might be different Tues - Thurs;

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was located in a great location - a 5 minute cab ride or a 20 minute walk from Fisherman's wharf and Little Italy. Also right near Chinatown and the fresh food market. The check-in was easy, the staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were roomy and well organized. Also free internet (with several computers) was great.

review.title: Fine if you don't have much luggage
review.reviewText: The room with microwave fridge sink was small but fine for one person, or two with limited luggage. Not that much storage so it's a bit cramped with two people and four cases. The studio with hob/oven was much more spacious though still limited storage.

review.title: Quite impressive
review.reviewText: This hotel was excellent for a business stay. Each of us (three travelers) were very impressed with the hotel and the appearance and comfort of the rooms. And the price was quite reasonable. Highly recommended. Avoid the restaurant next door. It's quite mediocre, and with the ample selection of excellent restaurants in SF, there's no reason to dine there.

review.title: Very impressed for the price
review.reviewText: It was an excellent hotel for the price.

review.title: Just right for those weekend stays
review.reviewText: We had one Saturday night here and found it to be perfectly fine. We had read reviews from here, and gave this hotel a try. It's location in the cbd of San Francisco can't easily be beaten for Market, Embarcadero and Union Square visits. The check-in desk staff were very pleasant. If you prepay (eg. via Expedia) beforehand then the process is a little different in that there are machines almost like ATMs in the check-in lobby that take your credit card and issue you your room key. The staff were helpful in assisting new guests like ourselves. We had read that the 'inner' rooms, i.e. those facing away from Clay St are quieter, and although we didn't check an outer-facing room, our inner room was very quiet, unusual for a San Francisco hotel room where I usually get woken up by the continual fire truck sirens. Yes, the room is small and the window has no view, overlooking a narrow alleyway. The bed linens and the room itself were very good quality, clean and crisp. There's free wifi and coffee machines in the room, but that's about it. The bathroom was clean and modern-style. There's no parking at the hotel, but there's city parking around the corner, and remember that there's free street parking on weekends and/or usually after 6pm - but check the meters for exact rules. We had breakfast at the Elephant & Castle, which had a buffet. Yes, I would probably find the room too small for 2 if we were there for a week+, but for the odd night or two in the City, we'd happily return.

review.title: Good location for weekend visit
review.reviewText: Overall well appointed facility but smaller rooms. Laundry on-site handy. Room was reserved (Internet) with queen bed but double was provided. Internet access in lobby was crowded taking about an hour in line to get relatively slow connection. Otherwise smaller lobby was able to handle weekend crowd.

review.title: Good place to stay.
review.reviewText: Clean ,quiet, close to almost everything. Perfect place if you don't rent a car . Walking is the best way to see San Francisco.

review.title: great sized suite
review.reviewText: This hotel was ideally situated in the middle of the finacial area close to transport, restaurants and attractions. The room was a great size for our family (2 adults, 2 young children) and gave us the ability to put the kids to bed and we could stay up later. It was also great to have kitchen wares in room for our own breakfast etc.

review.title: Nice, comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: Good hotel to stay in. Good service, good location, very clean.

review.title: Good SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Well located to several transit choices. Small but functional rooms. Clean. Nice lounge and exercise room. Roof terrace has nice view.

review.title: Very nice and convenient
review.reviewText: I went on a business trip and I enjoyed my stay very much. Location is great and the rooms are perfect for the business traveler, they even have direct phone lines. Some of the front desk staff were a bit cold (I guess I am too used to be greeted every time I go in or out of hotels), but helpful. I found that breakfast is a somewhat expensive in the hotel restaurant (it usually happens), but if you turn right just leaving the hotel, you will find a nice bagel shop in the next corner. The Starbucks on the left corner is a plus. And the Ferry Building Marketplace (4 blocks away, on the waterfront) has amazing deli options to eat there and to go.

review.title: Good price ratio hotel
review.reviewText: Extended a business trip in San Jose with 2 days in San Francisco. Good hotel. Room small by US standards, but greatly sufficient by European usage. Clean, seems to have been remodeled recently. Have not tested/qualified local public transports. Public parking round the corner pretty expensive, but usefull.

review.title: No Smoking Please
review.reviewText: When I checked into the hotel I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the room for the price paid. However, the enforcement of non-smoking floors is terrible. I complained a couple of times to which they had a security guard come smell the neighbors room to confirm and called the neighbors to tell them to stop. They claimed they weren't smoking, and the hotel staff refused to do anything else. I ended up getting moved from my suite to the smallest room in the hotel. One of my travel companions noted that there was smoking near her room as well. The management has promised to send a free night voucher and was at least responsive to my concerns after the fact. The management indicated that they are aware of the problem and that others have complained about similar experiences.

review.title: Great price for the location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very helpful, the hotel room very clean and the location is very conveniently situated in the financial district. Only one draw back, get a room that does not have a window to the side street where garbage is picked up. You'll get a wake up call every morning at 5:30 with the beeping of the truck backing up and the banging around of the garbage bins. Windows are not very sound proofed...

review.title: Inexpensive, Small rooms
review.reviewText: My wife & I spent a long weekend in SF at the end of Oct. Luckily, we did not plan to spend much time in the room at the hotel. It was a little cramped & not much room to unpack for 2 people. We chose the hotel for price & location not amenities. The hotel caters toward business travelers, not leasure. Staff was friendly. Hotel was clean. If you are looking for no frills & good price, this is not a bad choice.

review.title: Great Experience for First Trip to SF
review.reviewText: Very small room, but it didn't matter because we were out seeing the town most of the trip (2 days). Staff was friendly and helpful. A call to the front desk at 3 a.m. to complain about noisy neighbors was handled extremly quick and we were able to get back to sleep right away. Location was convenient to downtown. Nice restaurant and pub attached, Elephant and Castle: good food and service. Parking was expensive and inconvenently located.

review.title: Well located and friendly, good value
review.reviewText: Pleasant stay

review.title: No problems
review.reviewText: Smallish rooms, to be expected in a major metropolitan hotel. Well maintained. rooms on inside of hotel (not street side) are very very quiet. I had a room on the perimieter for 2 nights and I heard the fire engines leaving from the station across the way. The staff was extremely accommodating and very helpful, courteous. My family enjoyed it and it was a great location between Embarcadero and Chinatown. many many great restaurants within 5-10 minute walk.

review.title: Inexpensive and centrally located, but that's where it ends
review.reviewText: The hotel was small, but that's a SFO thing, although they were quite clean and modern. Although it's a business 'no-frills' hotel, I was shocked to find that they did not put irons/ironing boards in each room, but rather have a central 'guest ammenities' closet in the hallway -- that's going a bit beyond 'no frills'. The staff was pleasant, but be careful if you have them store your luggage because they have an extremely disorganized system and they were almost unable to locate a package that they stored for me.

review.title: Gem amonst the giants
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nicely located next to the embarcadero center is is less expensive than the hotels around it. room is modest but comfortable - service staff were kind, hospitable and very efficient.

review.title: Nice hotel, very good location
review.reviewText: Hotel personnel was great and the room was clean; and the best thing, the location, easy to get everywhere on downtown!

review.title: Great stay, great location
review.reviewText: This was my second time at Club Quarters and I was even more delighted the second time. I was upgraded upon arrival to a bigger room but it's the little things that make the stay so comfortable. Good customer service (who were happy to allow us to keep our bags behind the counter) and small things like free bottled water in the hallways.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel sits over a pub and a Starbucks. The pub goes until 1 am. The Starbucks staff start up at 4:30 am. Forget about any sleep. If you have the misfortune to stay in this hotel, do not let them give you a room on the second floor. They call the rooms suites, but they are not. The rooms are standard size with the bathroom in the middle. The hide-a bed is a single bed. This is not a hotel for families. The staff are the most uncaring ever.

review.title: Nice downtown SF hotel
review.reviewText: The Club Quarters hotel is typically a business hotel, and I found my accomodations quite nice. The room was clean and quiet, the included in-room internet access was great and it was just a few blocks walk to the bart Embarcadero station on Market Street.

review.title: non-smoking request not honored
review.reviewText: We arrived late and were placed in a smoking room despite a request to the contrary, as there were no non-smoking rooms avaialble. Although I realize the request via Expedia reservation is not binding, the hotel did not seem particularly apologetic or eager to please. To make matters worse, ventilation in the smoking portion of the hotel seemed to be non-existent, and I spent a very uncomfortable night.

review.title: Would go back in a heart beat.
review.reviewText: Great location. Most of the major attractions are within walking distance. Polite and friendly staff. The Elephant and Castle next door allows you to site see all day and then come back for a nice drink and a great meal.

review.title: Hotel is truly for business travel,
review.reviewText: it's comfortable,affordable and well maintained. As a lone woman traveling for business I felt safe and relaxed, the front desk was very helpful the restaurant however had a lot to be desired.

review.title: Nice clean hotel
review.reviewText: Quiet, clean hotel. Close to shopping district (Embarkodero). Small room, but that's life in San Francisco, hahaha

review.title: Good value, no frills hotel
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a place to stay in San Francisco with great rates and not expecting to stay in your hotel except to sleep then this is one of the best values out there. I stay there with my wife for a weekend trip to SF. It is located in the financial district, thus very safe and relatively clean. It is also right across the Embarcadero shopping mall where there are a few restaurants to try out. The Elephant Castle is right underneath the hotel and always seem to be full of people. It is within walking distance to Chinatown and close to Bart and Muni stations. You can take a short taxi ride to Fisherman's Wharf for about $10-15. You can easily get a taxi across the street from The Le Meridian Hotel. The staff was very friendly. We got there at 11:30am and they let us check in early. Check out was even easier as they had machines where you can just insert your credit card and the receipt prints out right away. We had no incidentals, so no receipt printed out and we were out of there in less then a minute. The rooms are small and there were little amenities. No safe for documents or cash, no toothbrush either. But, there is a Safeway less then 5 mins away. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good price in a good location without the extras of a big hotel.

review.title: Very nice place and good location
review.reviewText: Nice sized rooms that were well appointed and plenty comfy. Not the lap of luxury, but still very good. Only negative was that the TV was pretty small (like 19"). This is a place where professional travelers stay.

review.title: Great stay at a great price!!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location. Easy to get anywhere. Rooms are small, but very well designed. When I first saw the room, I was taken back by it's small size, but after 3 nights, I realized that it was one of the best designed rooms I have stayed in. I have stayed in rooms twice this size and felt more cramped. Lots of storage space available. Restaurant next door has good food and an excellent beer list. Hotel staff weren't exactly friendly, but were very service oriented. I would recommend this hotel to any cost conscious visitor to San Francisco!!

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in the business district. Easy access to MUNI bus lines. Hotel is a 5 block walk to Embarcadero BART station. Hotel has club room for reading daily newspapers, free access to 3 computers, free coffee. Hotel room had a desk for working, some books for reading, and free internet access for your laptop. Room was not too large. It might be a little cramped for 2 people.

review.title: Excellent room for a reasonable price
review.reviewText: The hotel was superior to my expectations. The area is close to the financial district and hence a bit quiet after about 9 pm on the weekends, but generally seemed quite safe. The hotel staff were courteous and provided helpful advice. The Elephant and Castle next door is top-notch English pub and is convenient if one gets in late and cannot get a bite elsewhere downtown. The room was well maintained and quiet. The only problem was that we got a room furthest away from the elevator. However, the hotel provided drinking water and bottles next to the elevator so that was perfect. All in all, a place I would recommend to others going to San Francisco.

review.title: Great location for weekend in SFO
review.reviewText: This was a great find! Hotel looks brand new and location is perfect for a weekend in the city. Ferry Building and Embarcardero minutes walk away. Columbus Ave and Italian restaurants closeby. Convenient for all San Fran kitschy transit options.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Centrally located within walking distance of the Stadium and the Wharf. The rooms are clean and quite.

review.title: Great Moderate Hotel Chain
review.reviewText: Our group had two rooms at this hotel in SF for a short weekend, and we were all very pleased. The rooms are very sound-proofed, which surprised me for SF. We've stayed at several hotels in SF, and for having an exterior, street-view room, having a silent room was very peaceful. Also, there's a Starbucks practically next door, and a cute restaurant attached to the lobby. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and check-in/out is very easy. I will stay in this hotel again, and am interested in trying out the rest of the chain.

review.title: great location with very good price
review.reviewText: nice hotel in good location. Starbucks was next door! Rooms were clean and neat but not fancy or overly decorated. Queen bed was ok. Hotel does not have king beds. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nothing fancy but nice
review.reviewText: The room was a moderate size and clean. Nothing fancy, but it served its purpose for the few days it was there. It's just a few blocks down to Pier 1 on the waterfront and a relatively short trolly ride down to Fisherman's Wharf and the other tourist areas.

review.title: Ok if nothing else available
review.reviewText: We stayed one night and went to an event in the marina district. Parking was not included and not explained. We ended up paying $30 dollars to park across the street. The check in and service was great. The room was small and somewhat cramped for 2 people, more suited to a single business traveler. We ordered extra pillows and they were delivered within 30 minutes. The embarcadaro shopping center was so close and convenient. The bed was very uncomfortable, comparable to a cardboard box, but the pillows were awesome. The towels were brand new and shed terry all over when we dried off. Starbucks close by always a plus. Check out was confusing. Would not return.

review.title: Clean, Great Service & Free Wifi
review.reviewText: The perfect place for the reasonable price. Just the basics and no frills. The room was super clean and the service was attentive. Great location next to the Embaradero Center near Pier 39! I will go back again.

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: Nice location. Good value for the money. Recommended for a short stay.

review.title: Compact but Great especially for the Price
review.reviewText: A great place to stay if you don't expect luxury. A bit like being on a submarine (halls very narrow, for example). One small drawback is that on the weekend there aren't many places open in the financial district -- we were uncomfortable at night walking around. You have to eat at the restaurant adjacent or walk to the ferry building.

review.title: Good hotel to stay one or two night for visiting San Francisco, Very Clean.
review.reviewText: Good hotel to stay one or two night for visiting San Francisco, Very Clean.

review.title: Great Value and location
review.reviewText: Next to Embarcadero shopping and minutes from waterway walkway to Fishermans warf which is 1 mile by walk. Close to all public transportation. Next to Transamerica pyramid for visible location no matter where you are. This is for singles or couples as rooms are probably too small for families. No pool etc. Great for a tourist couple though. Really good service and clean. Resteraunt next door is a 6 on a scale of ten due to service but food was good and probably a good bar if you drink. Room was very nice and above my expectation for the money. Not many homeless around compared to some of the Market Street areas. A great value on weekends but during week the rates get a boost so we moved down the road.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Very happy with the location, cleanliness and price of this hotel in downtown area. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: We are going to choose the same hotel in Boston, MA
review.reviewText: It is a good hotel to stay when you visit San Francisco, because is very closed to the interesting places, and the rooms, bed, bathroom and service are quite good. We only had a problem in the bathroom, because it wasn't shampoo and we should ask for it everyday.

review.title: Very Comfortable Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: After reading some reviews, I was expecting the room to be quite small. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived to see that was not the case. I thought it was a fantastic value for the price. I got a suite with a kitchenette. I wanted to make my own food and was delighted to find that there was a Safeway about 10 minutes away (on foot). I would have liked there to be more counter space in the bathroom and the kitchenette. I have a lot of toiletries, a hairdryer, and a straightener so it got tight with all that stuff. Granted, this wouldn't be an issue for male travelers. Since it was just me, the counter issue wasn't too bad, but I could definitely see it being very tight with two people. I loved that they supplied free bottled water. The location is great, about a 15 minute walk from the Westfield Mall. I was really happy with the service. I needed a lot of help with directions and they were always very helpful and pleasant with answering those questions. The bed was very comfortable and so was the couch. I especially appreciated the free internet connection as well as the dvd player. The gym is small, but fairly well-equipped, but that didn't matter too much because I preferred to run outside anyway. I found the area was safe and fairly busy. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Fantastic location made it convenient for us to see all the surrounding attractions we could possibly fit into our short trip. Room was small but well designed and appointed. Great value.

review.title: strongly recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: it was a very pleasant environment. nice service, cosy setting..great experience, value for money!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We had a party of 17 old and young, everyone had a room that was suited for them, and if anyone had to make a request it was done immediately. The only confusion was with expedia as they had to many reservations under one name, early arrivals in the party had to sort through the confusion. The hotel courteously made the changes, the hotel and facilities is located in San Francisco's business district, walkable to many interesting places. Our stay was perfect.

review.title: Had a great stay
review.reviewText: My Husband, I and 2 kids enjoyed our stay at Club quarters very much. The room was very clean and the refrigerator & microwave came in very handy for snacks and quick meals. We did have to ask for more towels but they were delivered quickly and with courtesy. We love to walk places so the location was great - within reasonable distance to just about everything. It was very quiet in the Financial district on the weekend and many businesses are closed. We would definately stay there again.

review.title: Excellent location and perfect for our needs
review.reviewText: We knew what to expect with this hotel chain and we were not disappointed. Clean, small, affordable, when in San Francisco, is all you really need when you're two people out seeing the city. Close to the municipal transport system, you can catch a bus, tram, cablecar within 2-3 blocks. Not recommended for families, or when you need parking. You come here to rest and sleep in comfort, cleniness, and security. Service is good too!

review.title: Good Deal, Good Location
review.reviewText: The room was clean, comfortable and a good location for getting around. The free chilled, distilled water was the only perk but one I very much appreciated. The walls are a bit thin so you might want to have a set of earplugs. For the quality, cleanliness, and price it was the best deal I could've found in S.F. and I'd definitely consider staying there again.

review.title: Business Hotel
review.reviewText: This is an excellent no frills hotel. I probably wouldn't go back for leisure travel, but if I were to return on business this would be a definate possibility for a stay.

review.title: close to everything we wanted to do
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable and clean.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Club Quarters on a weekend leisure trip to San Francisco and felt it was a good value. The service was friendly and good, the room was clean. Like so many SF hotel rooms, though, it was very small. The hotel is in a good location for business travelers, right by the Embarcadero and Financial District, and it's not a long walk from there to North Beach, but there are better locations for leisure travelers.

review.title: Great choice for a business stay in SF
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great choice for a business stay in SF. Not luxurious, but very comfortable in every sense: great location, nice room, helpful staff, small gym on site and arrangement with gym one block away, laudry facilities. It's next to the Embarcadero Center and financial district, and within walking distance to North Beach and Chinatown. There are plenty of dining choices nearby.

review.title: Overrated!
review.reviewText: Don't dare hope for an early check-in (unless you want to pay a $30 add'l charge for both early and late check-ins/outs) cuz you'll be given a glare by mature staff and told to return at 3pm. Our queen room was small w/poor lighting and inefficient ventilation. Younger staff attentive and prompt, thou. Weak bath linen and bath amenity stock. TV too small to enjoy from bed. Perfect for a solo college student who's use to dorm rooms.

review.title: Good weekend deal
review.reviewText: Small but very comfortable room is better suited for business traveler than families/tourists. Close to Ferry building and Embarcadero, but many stores and restaurants closed in the financial district on Sat nite and Sunday. Parking lots close by, but expensive -- as elsewhere in SF. (Free street parking on Sunday.) Excellent deal for the reduced weekend price!

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: We spent a Friday night at Club Quarters in San Francisco. Everything was fantastic! The only drawback was having to pay 30.00 for parking in a garage with no in and outs. It was great to have the pub and a Starbucks on location. Very convenient!

review.title: Always Dependable
review.reviewText: Club Quarters has always been dependable. It's my hotel of choice for value in San Francisco. The standard rooms are small, but nicely furnished with a desk, and an armchair and a firm mattress. Apples at the desk, and in the comfortable lounge which also has a nice fireplace, coffee and tea, and a large selection of newspapers and magazines. This is a small membership hotel - no bellmen, ironing boards are in a closet near the elevators. Free bottled water. Starbucks and an Elephant and Castle restaurant are downstairs.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: While conviently located the hotel doesn't offer enough amenities for the price. For a 3 1/2 star hotel I expected at the very least a bell hop to offer assistance with my luggage. I've had that at 2 star hotels!! The pillows were deplorable. They offered nothing in support and when I asked I was told that " was all the have " The attached pub was nice, but you would have to ask them for service if you wanted more than just drinks.

review.title: Fine for what it is
review.reviewText: The hotel is not a full service hotel, but the rooms are clean and comfortable. If you know it is not full service, you will not be surprised. I have stayed at the hotel several times now. It is very convenient.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with this hotel. The staff was friendly, the room was very clean and well maintained. We would stay there anytime.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, comfortable, and modern in decor. The staff were friendly, helpful and responsive. The hotel also provides refillable bottled waters-which was a nice amentity. The only thing was that the room was smaller than most hotel rooms, and there was no hotel parking. I would stay there again anytime. I highly recommend the place to others!

review.title: Iron and Ironing Board
review.reviewText: For those of us that travel and find our suits and shirts need a quick pressing, it would be nice to have an iron and ironing board in each room.

review.title: Very easy to get in and out of!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel! No onsite parking is the only drawback.

review.title: Tight Quarters!
review.reviewText: The room was extremely small! For the price it was not worth it. If price doesn't matter, the staff was very nice!

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The Club Quarters in San Francisco was a wonderful location. The room,a king suite, was setup perfectly for a businessman...a little austere for pleasure. Although we had a beautiful view of the Bay Bridge and Bay down Clay Street. The only complaint I have is that the sofa bed for the third person was a torture chamber.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel for a long time. Always great.

review.title: Great for business or leisure
review.reviewText: Amenities: great features mainly geared to business travelers and budget leisure travelers. Downside was the limited room service options, and wireless access was a bit sketchy in the room, although strong in the guest lounge. Location: Although it is a little dead in this part of downtown San Fran at night, the location is great for proximity to the Embarcadero/Ferry Building, Market Street, Chinatown - just a little further walk to Union Square and shopping but if you don't mind the exercise it is perfect. Service: very attentive and prompt - professional staff all the way around.

review.title: Decent Value
review.reviewText: Block and tackle hotel, clean and straightforward, nothing fancy but not too expensive, decent value for the price. Location is great for Embarcadero business.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: As an ex-travel agent, I have stayed in many hotels throughout the world--from five-star on down. This hotel is located right across from the a very expensive hotel and the price was very economical. The staff were pleasant and helpful; and you had access to free bottled water which is unheard of in most hotels regardless of price. It was in walking distance of a great deal of S.F., including the Museum of Modern Art. Cable cars and busses are also convenient. I definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: clean, modern, comfertable
review.reviewText: everything was great, except it's a little far from walking destenations and bart

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: The room was clean, nicely decorated and just the right size for one person. Staff was very accomodating. Was close to shopping, restaurants and public transportation. Area gets quiet at night. Just right if you need to work in your room. Desk and chair very convenient for me.

review.title: Just what we were looking for...
review.reviewText: Helpful staff, convenient location and reasonable rates made for a satisfying experience at Club Quarters.

review.title: Will return
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was great. Facilities are good as well. Rooms are small but have all amenities. Besides what else do you need when your just sleeping for the night. It is in a great location and is very clean. Will definately go back. The only down side is the street noise, winter must not be insulated. Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper.

review.title: Better then I had expected
review.reviewText: We had an amazing trip to San Francisco and a big part of it was due to the Club Quarters. This hotel is in the Financial District and as we were there for the weekend it was very quiet, a nice surprise. There is a Starbucks right next door so that would be my first stop in the morning. We would walk to Fishermen's Wharf, a fair distance but we love to walk and it was beautiful. We were able to walk to restaurants, shopping etc. from our location. I had read in the reviews about the small rooms, I have stayed in many rooms that were much smaller then this one. The only thing that I can say about this is that it is not really a private bedroom as there is only a half wall separating it from the living area. If my family and I had the opportuniy to go back again we would not hesitate to stay here.

review.title: Great for business travelers. Alley rooms not that good for light sleepers.
review.reviewText: I stayed at the most basic room offered, 1 queen bed with no bells/whistles. The room was very small, but very functional for business. Desk was very large, it had a cabinet that could roll out for extra work space, could print from my room to a printer downstairs stocked with very high quality paper, lighting was great for working, internet access was free. The bed and bed linens were very nice. The room was very clean, bottled water was free. My two gripes: first, my 4th-floor room was facing the alley. The alley had trash pick-up as late as 12:30 at night, and deliveries as early as 6 AM. Both woke me up, all five nights, including a Sunday. Second, the room is so narrow that there was no space to put a TV right in front of the bed. So they put a very small TV (20-inch) high up on a bookshelf on the side of the room -very uncomfortable if you like to watch TV in bed. I've stayed in similar rooms in other cities where they solve this problem by hanging a flat screen TV in front of the bed.

review.title: centrally located hotel close to all attractions
review.reviewText: I would recommend the hotel as it is located centrally and close to all attractions.

review.title: High quality, good value
review.reviewText: This hotel was ideally located for out 27th anniversary activities - Beach Blanket Babylon in North Beach, Segway ride near Fisherman's wharf and the Saturday market at the Ferry Building. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet. We didn't have occasion to use the hotel restaurant or other facilities. Price was right. We asked for and got an outside room - not a fabulous view, but we weren't sitting around looking out the window anyway. I would definitely return and am looking at joining the club or having my trade group do so.

review.title: Dorm accomodations
review.reviewText: Blocks from the Embarcadero, a stroll away from Market street the location is impeccable. However, the labrynthine hallways that remind me of a maze and were not guest friendly. The room is adequate, clean, and well laid out. But, the gloomy dorm room colored paint over metal on the doors and frames, the shower stall reminiscent of a high school locker room, and the closet that doesn't even hold an ironing board or iron make this a definite no-no for a vacation hotel. If you're looking for convenience of location and require the bare minimums then this place is fine. But, if you are looking for any sort of style, comfort, elegance, comfort, or relaxation this is not your hotel. The rooms definitely reminded me of a dormitory or military style accomodations. Actually it wasn't far off from getting a room on a train, just with more square footage. To be fair, this hotel really caters to business travelers and even comes equipped with a dictionary and a copy of Stephen Covey's Seven Habits of Highly Effective People. And, if you prefer dining in they even have several local restaurants that will deliver to the hotel (Chinese, Indian, or pub fare, etc.). As other reviews state, it's fine for business but it doesn't accomodate pleasure.

review.title: Straightforward, Clean, Attentive Staff
review.reviewText: Great place to stay in San Fran - central, inexpensive, clean... Rooms are a bit small on front side of hotel (request a room that does not end in -01 or -02) but other than that, this is an ideal place to stay.

review.title: Definitely would stay here again...
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located (4 blocks from the Embarcadero BART stop) to many attractions. The rooms were on the smaller side, but they were very clean. The hotel staff was very pleasant, I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Small but nice
review.reviewText: The hotel is tastefully decorated and centrally located. The rooms are tiny, but clean and well-equipt for a single traveler or a couple who aren't lugging too much "stuff"--there would be no where to put it. Small closet and no dresser. Our shower did not work and my husband and I didn't know that until a half hour before we were supposed to depart for an evening event. We called the front desk and a plumber was sent up immediately. He couldn't fix the problem. My husband "showered" in the sink and I was given a key to the empy room down the hall. An inconvience, to say the least. After our event... past mindnight... we switched rooms. Club Quarters gave us a free night at the hotel without our asking. We think that was fair and will stay there again when we are in town next month.

review.title: Competent, complete hotel.
review.reviewText: Even a suite is not that large, but the room has everything that you need. For the money, it is a great value.

review.title: Great Hotel for Business Travel
review.reviewText: This hotel has everything I look for when I travel to San Francisco on business. Convenient location, clean well kept confortable rooms and reasonably priced. There is also a pub style establishment, on the ground floor, that has good food and a pleasent environment. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on business in the downtown area.

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: We couldn't have been happier with this hotel. Perfect location, the most comfortable bed and sheets I have every slept on. Bottled water on each floor. The room decor was amazing. The restaurant next door has great food!

review.title: Great place to stay close to everything!
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. It was right across the street from a very expensive hotel. It was within walking distance to China Town, Russian Hill, Embarcadero and even within 4 blocks of a 24 hour fitness. I would definately recommend this place to anyone wanting to spend a nice getaway in S.F.

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and clean. Room and bathroom were small, but that was expected for the great price. There was a great shopping plaza right across the street with lots of great places to eat also. Only negative things were that the fan didn't work in the bathroom (we didn't have time to call and see about getting it fixed though) and the room had a window but you couldn't open it for fresh air.

review.title: Not bad but can do better
review.reviewText: I was warned that the room was small but did not realize it was that small. It's more comparable to a room on a cruise ship. The size was not a problem at all because the room was really clean and tidy. My disatisfaction was from the lack of amenities in the room -- 1 towel and 1 pillow per person -- I'm not used to that. Another problem was the extremely thin walls. Everytime our neighbor open their door, it seemed like they were opening our door.

review.title: Hotel was clean and quiet, room service bad
review.reviewText: Staff was nice. I ordered room service and was told 25 minutes. In an hour I called and they forgot. They brought it to me at no charge but got charged $3.00 for delivery. In Chicago Club Quarters, there was a door man, coffee, water, cookies and treats in the lounge. San Francisco do not have either. the place was clean and quiet.

review.title: Good choice for single traveller
review.reviewText: Club Quarters is a nice place for a short stay in the city. The room was clean albeit small. Convenient to all public transit and a short walk to Union Square & China town. Only 2 things kept me from giving totally satisfied rating. 1) The bed was too firm for my taste. OK for a short stay, say 3 or 4 days at the most. 2) I asked for a late checkout and the concierge neglected to tell me that I needed to get my card reprogrammed. So, I couldn't get back in my room when I left for a bit. They took care of that quickly though. All in all, a good value in my book.

review.title: Best value for the price
review.reviewText: Excellent location, clean rooms, fast check in/out, friendly staff, convenient complimentary services including free internet access.

review.title: Good for Business-OK for Leisure
review.reviewText: Staff was great and check in was very efficient and fast. Three computers available with internet and printers. Room was nice, but small. Room size is fine for one person, but I traveled with my wife and it is on the small side for two people.

review.title: Good Locatio
review.reviewText: Very good overall, but rooms are extremely small. Other than that, very good. Location is excellent

review.title: San Francisco Best Kept Secret
review.reviewText: Easy access to any thing and everything the financial district has to offer. Two blocks to the Port of San Francisco. 4 blks to Market St. 2 blks to California. I mention this as these streets are access points to transportation. I recommend you do not need an automobile. No parking. Unless you need to leave the city auto not necessary. The Club Quarters staff went out of there way to assure comfort and information. No internet access fees, wireless access high speed. Whether business, pleasure or family travel this hotel has it all.

review.title: Perfect place to stay
review.reviewText: Club Quarters is the perfect place to stay for business travelers or people that do not want to spend a lot of time in the room. The fast and convenient service was wonderful.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: A nice hotel in a good location. The place was clean, had good facilities in the room and the staff were friendly. Its location, in the Financial District, is close enough to many major attractions (such as Chinatown, Coit Tower, the Ferry Building and the city centre shops) but far enough away from some the less desirable places in SF - it's in a safe area. Overall, I would certainly use this hotel again. The pub next door was expensive, but there are plenty of other eating and drinking choices within 10 mins walking distance.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to all activities including Pier 39, transportation was easily accessable, room and hotel was very clean and hotel staff was very pleasant. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Ok

review.title: Extraordinary Value for Business Traveler!
review.reviewText: Stayed in the 2-room suite with Queen bed, twin sleeper sofa, two TV's, desk and kitchenette for less than most other regular hotel rooms in the area. Clean and comfortable room, good restaurant, great service, quick self-checkout. Self-bottled water, coffee, apples, cookies, wired internet, wireless internet thoughout hotel, printing, four computers in club house, fitness center...all complimentary! Absolutely my first choice next time in the San Francisco Financial District for business.

review.title: Compared with their neighbours, this is extraordinary value
review.reviewText: Directly in front of a 5 star hotel which costs 2x as much. Hotel is comfortable, safe, free wireless email, reasonable gym (free weights available). Didn`t try the restaurant/bar which connects through the basement, but looked ok. Very good value.

review.title: Great work hotel.
review.reviewText: This is one of the better hotels to stay at if you are traveling for business. It's geared towards the work traveler, yet serves the after hours requirement quite well.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: I'm not too familiar with San Fran rooms in general, but this hotel was nice. It was secure, the staff were friendly, and the internet worked! We stayed in the largest room (suite), and found it small- but maybe that's normal for San Francisco. Could've stayed at a different hotel for less $ and same facilities, but this was a nice place.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: This hotel has the best location. It is within walking distance from everything. Your legs will hurt after a while, but the area is safe, clean, and beautiful to look at. The hotel also was very clean, friendly staff, and must say very close to a Starbucks. :)

review.title: good, thin walls
review.reviewText: Small room but clean, small bathroom but clean, great wireless internet, friendly service, knowledgeable about the area. Only negative: very thin walls, could hear neighbor's phone ringing easily, his alarm effectively woke me up also. Still I would probably stay here again if on business.

review.title: Good deal for the price
review.reviewText: Overall my stay was great with one exception. My room was directly over the dumpters so every night when I was going to bed and very early every morning the garbage trucks were out there making a ton of noise.

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText: Nice hotel located in the financial district. Walk distanced to cable car stop, China town, Transamerica building and Embarcadeiro.

review.title: Clean and efficient, good price, great location
review.reviewText: It's like the Southwest Airlines of hotels.

review.title: Basic
review.reviewText: These gusy save money in smart ways. Room for one - they give you two bath towels, one hand towel and a washcloth. Never understood what I was supposed to do with foru bath towels and six washclothes. Amenities - soap for sink, soap for shower, one shampoo, no cream rinse. Make-up mirror, hairdryer. Small closet, lots of hangers. Books in room, two non fiction and a dictionary - very nice! Very very very slow wireless with no option for pluggin in. I gave up and went to my office early.

review.title: European style hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms are very small, like in Europe, but for one person it is fine. My room faced an alley, so was awakened by garbage truck every 2 am. Ask for a room in front or back of building.

review.title: Location and Price
review.reviewText: This is a hotel for business people, so it has good amenities, quiet, and a good location, but its not meant for people who want luxury. Since we spend most of our weekends in SF outside near the water, it was a perfect choice for us, and we will certainly use it again.

review.title: Perfect downtown business hotel
review.reviewText: I needed a reasonable place to stay for an early morning downtown (financial district) appointment. Club Quarters is perfect. It is centrally located (a block from the TransAmerica tower and I could easily walk the few blocks to my appointment. Parking is convenient (if you need a car in San Francisco) about a block away on the same street. There are numerous restaurants in the area as the hotel does not have their own, but the Elephant Bar next door has an entrance from the hotel. The lobby and lounge are high end, and service is professional and curteous. Rooms are small, about half the size of mid priced hotel, with finishes on a par with upper end hotels. Though compact there is a desk and chair, ample electrical outlets, and free high speed internet. The bed is very comfortable, and bathroom is modern and clean with a stall shower. It's a little tight for two, but ideal for the single business traveler, which appears to be their target market. Oh, and a 24 hour fitness room with machines and weights too. And across the street from a delux hotel with $$$$ rooms. I'll go back.

review.title: nice value, great location,
review.reviewText: we liked the club quarters. it was significantly less expensive than the conference hotel a couple blocks away, easy to get around since its not a big hotel, great attached bar and starbucks on the corner. pillows and bedding were ave. but the room was clean and staff was friendly. nice lobby with plenty of computers and areas to read.

review.title: Nice hotel, small room, but nice and clean and new
review.reviewText: My wife and I went for a long weekend. The location is good, right in the heart of the financial district. It is right around the corner from the Federal Reserve. A muni (bus stop) is right across the street which was nice. The hotel was nice and very clean. The room was pretty small, but was updated and the bed was comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel met all of my needs.

review.title: Great little hotel well situated
review.reviewText: While the rooms and conditions are designed for a single business traveler, my wife and I found the hotel very comfortable for a weekend in SF. Good place to take a long walk without having to scale the hills of SF. Nearby Farmer's Market, Embarcadero Center and lots of great restaurants. On weekends you can find parking on street, which saves you some $30. Very good value. You can pay more and get more, but if you are not interested in living in your room, Club Quarters fits the bill nicely.

review.title: Nicer than expected
review.reviewText: the room was small but very comfortable. perfect if you are there to spend time in the city and just come to your room to shower, change, and sleep.

review.title: Affordable, friendly, convenient, kinda cramped
review.reviewText: It was a good price and we weren't planning on spending a lot of time in the room. We were prepared for a small room in a sleepy neighborhood. The place was very clean and quiet. and the room was spotless, with a pleasant, neutral smell. A+ rating on the bed and pillows. Staff was friendly and helpful. Nice patio on the roof. Parking in nearby garages is $25 a day, but we were able to park on the street for free Sunday and (Monday which was a holiday). Its in the financial district, so the neighborhood is safe and quiet, but the streets roll up early and you'll have to travel for SF culture (or even a liquor store). Just a few easy blocks to BART, MUNI, Market St., Chinatown and Embarcadero. Only negatives were the small size of the [corner] room we had. College dorm room style decor. Just enough room for the bed, nightstand, desk and wall mount TV. With 2 people it was pretty tight. We were charged $3.10 for 3 local calls, which seemed a bit steep. No irons in the rooms, sheets changed daily "upon request". The pub next door is open till midnight and has a good selection of beer on tap. We ordered fish and chips and it was mediocre. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the CQ and would consider staying there again if the price was still right. A convenient and friendly spot for a business person without a car or tourists just looking for a clean room to sleep and shower in.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is in an older building that has been renovated. The initial impression was very disappointing. There was no valet parking and neither any parking provided by the hotel. We had to park about a block down the street in a public parking ($32/day). The person who was attending the reception at the time of our arrival was on a personal call. It took him quite a while to acknowledge our presence (a couple with a 2 yr old kid) and then he proceeded to take our information and check us in the most ungraceful and inhospitable way, obviously annoyed that he had to put his call on hold. We asked for a crib that he promised to deliver but never did. We had to call again later and talk with another person for the crib to arrive. We almost walked out due to that person. The room was fairly small and cramped for a suite but clean and well equipped. The rest of the hotel personnel were very polite and helpful but that first encounter set the mood for our whole stay. The hotel did provide high speed wireless internet access and they offered a nifty printing feature through printme.com where you sent a print job from your room and retrieve the print out from a printer in the general lobby area. It would be very helpful if the printer was not out of toner and the paper was not the flimsiest possible. Our stay was not a disaster but next time I will be looking for something better, I don't think it worth its price.

review.title: Great location close to Farmers Market and Embacadero
review.reviewText: staff courteous and helpful rooms are on the small side and did not have a view it was like a maze getting to the room try to get a room close to the elevator they offer limited room service from the restaurant extra pillows blankets an iron and ironing board had to be picked up by you from utility closet each floor has one an its first come first get mini refrigerator is available by request loved the laundry convenient washer and dryer have plenty of coins

review.title: Small room but extremely well appointed
review.reviewText: We were quite amused with the saize of the room but the quality of the facilities and staff was very good. Space for unloading/loading luggage is a trick and having to park around the corner is a bit of a pain. Very central for walking and sightseeing.

review.title: Great Hotel with a Parking Nightmare
review.reviewText: The Hotel was Great. Top Notch in every way. Parking in Downtown San Francisco is a Nightmare

review.title: Quiet Space
review.reviewText: Club Quarters SF was very quiet. The only negative for me was sound travelling between rooms -- this could get irritating on a longer stay! Easy to walk to the Embarcadero -- one of the reasons I chose it.

review.title: Very Chic Hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great surprise. I stayed in it because the hotel where my conference was held was too much money. The room was very comfortable, decorated very elegantly, there were all the ammenities of an apartment in my little room even though I didn't ask for cooking facilities. The front desk people were extremely friendly, helpful, and gave me great tips and directions. I can't say enough of how great it was and it was a decent price!

review.title: San Francisco visit
review.reviewText: Clean utilitarian hotel. Good WiFi access. We had a bad view out the window - (a wall) - but there are better views. Nice little roof top table / picnic spot. Easey walking to Ferry Building and Market Street as well as the Embacadaro shopping area.

review.title: Very pleased with our stay
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our Friday night stay at club quarters. Quick walk to the Ferry building where there are good light-eating choices.Very clean and attractive rooms. Pleasant staff. Its geared toward work-week people but made a convenient and comfortable weekend night hotel. Would stay again.

review.title: Club Quarters for business
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel on a recent trip to San Francisco for a business trip. The hotel is neat and clean. The front desk staff was couteous and pleasant. The room, while small, was well appointed, clean and had wireless internet access. The location was walking distance to the business district and close enough to the pier and wharf areas for walking and jogging. The hotel's gym is small, but had treadmills, stationary bikes and free weights.

review.title: small room, but very clean and good location
review.reviewText: i needed to be close to the financial district so it was the perfect location for me. the room was small, not what i am used to, but very clean. if you need this location it is worth it...but the omni and fairmont in town are gorgeous. and the le meridien looks nice and it is across the street. very small, but clean.

review.title: Well-Priced, Well Located Business Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay and will return. The room was good sized, comfortable, and tastefully decorated in European style with a small refrigerator and microwave. Parking is 2 blocks away, but is easily accessible and inexpensive by San Francisco standards.

review.title: Great for business travelers
review.reviewText: They clearly have the business traveler in mind with amenities targeted at such -- easy check-in/out, wireless or wired internet for free, desk in a small room, central city location. All for a very reasonable price!

review.title: Location, Location!
review.reviewText: Location says it all...easy to get to; easy to get around. Great for business folks and airline folks especially, it would seem.Our room ajoined another and noise was a concern(metal doors and wide spaces at bottom!). No refrigerator aftr it was advertised. Staff was not very helpful. More interested in telling you what they couldn't do, than how they could help.Many spoke poor English.Turned the mattress ourselves, but it didn't help. Had to request extra wash cloths,glasses etc. repeatedly.

review.title: Nothing Special
