review.reviewText: Small rooms with so-so furnishings. The "Automated" checkin/checkout functions never seemed to work. At least the lobby staff was helpful. The attached restaurant (a fake "English Pub") is kind of boring. In the financial district, everything else closes at sundown.

review.title: good location ,comfortable and clean rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location, easy walking to fishermans wharf, chinatown and even union square. Our room was clean and comfortable and the free computer access downstairs came in very handy.The complementary laundry facility an added bonus.We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good hotel in SFO downtown area
review.reviewText: Good small size hotel in downtown area, easy go up to china town, union square and many other good attraction. Only room are small, very NY styles, everything good inside very tidy. people very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel is nicely located, and the rooms are clean. I would go there again.

review.title: Top notch location
review.reviewText: Great hotel, can't beat the price and the location. We walked everywhere from the hotel, loacted near the embarcadaro, so it was just minutes to China Town, North Beach, SOMA, Union Square, Ferry building, the waterfront, etc. Close to all kinds of transit options as well. Rooms are small, but comfortable and clean. Staff was quick to respond to any request. The free internet terminal and the free washer & dryer are a bonus.

review.title: Rooms smaller along European model, but very nice and great location
review.reviewText: Rooms smaller along European model, but very nice and great location. Staff warm and welcoming. Would definitely go back.

review.title: Clean inexpensive in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel fulfilled our expectations. It was well furnished -new-, clean, and included the amenities -even complimentary Internet terminals in the lobby. And it was inexpensive during the weekend. Highly recommended

review.title: Good location to stay in
review.reviewText: After reading the other reviews, we were pleasantly surprised that the room we got was not small. So if you go, request for the corner suite because they have more space. The suite has a living area, dining area with kitchenette(complete with sink, refrig, microwave, plates and utensils), and a sleeping area with a bay window. There are two tvs! If you want/ or need the hotel has a self laundry room for guest in the lower level. There are three computer stations with printer in the lobby free of charge. Location is close to Chinatown and Little Italy.

review.title: Smart, simple, great deal almost every time!
review.reviewText: A favorite, some rooms are small, most are decent size for a couple of days. Not a full service hotel, but has all the amenities you need including a good resturant and bar attached that you can carge back to your room with. Modern, clean free wireless, what more do you want. In the shadow of the Transamerica tower. Great for business.

review.title: small rooms, not intended for vacationing or relaxation
review.reviewText: this hotel is meant for those traveling alone. the rooms are very basic. i would not recommend this hotel for those who are looking for a "vacation hotel"...this is not it. this is meant for those traveling on business.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: What a great location! The room was spotless! We had a blast thanks to all the advice from the staff. We will be back!!!!

review.title: Club Quarters
review.reviewText: For a brief weekend stay, where all you need is a convenient location, and safe place to sleep, the Club Quarters is ideal. It's perfectly located within walking distance to Union Square, Embarcadero Center, and a short cab ride to Fisherman's Wharf if you didn't bring the right shoes. Though a bit small, the room was tidy, well-appointed, and modern. No pool but hey, there are alot of better distractions in the city to enjoy. Hotel staff were polite and professional. I highly recommend this little gem of a hotel and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Hotel - Clean - Quiet - Clode to Cool Stuff
review.reviewText: Only a few block from the ferry terminal building. A must see. Reasonably priced. On the weekend, the Embarcadero(sp) is very quiet. Kinda nice. Only complaint is that they ran out of water on Sunday morning after a big "check-out"

review.title: Good location, small rooms
review.reviewText: This hotel was nice, clean and in a good location. I would recommend it if you are staying in San Fran. However, the rooms are very small, if you have a big family or are planning on spending time in your room this won't be for you.

review.title: I loved this place!
review.reviewText: The hotel and the rooms were extremely clean. It had small rooms, but the bed was very very comfortable. I would definately stay here again. The Elephant and Castle Restaraunt inside the hotel was very good, I ordered room service and it was delivered very quickly. Overall this was a very nice hotel.

review.title: Awesome Location, Clean, Quiet and comfortable!!!
review.reviewText: We hopped on the BART at the airport and it took us within just a few blocks of the hotel. We were very impressed with the hotels allowing us to check in early, with no fee, after an early flight. The room was quite compact, but immaculate and very comfortable! We had plenty of modern conveniences and were able to go online for free to search out activities. The staff was helpful and friendly. The location was fantastic! It is only blocks from Chinatown, and within a comforable 30 min. walk of Union Square, without being in the middle of the noisy, business of the city. We actually walked back from the Fisherman's Wharf (at night) one evening (quickly) as well in about 30 min. and felt very safe in doing so. MUNI transportation is available just a few blocks away as well, for transportation all around the city.

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: I travel all the time for both business and pleasure. This is a terrific utilitarian hotel. It gets the job done. Clean, relatively modern, efficient. Good location.

review.title: Best value in the financial district (but cozy)
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at Club Quarters this past Labor Day weekend. I had some friends meet me at the Elephant and Castle and we enjoyed the service and fine brews available (with authentic brewery glassware!)

review.title: Exactly what I was looking for
review.reviewText: Club Quarters in San Francisco (they have about a dozen other locations nationwide) was clean, comfortable, responsive to my needs, and a joy to stay at. Free wireless internet throughout the hotel with two or three public use terminals in the lounge as well. On-site do it your-self laundry and a small but clean and adequate gym were nice touches. They also offer to deliver a portable step machine to your room for no fee. I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: I thought this was a great deal, as it was nearly half the price of nearby hotels. The service was friendly and efficient, and the room was adequate size for two people. The only thing I thought was odd was that the bathroom door did not conceal the bathroom completely, (it left a small gap). Other than that, I'd definitely go back next time I'm in the area.

review.title: very nice hotel for the money
review.reviewText: Room in stylish, although small. Business services excellent. Restaurant is not good.

review.title: Good Business Hotel
review.reviewText: I've been using this hotel as a base for business and personal trips to SF - great central location. The rooms are not huge, but it is well maintained, clean, modern and has business amenities. Be aware that sound travels a bit in this place - so weekend families and late night meanderings are heard. Try to get a room on the street versus the inner "courtyard" which does not afford any kind of view or substantial light.

review.title: I'll be back
review.reviewText: Extremely clean. Excellent location for my purpose near Embarcadero. As others have said - the rooms are tiny but the weekend rate was worth it. There's a couch in the lobby "living room" that needs to be replaced though...I sunk to the floor practically! LOL Still - great location, clean, and safe area.

review.title: We will stay there again
review.reviewText: Location was perfect for transportation, sites, shops and entertainment. Good parking available just a block away. Hotel employees courteous and helpful. I wonder how often they can provide such perfect August weather? We would highly recommend Club Quarters to all our friends.

review.title: Nice hotel stay
review.reviewText: Good location, comfortable rooms, nice atmosphere. The hotel was environmentally conscious (you can choose that your towels and sheets be washed every other day instead of every day) and the staff was very corteous. Parking is close but expensive- $28.50 a day. A great deal and a great hotel.

review.title: Excellent Value and Location
review.reviewText: We were staying in this hotel at the start and the end of our holiday. We had booked a suite for the first stay and a standard room for the second. When we arrived, there were no suites available for some reason, and the only alternative was a standard room. The staff were not helpful at all in resolving the issue, and simply told us to call their Head Office (who were equally unhelpful). On our second stay, we mentioned at check-in the problems we had had, and they upgraded us straight away to a suite for the remainder of our stay. It therefore pays to speak with someone more senior. The hotel itself is delightful and wihin easy walk of all the main tourist areas - about 5 mins to Chinatown, 10 to Union Square, and 15 to the Wharfs. It is modern and clean throughout and the free Wi-Fi worked very well.

review.title: Great hotel and location - highly recommend
review.reviewText: We were vacationing in SF. The hotel was very well located, clean and the desk staff was extremely solicitous - answering questions and making suggestions. Others have commented that the rooms are small - they are but not uncomfortably so. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others.

review.title: Great Choice in Financial District
review.reviewText: Across from Embarcadero Shopping Center and just blocks from the City Market, this was a nicely appointed hotel with very good service. Parking was 1/2 block away, however garage closes each night at 1:00am. The only down side was that there was not much to do within walking distance after business hours and on weekends. With the exception of the Starbucks on the corner, we had to go elsewhere for restaurants, activities, etc. Since we had a car we did not check for proximity to trolleys, but never saw any circulating near the hotel. Given the overall quality of the hotel and the excellent price, we would still choose to stay there again on our next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: We loved it
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel - very helpful staff and a great location to get around the city! Only complaint: the only parking seemed to be a garage across the street that was $29 a night - ouch.

review.title: Clean, modern, inexpensive, but cramped
review.reviewText: The Club Quarters is clean, modern, and their rates are a great deal for the location (financial district - walking distance to trolleys to Fishermans Wharf etc). However it also excels at efficiency - they seem to have packed as many rooms into the building as physically possible. The bed my wife and I slept on couldn't have been more than a full bed - not even a queen. It's definitely designed with solitary business travelers in mind. Free WiFi was a plus. Good bargain if you can cope with the cramped quarters.

review.title: Great Location for Business
review.reviewText: This is a clean, reasonably priced hotel in the financial district of San Francisco. It is walking distance to work and play (e.g., North Beach, China Town), as well as to the buses, BART, Muni, and the cable car system. The only issue I had was maintaining a connection to the hotel's wireless broadband service. But, hey, it's downtown San Francisco, so that's an easy problem to solve!

review.title: A no frills stay in SF
review.reviewText: This was just what we expected. It is a very clean hotel and very minimalistic. The location is perfect for walking and for local transport. We needed to be close to China town and were able to easily walk there as well as the entire Embarcadero area even down to Fisherman's Warf. Parking was easy. I would stay again. All staff were great and helpful but don't expect any frills and we didn't.

review.title: Excellent location and value
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay in all respects, and the adjoing English pub was a real bonus. Very handy to the BART, the Port attractions and Chinatown.

review.title: Convenient hotel in Commerical district
review.reviewText: Feel good - I stayed 6 days in this hotel and felt very safe and converience to travel between hotel and office. It is walkable distance and located in centre point of commerical district. All staff is nice and friendly. Need improvement - No mailing service provided and the light seems not enough when using laptop for working in hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Nice location, safe area. The room was very clean but small, very small. If you are there to just sleep and not to spend much time in the room it's a great place. I thought the bed was comfortable compared to most places. I would stay there again.

review.title: Not for families
review.reviewText: The rooms are TINY - even by SF standards. There are no king size beds, only doubles. Since the rooms are easily half of a normal hotel room -- dont even think about having kids in the same room. All that being said, this is a GREAT single business persons hotel. Very clean, good staff, great biz location, free wireless.

review.title: Compact but comfy
review.reviewText: This is a terrific location in SanFrancisco, right next to the TransAmerica building and a block or so away from Union Square. The hotel is modern with high tech check-in, Starbucks next door and very nice service-oriented help. The rooms are small but well-designed with functional desks and comfortable beds. No frills but if you like clean, comfortable and safe, this is the place for you.

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the location. Easy walk to many of the usual tourist type places. Nice clean hotel. Will definitely go there again if in town.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: You'll want to get out and see the city, so you won't notice the tiny dorm-like rooms or paper-thin walls. The price is good and the comfort and convenience is adequate. If you just need a place to sleep, it's a great hotel.

review.title: Convenience & Comfort
review.reviewText: I must say I wasn't sure about the hotel because I booked online. I was however quite surprised. This is a nice, clean, friendly hotel. It is conviently located across from the Embarcadero Center and minutes away from the Embarcadero Pier. There are lots of restaurants in the are and its a short walk to Union Square and the Financial District. Muni and Bart are also a few blocks away. I would stay at this hotel again because of its great location, friendly staff and comfort.

review.title: Would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: good location, great service, very good facilities

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Grate location at a good value.

review.title: San Francisco Excellence
review.reviewText: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in the heart of the city's financial district and close to many of San Francisco's best sites. The service was excellent and the room well appointed and comfortable. At night when it was time to retire the area surrounding the hotel was quiet because of it's location in the financial district. We were able to walk to many attractions and a couple of blocks away from the BART and Muni public transportation stations. We plan to make this hotel our regular spot when visiting the great city of San Francisco. 5 stars!!!!

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to SF. Loved the hotel - and it was centrally located to major attractions of SF. Great value for your money.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Club Quarters is out of the ordinary. Not your ordinary hotel room. With modern decor and aesthetics, it stands out. Location is prime and from Saturday evening through Monday early mornings, you can find ample parking on the streets. Just look out for the street cleaning restrictions...

review.title: Great value.
review.reviewText: Clean and next to the Embarcadero and a few blocks to the Ferry Building. Check-in was very easy, room was simple but clean; the Hi-speed internet seemed slower than I expected;they have a number of amenities/services-free cofffee& papers that I would like to take more advantage of next time

review.title: The Club Quarters Hotels concept is very appealing and I have applied for membership in the program.
review.reviewText: Quaint Hotel, recently remodeled in a tasteful, contemporary fashion. Excellent business amenities in a great Financial District / Embarcadero (Ferry Building) location. Easy walk to Cable Cars and all public transportation.

review.title: Ok for business travel
review.reviewText: well located-good price

review.title: San Francisco best location
review.reviewText: The best location, secure and comfortable, hotel bar is ecxellent.

review.title: Good price for the location
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Club Quarters hotel in San Francisco. The positives are: The location is excellent, In a good neighborhood right across from the embarcadero. Bart is only a short walk away. Room was big and clean. Bathroom has a walk-in shower and a huge vanity mirror. Air conditioning has thermostat and is great to use. Affordable, a lot cheaper than most hotels in the financial district. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Free internet downstairs in the guest area. Staff will hold luggage for you if you have finished your stay but want to walk around athe city after checking out. The negatives. Walls are pretty thin, you can pretty much hear people talking in the next room. TV is really small. Room service menu is way overpriced. Overall the Club Quarters is an affordable, good quality hotel that is great for a short stay but if you are planning on spending a lot of time in your hotel room there are better, albeit pricier options in the area.

review.title: Good Location, Clean
review.reviewText: Good Location, within walking distance to the wharves. Shopping center right across the street, with many resturantes and stores. Starbucks and food/drink bar right downstairs. Room was small, but very clean, hotel looked very well kept! Would definatly stay again.

review.title: Good bargain
review.reviewText: Club Quarters is nice hotel that is fairly conveniently located in the Market/Financial district. Pretty easy walk to MUNI stops to go anywhere and within walking distance of Chinatown, shopping, and theatre. My only complaint is in the design of the room and the air conditioning. We could never seem to get the room as cold as we wanted it, and the TV was not located in front of the bed and it was difficult to see comfortably. Otherwise, CQ was a nice, clean hotel that is a good bargain for a short vacation stay.

review.title: Great location, good hotel
review.reviewText: The location was the best part of this hotel. Only a few blocks to the Ferry Building, and also only a few blocks to Chinatown. Cable cars two blocks away, and the street cars too. The hotel itself was clean, and I liked the decor very much. Staff were helpful, and were able to answer all the questions I could think to throw at them! I was a little confused initially about the parking, but it was cheaper than for most hotels, though it wasn't actually in the hotel. I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Except for the lack of parking, this hotel was an exceptional value.

review.title: Club Quarters is great!
review.reviewText: Small room but in great condition with excellent furnishings and in a great location.

review.title: Great option for staying San Francisco
review.reviewText: Convienent location and very reasonably priced

review.title: Clean, Simple, Inexpensive, Just-Right
review.reviewText: This hotel was a good place to spend our 6th anniversary. Close enough to walk or take the Muni almost anywhere. Interior seemed very new, but was a little small. I would recommend, and stay there again.

review.title: Nice surprise
review.reviewText: Wonderful, good service

review.title: Very pleasant hotel
review.reviewText: Club Quarters was a great value. My room was very clean and comfortable, but smaller than most other hotels. It was close to the Ferry Bldg (my favorite SF spot to visit) and the restaurants in North Beath were close by. If shopping is very important to you, you might want a hotel closer to Union Square. When I got back to SF, I'll stay at CQ again.

review.title: Very impressed.
review.reviewText: The location was perfect, only blocks from the Ferry Building. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms are small but very well appointed. Excellent use of space, very clean and the bed was very comfortable with soft sheets and comforter. Don't miss the sundeck at dusk for a beautiful view of the City!

review.title: great value for the money
review.reviewText: super business traveler hotel - close to financial district. Restaurants are not as close as some other higher priced properties.

review.title: A Pleasant Surprise
review.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located close to restaurants and public transport. The hotel's location is across from the Embarcadero Center and a short walk to the Ferry Building.

review.title: Very pleased--would stay again
review.reviewText: Fairly priced, very clean and comfortable. Some rooms on the small side, but mine was plenty roomy and comfortable. Within walking distance of cable cars, shopping, good restaurants, etc.

review.title: Clean, modern, tiny room!
review.reviewText: Nice location, just a few blocks from BART, and an easy walk to all sorts of SF locations (North Beach, Embarcadero, Market St, Union Square, etc.). Very clean, very modern, but the rooms were very small - almost like NYC or Europe. TV was kinda small, too. Loved the shower, though - it was plenty roomy.

review.title: Classy, clean and convenient
review.reviewText: Other reviews I read before making the reservation mentioned that rooms were somewhat small but size was adequate for amount of time we spent in it. Staff was courteous and helpful, hotel was very clean throughout, nice lounge area, and location was convenient to many places we needed/wanted to be. Our room near end of a hall was also very quiet, a plus for weary travellers, and the room card system for elevator use was a nice security feature. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Club Quarters
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the perfect location for a vacation in San Francisco. Almost everything is in walking distance. Being in the financial district, puts you right in the middleb of the bustle of San Francisco. The hotel seems to be geared more towards the business traveler that just needs a bed, desk and bathroom. If you want more luxury, try somewhere else, but if you want convenience to everything, by all means stay here. The hotel staff was the best...

review.title: Good room, good location, Parking is $28.50 /day
review.reviewText: Got the 2nd level up room. great bed, nice desk.fridge/microwave/coffee pot. room decent size. very nice bathroom. Parking is in the emarcadero center - very expensive. $2.75 every 15 minutes or $28.50 max/day. very easy check-in/out. (automated)

review.title: my review
review.reviewText: I like the hotel's interior look but did not like the small rooms and lack of rooms with street view.

review.title: Pretty nice for the price.
review.reviewText: Room was small but had everything you needed, free wireless internet was a plus. Room and Hotel were Very clean. Staff was very accomidating, and polite. Check in was a little strange, you put your credit card in a machine and it spit out your key with a receipt even though I prepaid on the internet. The hotel was located in a nice part of San Fran and very close to stores and the Bay.

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Excellentlocation--close to Chinatown and North Beach; friendly and helpful staff. Attached restaurant served good food.

review.title: Probably better for vacation traveler
review.reviewText: I found the hotel satisfactory in all respects except business services. The in-room wi-fi service was extremely poor. The speakerphone in my room did not work, and when I needed to make a few copies the system was down.

review.title: good clean small hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel room was very clean but a bit on the small size. Room sizes do vary, corner rooms are smaller. Hotel does have thin walls but relatively quite on the weekends. Rooms not facing the street are quite r than the ones facing the streets. Overall, the room was very clean and nice with very comfortable bed. If yo don't plan to stay in the room too often aside from sleep this is a good hotel that is in a good location. I would stay here again.

review.title: Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: This was a good location for China Town, North Beach and Embarcadaro, though we walked all the way to Fisherman's Warf, Girardelli Sq, and Union Square from our hotel. Our first night we went to a restaurant around the corner for fish and chips....very good, Harringtons. On the weekends this part of town is more quite because it is the business district, which was nice. If you walk straight up the street towards Pier 1 there is a Farmers Market on Sundays from 10-2....the best place to go for breakfast and lunch.

review.title: Good deal, good location
review.reviewText: Smaller, but definitely comfortable room. Perfect for solo or business travel, wouldn't recommend for family travel. Great access to Financial District and easy walk to North Beach for restuarants/night life. Castle and Elephant convenient next door, although food is average at best. Better to walk to North Beach. .

review.title: Great for business travellers
review.reviewText: Excellent alternative for the conference hotel, already overbooked and pricier. Good walking distance to my favorite bookstore (City Lights)--it was a literature conference! and easy walking to the Embarcadero. Everyone at the hotel was helpful but also no-nonsense, not overly solicitous. I've already recommended this hotel to others for business travel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very impressed with hotel cleanliness and service.

review.title: Superb
review.reviewText: Will make it my regular place to stay!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: I definitely recommend this hotel. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is so close to "little italy". The rooms are clean, staff are friendly. I enjoyed my stay in this place. Enjoy the big, delicious, red apple served in the lobby :)

review.title: Good Hotel for Business Travel
review.reviewText: A good hotel to stay at if you don't need all of the bells and whistles. Clean rooms, comfortable beds and helpful staff. Located within walking distance of BART and MUNI and near North Beach and Chinatown. For business travellers, a super deal.

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText: I have to say that I enjoyed my stay at Club Quarters. It is conveniently located near everything and in a safe neighborhood. The hotel is very well maintained and the staff is very curteous and helpful. It was a very small room but quaint for the overnight business traveler. I will definitely be back for another stay.

review.title: Worth while for short trip in SF
review.reviewText: If you're staying late at work and have to get a room for the night, Club Quarters is the place to go. Located in the Financial District, you are seconds away from Chinatown and North Beach. Rooms are tiny and positioned like cabins on a ship, but they are kept up and are clean and comfortable. For the price, you can't beat it.

review.title: Convenient and satisfactory
review.reviewText: Conveniently located next to Transamerica Tower so you can always find your way back! Business-style hotel, comfortable enough. Rather thin walls. Efficient desk service.

review.title: Great location, slim on room size and amenities
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in an easily accessible location close to the BART station and China Town. The hotel rooms are pretty small and there seems to be less amenities with the room like extra towels etc. I would not stay here again given I was in town to vacation, but would stay here on business.

review.title: Very Professional and Modern .. Definately a businessman's paradise!
review.reviewText: I was impressed with the decor, professional setting, internet access, etc. The room was very nice and the Hotel staff was very accomodating. I have stayed there before and I needed another room . . they were happy to make provisions and give us adjoining rooms. Even the smoking rooms are very clean. I would highly reccommend this Hotel!

review.title: Great hotel for budget travelers
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to main tourist points. It's clean, comfortable, safe.

review.title: Clean, comfortable and affordable!
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent four nights here and were very impressed with this hotel. Yes, the rooms may be a bit on the small side, but we didn't come to San Francisco to spend our time in a hotel! The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and the shower was very nice. You're about a mile away from most major attractions, but only a few blocks away from BART and the cable cars. If you enjoy walking then you'll have no problems. For a single person or a couple planning on spending a few days in San Fran, this hotel is ideal!

review.title: Perfect for travellers on a middle class budget
review.reviewText: Due to all the complaints about how small the hotel room and hallways were, I was worried that I might be walking into something from Alice in Wonderland. Really... its not that big of a deal. It's San Fran, unless you want to blow all of your money on a hotel that has all the luxeries you wont have time to need anyway, this hotel is perfect. The location is ideal and most things are in walking distance as long as you dont mind a little excercize. And even if you do mind a little walking, there is a bart and a muni stop less then 2 minutes away. We did spend a lot of money on cabs however because if you are just in town a couple of days getting to know the public transportation system is kind of a pain and cabs are just quicker. Plus things like the Palace of Fine Arts and The Wharf are just a little bit beyond a walkers comfort. The room itself was pleasantly comfortable. It is small and is not quite hotel feeling, but the refrigerator and microwave are a nice touch and everything was clean and well maintained. My friend and I stayed for a week and had no issues. The staff was friendly and the closests in the hallways with all needed toiletries came in handy. The lounge in the foyer is also really comfortable and has computers with printers. All in all, Club Quarters was perfect for two people travelling on a realistic budget and wanting to explore San Fran without be to far out or paying the bloated prices for something right downtown.

review.title: Affordble Business Hotel in the Heart of the Financial District
review.reviewText: Hotel is Clean, Clean, Clean. Automated check in can be a small hassle in that Expedia guests, default to a desk check-in. The Hotel caters to mostly business travelers, hence it is quiet, It is not a good hotel for for small children or families in that the rooms are small and it does not have amenities for children.

review.title: clean but too small
review.reviewText: This hotel is really clean, but its bed is too small. Its bed is really really a twin bed. If you prefer staying in a clean place to a spacy place, I would recommand this hotel. Another pitfall of this hotel is parking lot. There's no parking spot in this hotel. If you use public parking lot near this hotel, you should pay for $30 per night.

review.title: great weekend bargain in sf
review.reviewText: this hotel was a great find. Inexpensive weekend rates, close to chinatown and cable car lines. But note that it is in the financial district, so the weekends are a bit on the quite side.

review.title: Pretty good overall
review.reviewText: Clean, nice,..

review.title: clean & convenient
review.reviewText: Room small but acceptable. Wireless internet erratic, but wired version was quick, efficient, and painless. Very convenient location at a reasonable price.

review.title: Great for business
review.reviewText: Not really meant for families, but convient location to everything.

review.title: European feel
review.reviewText: Location is good not great, rooms are small, makes me feel like i'm in europe, parking is terrible, mall is a ghost town on the weekend.

review.title: Good place to stay if you won't be in the room much
review.reviewText: The Club Quarters is a very nice hotel. Everything was in really good shape. The room was really comfortable, although not too big. The room was ideal for business travel - multiple phones, including a wireless set and speaker phone; good internet connection; business center in lobby; laptop desk. I don't know if you would want to use the room I had as a base for a vacation since there isn't much extra room or chairs. I didn't take advantage of some of the amenities like health club or roof top deck, but they are available. The location was also really good. I walked everywhere I needed to go (Nob Hill, Moscone Center, Union Square, financial district). China Town is also very close. If you don't need to be in the room much or a small room won't bother you, I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great for Financial District
review.reviewText: Modern and with great security. Very pleasant lounge-lobby. Adjacent Elephant & Castle restaurant convenient with option for room service. Very convenient for walking to Financial District offices; not far from Union Square - all without climbing hills. The main negative: Decor was very masculine and stark. Recommend requesting a room not with an adjacent connecting room due to noise. Good room rates; Microwave and ref. in room, but didn't use them.

review.title: Clean and practical
review.reviewText: This isn't a luxury hotel, it's a clean, comfortable, well-located room to sleep and shower in. I wouldn't travel to San Francisco to hang out in my hotel room, so for me this was perfect. Some people will find the rooms to be small, I thought they were well-organized and efficient. The beds were comfortable and covered with good-quality sheets. The staff was very friendly and quick to respond to requests. The housekeeping staff gave thorough, daily attention to each room. I would definately stay there again. My only exception to Club Quarters is that ventilation is not as good as I would have liked, but I tend to be picky in this regard.

review.title: great value good location
review.reviewText: this hotel is in a great location, across from a shopping centre, a few blocks from the BART station. the rooms are clean and well maintained, they cater to the business professional with free internet access, lounge coffee bar, fitness centre etc. would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: Very good experience overall. Hotel is close to Chinatown and North Beach as well as cable cars. The rooms are about 1/2 the size of an average room. Great hotel if you don't plan to spend much time in your room. Service was great, room was cleam and great location.

review.title: Great location and perfect for a no-frills business room
review.reviewText: This hotel was in great condition, the service was prompt and friendly, there is wireless in the rooms, and it is a reasonable price. It is in a great location for those interested in things downtown, chinatown, or general access to transportation. Would highly recommend this to others for either business or leisure and enjoyed my first stay with Club Quarters - will definitely stay with them again.

review.title: Great option
review.reviewText: It's an excellent choice, very modern decoration and excellent location, close to the Ferry Building, China Town and the financial district.

review.title: Very convenient for business travel
review.reviewText: I found the hotel to be very clean, stylish, and conveniently located for my short business trip. The staff was extremely helpful. The room and bathroom were small, as is the case with other Club Quarters hotels where I have stayed. However, if you know that going in, you won't be disappointed.

review.title: Great SF business hotel and location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel-great value-fantastic location in the financial district. Room itself was nice if you can weave through the long hallways-mine viewed into brick building next door but I just slept there. Small fitness room but adequate. Parking is ridiculus but that's San Francisco. All in all I'll go back for sure!!

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: double beds = twin beds. although it was very small and kinda looked like a dorm room, hotel was nice and in a good location.

review.title: Good enough to consider a return visit.
review.reviewText: While some people would consider the rooms small then most other hotels it satisfied my requirements and I was quite pleased with it. The location was close to most attractions and right smack in the middle of the financial district if you need to be there for business. I was also pleased that several computers were available in addition to wireless service provided in all rooms. I will definitely consider a return trip the next time I make a trip to San Fransisco.

review.title: Excellent value and location
review.reviewText: This is a very European place that is clean and with friendly staff. The non-suite rooms were well designed with a desk, chair and bed off to the side. This allowed us to stretch and excercise in the room without bumping into each other. The location is great with the Ferry building just a short walk away. The value is excellent as well. Definitely recommend this place. It made my wife's birtday weekend a blast.

review.title: Clean, Great Location
review.reviewText: Easy Check in - Check out. Clean rooms. Asa frequent traveler this hotel has always had impeccable rooms.

review.title: Chic Value
review.reviewText: Very nice room, well maintained, modern chic decor, accomodating staff, a very good nice hotel room at a nice value.

review.title: Will stay again next time
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for a short, fun trip. The shower was wonderful and the bed was very comfortable as well. I would definitely stay here again and I am already planning my next trip!

review.title: best hotel close to Embarcadero centre
review.reviewText: very clean but small room. all basic utilites included. has self-service washing and drying machine on the basement floor. very close to embarcadero centre. 3 blocks from Bart train station. 3 blocks from Chinatown.

review.title: fine place
review.reviewText: the room was on the small side, but perfectly nice. I was very pleased.

review.title: Perfect for one person
review.reviewText: Safe, easy downtown access through the Embarcadero buildings - fine for walking alone at night. Comfortable rooms - great for one person, maybe tight for two. Very clean, modern, excellent pillows. Free internet and computers in lobby - cheap local restaurant delivery to room. I would stay again anytime I need to be near downtown.

review.title: Nice hotel in good location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The only "complaint" (and it really isn't one) that we had was that, even though there were two of us in the room, we only received one wash cloth each day. Also, we asked if we could have a vase for some flowers we purchased, but even though they said they'd check (at the front desk), we never heard back from them. On the "good" side, the staff was very friendly, the room was nice and clean, there are lots of amenities for business travelers, and the proximity to the Embarcadero was very convenient. The hotel accommodated our request for early check-in and a refrigerator, as well. The pub next door was great, too! So the things with the vase and the wash cloth were not big deal.

review.title: Clean and Simple in a Great Business Location
review.reviewText: Fine place to stay if your mostly in the hotel to sleep.

review.title: I'll be back
review.reviewText: Very quiet and understated. The staff was very helpful...they took care of any request immediately.

review.title: It was a mediocre hotel
review.reviewText: I was a little upset that most of their workout equipment was broken. The design of the hotel was unusual. I had to walk in a maze to get to room

review.title: Good value, great accomodations
review.reviewText: Excellent room, clean and well maintained. Close to shopping, restaurants and the embargadero street car lines. Staff was attanetive and helpful.I have traveled a lot to San Francisco this is one of my preferred places, you pay more for the same quality at the big name places

review.title: Mixed Reviews
review.reviewText: My first stay was in a Deluxe Room and I did not understand the reviews that said the rooms were small. My second stay was in a Standard room and it was disappointingly small. On my second stay I was charged $55 for a seven minute call to a toll free number in the UK to report my credit card stolen. This hotel has lost its charm for me and I will not be returning. The reception was pleasant and a good place to check out emails.

review.title: Good location - if you want to avoid the Wharf..and you do!
review.reviewText: Dont even think about staying near the Wharf & the hordes - this is a better location for shopping, dining & dancing. Round the corner from China Town & easy orientation/transport to most areas of the city. Very efficient, friendly check in. Rooms nothing fancy but practical & a decent size, bed plenty big enough - how big are these other guests!? Rooms clean and cleaned daily. Crisp white linen & towels. Would recommend to other travellers

review.title: Nice and Cheap
review.reviewText: Room is your basics. The mattress is bad though. I had back problems after staying for 3 nights. But the area and the cost make up for the difference

review.title: Bed's Too Small With You
review.reviewText: Very interesting economy of space. Small beds - too small for two and not that comfortable. Good location though - near the Embarcadaro/financial district. Probably would not stay again as bed not comfy.

review.title: would stay there again if i went back to san francisco
review.reviewText: hotel was very clean was close to all the places i wanted to go or had easy access to the bart and i loved the elephant & castle bar and grill next door!!!!! all in all great hotel

review.title: Comfortable, Clean and Friendly.
review.reviewText: My wife and I have stayed here twice, and have had an excellent experience both times. The rooms are clean, comfortable and the staff is very helpful.

review.title: Clean Hotel in Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a nice area. It is a short walk from the Ferry Building and/or the Embarcadero. I took advantage of the BART stop that is only a few blocks from the hotel and limited my taxi cab expenses. The rooms are small but clean. Overall, a good value.

review.title: Definitely Would Go Back
review.reviewText: Other than the rooms being somewhat small, we were very satisfied. There's a nice lounge area with a connecting bar and grill also serving breakfeast in the morning. Taking into consideration the nightly rates, this hotel rating should be a 5.

review.title: Club quarters
review.reviewText: The room was very small and the maid did not bring clean towels but must have expected the quests to use the towels more than once. The front desk also did not have much advice or information on where to go and what to visit while in the city. Overall it was not bad but i have had much better experiences at comparable hotels.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: I was satisfied with this stay. The rooms are nicely kept and very clean. It's close to Chinatown and right next to Embarcadero shopping center. I would stay there again.

review.title: Good choice in the Financial District
review.reviewText: Excellent value in the high-priced S.F. market. Close to Chinatown as well.

review.title: Small but nice
review.reviewText: Rooms were small but had all the amenities, including free high speed internet. They also offered to a treadmill / stair stepper to be brought to your room, although I used the workout facility. Staff was friendly.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Charming older hotel. Enjoyed "wine hour" but room was a little small and stuffy.

review.title: great
review.reviewText: professional and courteous

review.title: Can't beat it for the price
review.reviewText: Very nice quality for the price and in a good location. Recommended. Only complaint is with restaurant associated w. hotel. Food was not good; would avoid.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful. The location has good access to public transportation and the touristy areas. The only downside was that the free wireless internet service only worked about half the time.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Club Quarters far exceeded my expectations. The staff was more than helpful and was there for everything I needed. I recommend this hotel without any hesitation. And the sundeck...beautiful view!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is definitely geared toward the business traveller. The rooms are a little smaller than your standard hotel room but no less comfortable. The staff was very courteous and I appreciated the cleanliness of the rooms. If you're a tourist, the hotel is only two blocks from the California cable car and four blocks from Market Street and the F Line. The only downside is that since the hotel is located in the central business district, it may be difficult to find restaurants open on the weekend aside from ones located in other nearby hotels.

review.title: Very Nice - Great Price
review.reviewText: The Club Quarters was very convenient to meetings at another more expensive hotel in the Embarcadero. Room was a bit small with no seating area, other than a desk and chair. Bathroom had a shower stall instead of a tub/shower, which I liked. The 11th floor terrace was a nice place for an evening glass of wine. I would go back.

review.title: Excellent hotel for the price
review.reviewText: I thought the hotel was a good deal. Yes rooms are small and geared towards the business traveler. My room had plenty of space for two people and was nicely maintained. The front desk staff was helpful. It is located by lots of shopping and near the streetcars and Muni.

review.title: Great find in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Club Quarters is a great hotel... clean, close to everything and not expensive. I would definitely stay here again...

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: convenient to financial district and Chinatown --- hard to get cabs on weekends

review.title: Unexpected surprise
review.reviewText: Having never stayed at Club Quarters, I was concerned about the quality of service and the actual accomodations available. Pleasantly surprised, the room was warmly decorated, clean , and spacious. Hotel staff was courteous and friendly. The workout facility and Internet access are a must have with my stay, and I found both easily accessible and accommodating. I look forward to future stays in various Club Quarters locations.

review.title: Totally disappointed
review.reviewText: 1. There is a strong smell of tobacco in the non-smoking room. 2. Size of the room is hardly enough to fit the amount of air for normal breathing. Extremely small room! 3. There is no such useful thing in the room like "Do Not Disturb" sign. 4. Housekeeping service is completely annoying. 5. Pretty noisy. Isolation is not good enough.

review.title: Weekend Wonder!
review.reviewText: Great value for my Sat/Sun nite stay in S.F. Take bart from SFO to Embarcadero for about $5. Leave the car at home! Really comfortable bed & pillows. Rooms are a bit small, but fine for 1 person. Great shower! A little street noise, some from hall and other rooms. Check your email on one of 3 computers in the lobby. Security is good. Adjoining pub had good food/drinks. Location is tops - walk to Ferry Bldg, Justin Hermann Plaza, Embarcadero Center, cable car/muni/streetcar stops, even Pier 39 if you're a walker!

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: I found the Club Quarters to be an exceptional value for the money. I was a bit hesitant to make my reservation here given that most decent hotels in the area charge nearly double the rate. To my surprise the hotel offered stylishly modern rooms and a very courteous front desk service. I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Quarter of a Room!!
review.reviewText: The room was very small and cramped with unimpressive decor. Service was good, and the rooms were clean and new, but overall, I was extremely dissapointed with this hotel. On the upside, it is located in the financial district, only a few blocks from Chinatown and within walking distance from the water.

review.title: Very enjoyable stay...Yes I will stay there again!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and quite, 3 computers in the lobby with free internet service, free laundry, good resturant and bar adjoining lobby, very accomidating and friendly staff. Very good part of town, close to good shopping and the farmers market and ferry service. Walking distance to China town, Fisherman wharf, and a lot of very interesting places. We had no bad suprises, beyond our expections for the price we paid.

review.title: Clean hotel with horrible service
review.reviewText: When we stayed in San Fran, this was a clean hotel in a great location. However, the horrible service overshadowed any benefits and ensured we will never stay there again.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel stay.
review.reviewText: My husband and I booked a stay overnight to avoid traveling home after a business cruise at Pier 9. I was very pleased with the room. Just big enough for a couple to enjoy. The room was very clean and the decor is up to date. Starbucks was right next door. Including another full resturant and bar. I will definetly use this hotel again.

review.title: quite good
review.reviewText: good service; convenient as it is very close to china town. but the noise separation is not good. you can hear the tv sounds in your neibough room.

review.title: Pretty good for the price
review.reviewText: For San Francisco Financial District, the price is reasonable. Rooms are small, but efficient. Many are on the outside of the building, i.e., subject to a lot of street noise. Adjacent restaurant is OK, not great, but others are within reasonable walking distance. Staff is professional and pleasant, but this hotel is largely self-serve from electronic check-in kiosks to card-controlled elevators.

review.title: Small but fantastic
review.reviewText: This hotel is small but definitley worth it. It's well located near the ferry building which has great food but also ideal if you are thinking about hopping over to Sausalito. It's blocks away from most major public trans. The streets are nice and quiet so you're not awaken by noisey traffic. The only complaint is the noise of people in the halls.

review.title: extremely satisfied !!
review.reviewText: Great location (very close to china town, fisherman's wharf and union square), very clean and in great condition, extremely comfortable, and the service is exceptional ! they even have computers available in the lounge for internet use! the room may be smaller than most hotel rooms, but for the price, and the cleanliness, it's a great value for your money! parking may be a problem, but you can always buy a city passport, and take the bus, or the trolley or the cable cars ! it's a fun way to explore the city !

review.title: Vacationing at a Business Hotel
review.reviewText: My fiance and I were very satisfied with our stay on our first trip together to San Francisco. Even though the hotel is in the Financial District we were still in a good location for reaching the tourist destinations. We were not too far from a BART stop (great to-from the airport), the trolley, or bus stops, plus it's an easy (though somewhat up-hill) walk to Chinatown. The hotel service was good and check-in-and-out was really simple. Room was a little small, but perfect for a visiting couple (had an adjoining door too). As a bonus, it is right next to the Transamerica Building, so you always have the perfect landmark.

review.title: Very clean room.
review.reviewText: Very clean room. Just a little small but great for business travler. Internet access, close to everything. Would stay again.

review.title: Clean, comfortable, affordable, but weak WIFI
review.reviewText: Like the title suggests, the hotel rate was a bargain, and the room was clean and comfortable. However, I was extremely disappointed by the complimentary wireless internet connection. It was weak in signal strength and extremely unreliable.

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and close to everything. Nice staff.

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: Great price and overall experience was good.

review.title: Home away from home for eight days.
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The Embarcadaro center with shopping, health clubs, restaurants, and a movie theatre is diagonlly right across the street. It is a short walk to the Embarcadaro, North Beach, and China Town. The rooms are small but confortable. Great for one person. It has one of the few hotel lobbys where I actually felt like hanging out to read the paper, surf the internet, watch television, and talk to other guests. And there is an Elephant and Castle pub and restaurant just off the lobby.

review.title: Downtown Convenience!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very helpful in directing us toward our destination(s) etc. Unfortunately, a specific request for additional pillows was ignored, giving us the impression of less comfort than would have been possible & a lapse in customer service. Overall, the hotel's convenient location in downtown & the concierge's advice resulted in a generally ideal stay during one of San Fran's busiest weekends. We would recommend Club Quarters to all people looking for convenience, satisfactory ambience and much appreciated helpfulness (in terms of "tourist advice/tips")

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Guys there are really helpful and the hotel is really clean which make my stay there very comfort.

review.title: Great place to stay if you don't mind a small room
review.reviewText: The Club Quarters is a great place to stay if you don't mind a small room. The hotel is very nice with everything you need, in a great location downtown.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Very handy having the English Pub next door as during the weekend a lot of restaurants in the financal district closed. Staff very helpful ordering cabs and directing us.

review.title: Will Stay Again
review.reviewText: Yes the rooms are small, but comfortable and clean. I like the security of the building. Plus Clean.

review.title: I will be back
review.reviewText: This is avery small but quaint hotel. It is near everything and I found tyhe service to be of excellence.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great Location. Appreciated parking garage on Embarcadero was convenient and less costly than most hotel parking.

review.title: Nice hotel for business travelers
review.reviewText: Club Sport is perfect for business travelers who enjoy a comfortable and quiet place for the night. While located in downtown S.F., it is blocks away from much of the noise and in a safe part of town. Nice touches include free internet, several reference books and reading material in every room.

review.title: Perfect for business travel
review.reviewText: In my view, this hotel gets it exactly right. Clean, comfortable, helpful staff, nice workout room, and an absolutely fantastic location in the heart of San Francisco. The room was small, but to me, that's irrelevant -- when traveling on business by oneself, how much space do you need? My only quibble is that the entry process is a bit confusing if you arrive by car -- there was no doorman, and it was not clear that I was supposed to leave my vehicle at the curb, check in, then drive around the corner to a garage. But now YOU know, so that problem is solved for you!

review.title: Rooms are small, but "new' and well kept.  Staff is friendly.
review.reviewText: Restaurant in hotel is good too.  Free on line service to check your email.  Superior security; you need a room key to use the elevator.

review.title: Amazingly good beds
review.reviewText: Along with a perfect location near Embarcadero Center and financial district, North Beach, and Chinatown, this hotel has the best beds my girlfriend and I have ever slept in. We love this place!!

review.title: Clean, updated, modern, centrally-located hotel
review.reviewText: Though the rooms were rather small, they were extremely comfortable, clean, and modern.  Apparently there had been a recent renovation, for the carpet smelled new and the furnishings appeared almost brand new.  The location was wonderful for access to all the touristy sites.  We highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: I am planning a weekend trip with my husband.
review.reviewText: The Hotel was wonderful with everything!  It was very cozy and a comfortable place to stay.  Location was perfect.

review.title: Great Value for the price
review.reviewText: Stayed for leisure.  Excellent value.  Very clean & comfortable.  Excellent location.  Geographically located in the in the middle of heart of the Financial District.  It's also walking distance to Chinatown, Union Square, Northbeah, and only minutes away by cab from Pacbell Park, Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirideli Square, and the Marina.  The only negative that I can think of, is that they do not have their own parking lot, if you have a car.

review.title: Simple and No Frills
review.reviewText: For the the location and the friendliness of the staff, you can't be it for doing work in the Financial District or Embarcadero.  Rooms aren't big but how much time do you really spend in your room if out with clients or in the office?  Stand-up shower only a surprise (no tub) but a good value for $$$ - clean and safe.

review.title: Simple but meets expectations
review.reviewText: Small rooms but comfortable, clean and friendly service.  Good value and great location across from Embarcadero.  Would definitely return.

review.title: would like to see club quarters in cities where available
review.reviewText:
particularly well-laid out rooms for comfort and efficiency.  work area, services and ammenities are among the best ... reasonable rates and exceptional location make it a "good buy"

thank you for serving as broker

review.title: Convenient to Union Square, Chinatown, and Lil' Italy
review.reviewText: Rooms are not large, but clean and the price is great. If you are going to convene in your hotel room for extended periods while on vacation, the rooms may be too small, but if you are like me, the room is pretty much a place to sleep, bathe and store luggage. Staff was very nice. A nice walk to many areas of interest.

review.title: centrally located
review.reviewText:
they had hot water problems, but that could be an isolated incident. rooms are small, fine for a single person would be too small for a couple.
computer access, nice living room down stairs with pc and papers and tv.
fine for business. no tourist info.

review.title: Club Quarters-not bad!
review.reviewText: I had heard mixed reviews on this hotel, but was pleasantly surprised. Check-in was quick and easy- the hotel was beautiful and very clean. The rooms were adequate with large bathrooms, and came inclusive with desk, refridgerator, etc. The only thing I would say is that walls are thin and you can hear just about everything from the other rooms... so if you are trying to get a good night's sleep, you may be kept up or woken up early!

review.title: Great for the business traveler
review.reviewText: This hotel was secure and comfortable.  While the room was small, it had a great desk, wireless internet, a fridge and microwave.  They also offer room service from 5 different restaurants.  It is great to have a choice when you have had a long day and don't want to go out.

review.title: Cramped Quarters
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean, but the rooms are very small.  The fan near the window was inches away and blew on my head all night.  As a result, I developed a terrible head cold. To see the TV from the bed (which is the only place it can be watched from) you have to turn you head sideways.  The rooms size is similar to a standard cabin on a cruise ship.
